title: Just Bad
text: The first impression of The Meg 2: The Trench (2023) is that this was hard to watch. There were dumbfounded scenes that did not make any sense led by decision making. The kills were not that good especially since it is a PG-13 movie. The only parts that I liked are Jason Statham and his great acting and the antagonists getting killed off. Other than that, I was ready to leave the theater. It really questioned me on how does the protagonists keep on surviving after questionable events. I honestly liked the first one better because it was not that bad of a shark movie. The sequel, however, just made it worse. I am surprised that this film was allowed to make it in Dolby Cinema since it only allows good or great movies in the auditorium. Overall, The Meg 2: The Trench is pretty bad with its scenes and kills. I would recommend to stay away from this movie.

title: DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND WATCH PAINT DRY INSTEAD
text: Don't believe these fake reviews by probably paid, semi-professional writers who say the movie is good. This movie was one big bore with no thought at all put into it. It's just a quick cash grab rebounding off the first one. You'll have more entertainment watching paint dry. I myself have more enjoyment spoon feeding my disabled, hunchbacked cousin pudding. The shark in Sharknado looks more realistic than this creation made by some CGI intern at the local community college. No cares about quality content anymore and it's sad for the avid film goer...This is an unbiased review from a real person who loves movies.

title: The Only Good Thing Is Jason Statham
text: I wanted to like this, I really did, it has everything, giant creature, Statham, shark, but this is just so boring.The problem is, it hits every clich√©. Annoying kid, paint by the number villain, a predictable plot. Unlikable characters who all behave like cartoon characters.I liked the first movie and was looking forward to the sequel, but the irritating characters and lazy [;it just didn't do it for me.I don't mind popcorn movies where you park your brain at the door, but they are usually fun. I think that is the problem here, it just was not fun. Statham is the best thing about this movie, he always turns in a reliable performance. The rest of the cast are so forgettable, in the end I was cheering for the shark.If I want a good shark movie, I will watch Jaws.

title: DID THEY CGI- all these actors? Major FLOP!!
text: I need to preface this by saying, I LOVED the Meg, it was the right amount of silly and loose storyline that I could watch it and play PVZ without needing to follow the storyline.I was looking forward to MEG 2, not sure how they would have followed it up but I do like Jason Stantham movies.Unfortunately the movie was incredibly boring, ridiculous storyline that was so unbelievable, an annoying kid that I have no idea why they were in there and these one-dimensional villans that I found myself laughing at how stupid they were.The worst part, is I couldn't help but feel I was watching a paid for by the CCP movie, designed to elevate the face of China.I actually don't even have a problem with that, but to make out like the Chinese govt. Is Captain America and is the ultimate force of good in the world felt like a betrayal to story telling.As a mum of part-Asian children, I'm really enthused to see more inclusion of Asian actors in roles that go beyond those stereotypical kungfu roles. Unfortunately, this had no texture or believability and I felt like I was watching a caricature of a believable person, with believable relationships.One word of wisdom to CCP - You can make good stories that reframe you in a positive light, but when you make such hogwash, ridiculous stories.... it makes you look like a controlling communist....

title: The Very Sharp Tooth of Boredom
text: Meg 2: The Trench is like all those late entries to the Jurassic Park franchise: lifeless, soulless, mindless, dumb, generic. There is no excitement or suspense, no characters one can relate too (at least I couldn't), and compared to fine "shark movies" like Jaws, Deep Blue Sea, Open Water or The Shallows, this one is not B-league but C-league, despite some production value. Also, some well done CGI is no news anymore for quite some time and not very entertaining if the rest of the movies is just crap. I really would prefer to put some of those good old Godzilla themed movies of the 50s and 60s back on my screen (and have some fun) instead of watching this, well, void of boredom ever again. I really like some of the movies starring Jason Statham, but as I don't watch (and like) Fast & Furios movies (the last one I watched was the third entry) the last really good one I can remember was that little movie Homefront, a movie made 10 years ago - simply put, I would prefer to get more class and less mass.

title: Exactly what it says on the box...
text: My Rating reflects expectations. If this was touted as a edge of your seat thriller with cutting edge CGI and unexpected twists and turns, it'd be a 2. But this was always going to end up the campy, overacted, completely implausible, CGI riddled cheese-fest that it is. And it absolutely delivered on that expectation.It has Plot holes so big you could swim a megladon through, hilarious foreshadowing via dialogue (if they say something won't happen, its going to happen,) and a decent smattering of quips, giggle/smirk inducing lines, and the requisite action scenes.It ticked all the boxes for expectations - and exceeded it in areas like "completely unrealistic technology," "inaccurate animal behaviour" and "Implausible physics/hydrodynamics." But that just added to the fun.For the naysayers - expecting more quality/realism/etc from this movie is like expecting a Fast and the Furious movie to be extolling the virtues of bicycles.Its a fun, lighthearted, and "laugh at the ridiculousness" sort of flick and that's worth a passing grade.

title: A cinematic abyss
text: Meg 2: The Trench sinks to new depths of awfulness, earning the dubious honour of being Statham's worst movie by far. The palpable absence of the previous star cast further drowns this terrible sequel leaving a void that Statham simply couldn't fill.The plot is so awful it's as if a kindergarten child was handed a pen and paper during the writers strike and was told to write whatever popped up in their head.Shall we talk about the acting? The protagonists were mediocre at best. Their acting looked forced and unnatural.As for the supportive characters, they all looked as if they came straight out of a high school drama workshop. Take that female security guard for instance, a character so unnecessary and annoying. The actress herself was so unable to deliver a single convincing line. Every time she spoke I found myself wincing. Kudos for achieving such a cringe-worthy presence on screen! As for DJ, the comedic genius offering humour so intellectually stimulating, it's as if the writers consulted a focus group of thee-year- old kids. Perhaps the only one who could deliver a somewhat decent performance was Cliff Curtis but he still couldn't salvage this shipwreck of a movie.Furthermore, the cgi looked so cartoonish I half expected the sharks to break into a dance routine straight out of a Saturday morning cartoon.Overall a cinematic disaster that should come with a warning label: "View at your own peril!"

title: Typical mindless over bloated sequel...and I loved it!
text: Personally, I was surprised that Jason Statham decided to make a sequel to the Meg. Most likely because I did not think the Meg was his type of movie. Not exactly Crank on water or anything. The film is an obvious cash cow but worth the money. No need to put any thought into how stupid this movie its cause it's met to be the opposite of smart. Its entertaining as hell and does not slow down long enough for me to point out the plot holes and the science mistakes. A perfect Tie-in to Shark Week. I went into this baby knowing that I was going to like it and I came out loving every minute of it. It's not met to be Shakespeare but it's definitely a fun experience.

title: Meg 2: The Trench is more of the same silly fun as the first one with enough new elements to make fun escapist viewing
text: 6 years after the events of the first film, Jonas Taylor (Jason Statham) is now the guardian of Meiying (Sophia Cai) following the death of her mother Suyin and continues working for the Oceanographic institute alongside his friends Mac (Cliff Curtis) and DJ (Page Kennedy) under the direction of Jiuming Zhang (Wu Jing), Suyin's brother, as well as performing environmental investigations exposing illegal dumpers and polluters. Jiuming continues the work started by his father and sister with the backing of billionaire Hillary Driscoli (Sienna Guillory) including having successfully captured a meg, named Halqi, and kept it in captivity despite the concerns of Jonas. As Jonas, Jiuming, and several others embark on a journey from Mana One research station to explore the Mariana Trench, they stumble across a conspiracy with far reaching implications that unleashes the threat of the Megs once again on humanity.After weathering a troubled 22 year long development cycle, The Meg proved to be a sleeper hit overindexing in the United States and making over $500 million worldwide. Shortly after the first film's release it was announced the producers were in development of a sequel that would mine material from other material in Steve Alten's Meg novel series. With Ben Wheatley stepping in for directors duties and the writing team of Dean Georgaris and Jon and Erich Hoeber, Meg 2: The Trench delivers on the same silly fun as the previous film and is unapologetically ridiculous Summer escapism.Jason Statham and Sophia Cai reprise their roles as Jonas and Meiying respectively from the previous film, and despite the clunkiness of having to explain away Li Bingbing's character Suyin from the previous film, the movie does a solid job of building upon the chemistry between Statham and Cai with the two in a unique place with Jonas now Meiying's legal guardian and there's a solid dynamic between the two. We also get the welcome returns of Cliff Curtis' Mac and Page Kennedy's DJ respectively with both still great supporting characters to bounce off against Statham with DJ in particular given some very funny developments spurred by his experiences in the last film. Much like the novel it takes (loose) inspiration from, Meg 2: The Trench is stuff to the gills with things that happen and it's probably the most movie you'll get in a Summer blockbuster in terms of sheer variety. There's a little bit of Aliens, some Abyss (or if you will: Leviathan), of course traces of Jaws, and even a little bit of Die Hard and Jurassic Park thrown in for good measure. The last act of this movie is just insane and much like the prior film it is unfortunately held back from getting too bloody thanks to its PG-13 rating, but in terms of delivering on crazy action and spectacle it's certainly firing on all cylinders.Meg 2: The Trench is my kind of cinematic junkfood. It's a movie that feels like a throwback to those 90s era blockbusters complete with a rap song over the end credits called "Chomp" that almost makes you expect the credit "Voice of Magic Taco.... James Earl Jones" (look up Simpsons and Zorro, you'll know what I'm talking about). As you can tell I had a blast with this movie and I hope they mine the rest of the book series for all it's worth.

title: I'm utterly ashamed I paid to watch this atrocity.
text:
This film plunges into the trench of terrible plot, leaving you grasping for coherence. The first movie was also dumb but a million times better than Meg 2. The filmmakers obviously used most of the budget to pay statham and that Asian star and then for some reason decided to scrape the bottom of the barrel for the rest of the cast.Whatever happened to A list names like Ruby Rose, Li Bingbing and Rainm Wilson ? Why would you try to float the film with a crew of completely unknown, talentless actors who seem to have come straight out of an amateur high school acting class?Now let's talk about the plot. Completely nonsensical! So indifferent and poorly written that leaves you wondering if the writers were playing a cruel joke on the audience. To top all that, cgi looked like it came out of a PS2 game.Save your money! This is so bad it seems like it was written and played by a group of teenagers experimenting with their first camera.Plot: 2/10
Acting: 1/10
CGI: 4/10.

title: weak film, the first was better
text: This film just wasn't as enjoyable as the first. It took me multiple attempts to finish this film because it could not hold my attention.The meg was present in the film but the meg wasn't at the center of the film like in the first movie. This was basically a usual Jason Statham movie with a villain and martial arts that just so happen to have some sharks in it.There were some other creatures in the film and honestly I can't remember how they came to be. I expected this to be a film where you have to accept the impossible but it was just so ridiculous that it was annoying.The only character that saw some development was DJ. We were able to see some growth from him since the last film but other than that all of the characters were unmemorable.Weak plot, weak action, weak dialogue and a weak ending.

title: A Jason Junk Film
text: Jason Jason, Jason. Why, Why, and Why? This was strictly for a paycheck plus being a producer, so you did made some money. Please make your next film better because you need to redeem yourself to your fans. This movie STUNK! So many errors, implausible scenes, terrible action, and lousy script writers trying to be funny. I was hoping you would have done the Jack Reacher films instead of that short 5'7" guy with the initials T. C. Please don't get involve with a Meg 3 if someone is thinking about this. The cast is bad, the acting is bad, the science is bad. How could anyone swim in 25,000 ft of ocean depth without a pressurized suit of some kind. Jason did! Don't bother with this fiasco.

title: It's awful
text: Clearly Jason Statham just did this movie for the money. The story is ridiculously bad, I mean seriously bad! Statham is like a constipated statue the whole time. The CGI is cheap nasty and completely unrealistic. The only saving grace that is fantastic & I mean FANTASTIC is when the credits rolled. This movie is everything that is wrong with Hollywood, regurgitating stories and using bad actors, bad producers & bad CGI. Would anyone in Hollywood ever stop this idiocy forever. Don't go see the Meg it's awful. Not one bit entertaining, it was made as a money magnet but I for one don't see the pull of it. Avoid it, it's a waste of time and money.

title: Sharknado with a huge budget and the same amount of camp
text: Let's keep this quick and simple because if you're seeing this movie you probably can't focus on anything for long periods of time.1. Evil corporation - CHECK2. Three massive sharks - CHECK3. A giant squid - CHECK4. Jason Statham literally jumping a shark - CHECK5. One-liners straight out of an 80's movie - CHECKThe regular film critics might say this is a mess but I think a serious giant shark movie just wouldn't work. I don't think Hollywood is giving up, I think they're giving in to what the people want. If you asked me what movie I think should win a razzie and still be worth your time, it's this one.

title: not all movies have to be good to be great
text: This is easily one of the worst movies I've ever seen- I loved it.The key to enjoying this is expecting camp. After seeing the trailer, I went into the cinema suspending my disbelief SO HARD and had the time of my life.The characters are the least likeable part of this- you'll find yourself wishing at least five characters get eaten instead of rooting for them. Page Kennedy is a shining star though, and every time he was on screen I was ecstatic.The plot is bad, bordering hilarious. The villain's motivations are cartoonishly poorly thought out, and all the decisions that lead up to the movie's climax taking place are idiotic at best.The actual megs (and other sea creatures) are gorgeously rendered, but you'll also have to suspend your disbelief about how they're a) alive b) doing any of this. Honestly, I would have loved to see more of the sea monsters, instead of all the plot bs. Sea dinosaurs take off running on land, just roll with it.My conclusion: this movie is campy as hell. It's got the depth of a puddle, so just turn your brain off and you'll have a blast.

title: Horrible
text: Unfortunately, Meg 2 leaves much to be desired and is a letdown on many levels. Firstly, the plot feels confusing and inconsistent. The plot twists are not only predictable but also cliched, making the film dull and uninteresting.The performances of the actors do not redeem the situation. The main characters appear emotionless and unbelievable, lacking any chemistry between them. The dialogue is cliched and wooden, further detracting from the overall experience.Special effects and the portrayal of the sharks are disappointing. While the first Meg film set high expectations, the sequel fails to deliver anything new and seems as if the budget was cut in half. The sharks look artificial, and their movements are clumsy.The soundtrack is also problematic, as it fails to build tension or create a suitable atmosphere. The music at times feels disconnected and does not adequately support the unfolding events.All in all, Meg 2 falls far short of the original film's standard, leaving the viewer disappointed and questioning why this sequel was made at all. Hopefully, in the future, sharks will return to the big screen with a stronger and better-executed presence. I would have given 0 stars if I could.

title: JUST TRY AND ENJOY IT FOR WHAT IT IS!
text: A -{ B I G }- Screen Mini Review ; Movie Seen Thurs., 08-03-23.______________________________________________________Woman, to nearby man : "You can relax. This place, 'Meg-proof'. I mean, Jonas was always afraid of this, but I was also thinking....." { a Meg crashes through the 'impenetrable' glass barrier and chomps her up whole }.( Scene features in the -official- trailer by Warner Bros. Pictures ; hence a Non-spoiler ).______________________________________________________You already KNOW that this "Ain't No Oppenheimer" ; is almost certainly -not- going to win any Academy Awards ; nor was it -ever- intended to be as such. Bearing that in mind, here's a few thoughts to get the boat rowing. Isn't the reason that we -{ PAY }- . . . Of our "own-free-will", { and often rather handsomely, at that! } . . . To see a larger-than-life { quite literally! }, "UTTERLY BONKERS LEVEL" sci-fi action extravaganza such as 'Meg 2: The Trench' ( to be referred to simply as 'Meg-2' here ) . . . That we wish to 'Escape', be 'Enthralled', and perhaps most significantly of all . . . " Be able to let our hair down for a while, and just have a little 'Serious' Cinematic -{ FUN }- ? ? ? " Just Sayin'. ( And if you consider yourself to be a -true- lover of action flicks, then you will most -definitely- be able to relate to Meg-2 ).Jason Statham has been one of my favourite action heroes for the longest time, & well & truly -Delivers- in Meg-2 as 'Jonas Taylor', inasmuchas the "kicking ass" department is concerned. However, the absence of Bing Bing Li ..{ 'Suyin', in the first instalment }.. was an unequivocal disappointment, as her presence in 'The Meg' was nothing less than sheerly delightful. In contrast, Page Kennedy { 'DJ' }, not only reprises his role ..with 'Panache!'.. but also brings some -genuinely enjoyable suprises with him . . . -{ And }- performs the massively exhilarating hip-hop song "Chomp"! ( The track plays over the end credits ). If I have one -major- criticism of the film, it is that the -extremely- deadly Komodo Dragon like prehistoric creatures on "Fun Island" { -Also- featured in the aforementioned trailer } were, for want of a better expression . . . Just permitted to er, well, simply "be there" ( this is -very- obviously implied ) by the island's management ; -inspite- of the said venue, ( quite expectedly of course ), being chock full of, you-guessed-TOURISTS! But ..'other than that'.. I simply surrendered myself -completely- to the -{ "MINDLESS MOVIE MADNESS" }- at hand, and made a perfectly earnest effort to just relax, and enjoy the undeniably -immense- level of entertainment on display.Summary : The opening sequence is "Par Excellence". Also, I was -especially- heartened by Jonas's very endearing relationship with the "sparky and seemingly ever enthusiastic" 14 year old whiz-kid 'Meiying' { Suyin's daughter from the first picture, and played by the -now- 15 year old Sophia Cai } ; as it provided a VERY refreshing break from the 'Heartless Badass' personna that we almost -always- see Jason Statham's roles embody. In a nutshell, Meg-2 is "rife" with Twists, Turns & Curved-balls, galore. It -attempts- to fight every possible narrative clich√© Real-hard, and generally ends up winning ( -NOT- to be confused with all the -very- obvious "homages" present in the picture ). Ergo : " 8.00 -{ UNABASHED }- , Chompalicious Marks Out Of 10.00 " . . . . KUDOS, Director Ben Wheatley ! ! ! !

title: Unashamedly ridiculous, but made me giggle
text: I had low expectations for this movie, but actually found it somewhat entertaining. It's one of those flicks that's so over the top ridiculous that it's funny.As a professional diver for two decades, I found the underwater scenes quite hilarious. They just took things like physics and the gas laws and decided to entirely ignore them. The whole movie, from premise and plot to the dialogue and action sequences was utterly absurd, but I feel that must have been a conscious decision.The CGI was okay. It was action-packed. I laughed. It wasn't boring. That's worth 6/10 from me. It served it's purpose: to entertain.

title: Not made for the American market
text: The whole time that I was watching this movie all I could think was that there was some major overseas dollars particularly from Asia that had been sunk into this film in order to get it made. Everything from the characters, to about 1/3 of the dialogue or more being in Chinese and subtitled into English, the filming sites that were chose... Pretty much everything points to foreign investors that had a whole lot of input into how this movie was made and what it would include. Even when you put all the bad CGI, terrible acting, non-existent story, Syfy tropes to the side. In the end this just felt like a giant vanity project for wealthy Chinese investors to show off to people in Asia. Thank God I have a regal pass and I didn't have to come out of pocket on top of my subscription in order to watch this streaming pile of trash.ü§£

title: Most Boring Shark flick I've ever watched!
text: Meg 2 was an utter disaster. The cast's abysmal performances, coupled with a plot that reeked of indifference, not to mention the laughably cheap cgi which made the almighty megalodons look like cartoon caricatures, left me desperately awaiting the end credits. The absence of A-list actors like Li Bingbing, Rainn Wilson and Ruby Rose, who brought credibility to the predecessor, was an obvious misstep. Their replacements with unknown actors contributed to the film's downfall, as their lackluster performances failed to elicit any emotional investment. Not even Jason Statham's presence could save this sinking SHIP. I'm surprised Ben Wheatley directed this c rated flick. A painful reminder of how not to make a sequel.

title: Even with low expectations, it failed to meet them.
text: Given that I found the first installment passable for what it was, I was willing to give the sequel a shot. But even going into the movie with low expectations, it was impossible to watch.Contrived and formulaic were expected, but the sheer laziness of the mind numbing dialogue was simply too much to handle, even if one could get past the obvious pandering to international markets.Although I generally find Jason Stathan a mediocre actor in his best efforts, he was, surprisingly not the worst performer. Or at least, no so much so that he stood out poorly.If you want a fun, no expectations shark-related disaster films, stick with the Sharknado franchise, the likes of which are far more watchable and enjoyable than this lazy attempt at a money-grab.

title: Excellent Movie, if you are a 5 year old kid
text:
Pros: None that i can even remotely think of.Cons: Where to begin?Mildly interesting twist revealed way too early, not enough megalodon action, laughable CGI which is absolutely unacceptable for a 2023 movie, supporting cast is just like puppets, awful script, asinine direction, blatantly differs from source material and insults the source.Female lead of previous movie is missing who had slight chemistry with male lead. John Turtletaub may not have made a magnum opus with the first movie but it's definitely fun and enjoyable unlike this vapid waste of resource
Verdict: Avoid at all costs, not worth pirating also, just read the novels.

title: SILLY.
text:
It's silly, makes no sense, however, it is a lot of fun. The story is just getting out of hands every minute pass. And then stupid jokes in the middle of serious scenes lmao.Synopsis:
Get ready for the ultimate adrenaline rush this summer in "Meg 2: The Trench," a literally larger-than-life thrill ride that supersizes the 2018 blockbuster and takes the action to higher heights and even greater depths with multiple massive Megs and so much more! Dive into uncharted waters with Jason Statham and global action icon Wu Jing as they lead a daring research team on an exploratory dive into the deepest depths of the ocean. Their voyage spirals into chaos when a malevolent mining operation threatens their mission and forces them into a high-stakes battle for survival. Pitted against colossal Megs and relentless environmental plunderers, our heroes must outrun, outsmart, and outswim their merciless predators in a pulse-pounding race against time. Immerse yourself in the most electrifying cinematic experience of the year with "Meg 2: The Trench" -- where the depths of the ocean are matched only by the heights of sheer, unstoppable excitement!

title: Why can't we have negative stars?
text: I loved the first Meg movie. It's one of my all time favourite action movies. The premise is reasonable enough that you can suspend disbelief. The writing and plot is solid, with good acting, great action sequences and some cool twists. The Meg 2 on the other hand is the antithesis of the original. This is why you don't let AI write screenplays! That's the only way I can think that this abomination was created. Just like those early AI picture creations that look like Dali had an accident with a meat clever, and you can't figure out what the hell you're looking at!!?? Yes, it's that bad. Moronic action sequences that defy the laws of physics and treat the audience like they are a bunch of brain dead popcorn munchers. It should be a crime to make a sequel that is so utterly, got wrentchingly awful that your only salvation is to stare at your watch and count the seconds that feel like hours until the godforsaken torturous visual and auditory cognitive assault finally ends. This is one of the worst if not the worst movies I've ever seen at the cinema. So much so I felt compelled to actually log in to IMDb and write this scathing review just to get some sense of justice from being wronged by this horrendous streaming pile of garbage. Damn you - I want my money back.

title: Statham, Jurassic/Kaiju, Action
text: Solid popcorn cinema delivered.Beside from two cringe worthy moments the movie is really enjoyable and pace is good.Cinematography and effects are better than most things put out nowadays.3D works sometimes but you notice it wasn't written for it. For 3D to work you wan't long continuous cuts and that isn't the case here. If you go watch it go for 2D.Story is ok so far, no big blunders apart from the two moments mentioned earlier.The humour works most of the time for a smile.The cast is really good and believable.There is no identity politics or behavioural preaching in this movie.

title: Gen Z masterpiece
text: I do not understand why Hollywood is producing movies like this one. I love most of Jason Statham movies, but this one is embarrassing. Can you imagine the original Jaws (a masterpiece) with this amount of CGI?...First, I like the use of CGI and technology in movies, but honestly, this nowadays nonsense is embarrassing to watch.Second, if you're a Gen Z that was born in 2005, probably this one is for you. I get it. It includes fake people and animals, Instagram and TikTok visual style, full of filters and cheap CGI.So, overall a new Sharknado style movie, only recommended for people around 10-15 years old.Enjoy!

title: Come on! What's not to love about giant sharks! Lols?
text: I don't know what a lot of people expect from movies these days. An action movie is an action movie, all with different actors and plots but they won't be very different from each other in general. Same goes for other genres. I'm so fed up of reading convoluted rubbish from people who think they're film critics. In fact, I'm sick reading the same crap from critics too lol. Both Meg movies are pretty cool. Huge sharks, a giant octopus, jet skis and bombs? What's not to like? Acting was good, SFX are good, plot was dead on, and I never got bored. It's a popcorn movie. Switch off, chill out and enjoy it.

title: Trouble in The Trenches.
text: Jonas Taylor is back, and this time has battling multiple Megs and greedy individuals, only this time he's trapped at the bottom of The Ocean.It's hard to believe it's been five years since the first Meg snapped onto our screens. Just like the first, if you're prepared for a bit of outrageous, over the top action, then this may just be the summer pick me up that you need.This time it's not just The Megs that represent a threat, expect a few surprises along the way, but man's greed is arguably the main villain that Jonas has to battle with.The usual mix of action and special effects, if you thought the first one lacked subtlety, this one rips up the rule book, it's outrageous, big sharks, and plenty of opportunity for Statham to do his thing.It's not easy to pick out the characters that are solely here as cannon fodder, but in fairness it's not shy about bumping off the cast.I think this film has been lost among Barbenheimer, and that's a shame, it was a fun watch. Maybe The huge Chinese market will ensure a third film follows in the future.Best of all, Pipin is back!6/10.

title: Bravo Alpha Delta
text: Oh, what a stinker. Half the dialogue is in Chinese, another quarter is in English with unintelligible Chinese accents, and the rest is mumbled. But this isn't really a problem, since it is all written in pure gibberish. Not one single line feels natural. The science bit, oooh...this makes Star Wars look like a documentary. A total disregard for the laws of physics, extremely silly.It's sad to think how much money was spent on this, when it could have financed at least ten good movies with stories to tell and actors who can actually act. And the no doubt very expensive CGI wasn't even very good... DOn't waste two hours on this. If you like Jason Statham, watch The Transporter for a second time instead.

title: Empty
text: Cheesy as the first one was, I quite enjoyed the mindless fun of it all.Then this one came along and for some unfathomable reason, I had higher hopes for it than the first one.How wrong!Wooden, cold, empty, awkward. Everyone clearly left their hearts at home when making this terrible formulated derivative drivel. A bread and butter soulless venture into 1 dimensional boredom.I had to admit to a little confusion over director.I generally enjoy his stuff but it's so far out of his ball park that I was interested to see what he'd do with a bigger movie. Well, what he's done is, BAD and honestly, I've lost a little respect for him, selling his soul for $$$$$.Having said that, I do still like most of his other stuff but will be on guard from now on when it comes to being interested in any future project of his.Watch this by all means. You might need to to believe just how bad this film is.I honestly couldn't get beyond an hour before I finally turned it off in frustrated rage.Another waste from the dying film industry!

title: It's Exactly How You Think It Will Be
text: I'll keep this brief, my opinion is most likely unpopular but I needed to vent somewhere.The original Meg is probably in my top 5 most hated movies of all time. So out of spite to myself, I decided to sit through this one, purely because Ben Wheatley was directing. 5 minutes in and I knew then I made a big mistake.Going into it, I kind of knew what I was getting myself into. I'm under no illusion that I'm watching a movie about a giant shark that only wants to eat people. Everything was bad, the CG on the sharks at some points was laughable, the dialogue was so cheesy it makes you uncomfortable. Things happen with no explanation as to why, Statham going for a swim 7 kilometres underwater with zero equipment was ridiculous.Again I know what I'm watching but don't make it so implausible that it comes off as a joke. It felt like I was watching something from Asylum Studios that was made on a quarter of the budget. There were scenes that are literally taken from other movies but filmed badly. The final showdown was like watching a bad John Woo movie from 1995.It's safe to say that I have tormented myself enough wanting these movies to be something they are definitely not, if there's a third, I'm not putting myself through the pain of watching it. But, like all movies, make your own mind up.

title: So so awful
text: The first one was an enjoyable, B movie type action flick where one didnt need to think and just enjoyed the ride.It didnt blow you out of immersion with ridiculously over the top inconsistencies or dum6 scenes.The sequel is mostly that. The second part especially.First of all for a movie to be called Meg one would think there would be a raising tension about the creature, some face off and resolve. Or at least mostly about it. But alas it is not.It is about a variety of creatures that follow no logic about their living conditions, it is about some silly side plot, it is about horrible attemps at humor but most devastating for the movies, it is unbearably inconsistent.Second part of the movie is scene after scene after scene of a character here and in next scene somewhere else entirely, a character equipped with X and then uses X but next scene again has it. Or combant scenes that make NO SENSE. Some fighting here and then teleportent somewhere else and fighting there, then again at the first place and then rewind and go back a few steps. It is like someone just mixed edits and threw them together hastily so they only barely make any chronological sense. It is enfuriating.Skip it, it is beyond bad movie.

title: Most brain-dead film since Moonfall
text: Did you think the first Meg film was dumb? You've seen nothing yet.The three writers of Meg 2 collectively share one brain cell, and I have it on good authority that this one brain cell fired approximately three times during the writing of this script.Everything. Every. Thing. Is brain-dead. From the plot to the villains to the inconsistent characters to every scenario they're thrown into. All of it is devoid of an ounce of anything that could be considered rational or smart.But they upped the stupidity while sucking out the fun. The first two thirds of this movie takes itself unbearably seriously and is rarely fun.I would've rated this even lower if it weren't for the last 35-40 minutes, when the movie suddenly goes full self-aware stupid mode and it's some of the most purely dumb fun I've had at the movies this year.

title: Funny and Entertaining Sequel
text: Five years after the problems with the megalodon, Jonas Taylor (Jason Statham) is the stepfather of and raising the fourteen-year-old Meiying (Sophia Cai) after the death of her mother. He works at Mana One with Meiying's uncle Jiuming Zhang (Jing Wu), who owns the facility, exploring and mapping the bottom of the sea at the Mariana Trench and fights environmental crimes every now and then. Jiuming is raising and training a female megalodon called Haiqi. While mapping and unknown part of the bottom surface, Jonas finds that Meiying is a stowaway in his submarine. Further, they find a hidden mining station on the bottom of the sea. However, the criminal Montes (Sergio Peris Mencheta) explodes the area and traps both submarines in the trench. On board, Mac (Cliff Curtis) and DJ (Page Kennedy) discover that the rescue submarine has been sabotaged meaning that there is a mole in the crew. How the submarines' crew will be rescued?"Meg 2: The Trench" is a funny and entertaining sequel of "The Meg" (2018). The plot is intense, full of action and with the most absurd scenes, as this type of film should be. It is funny to read professional critics that expect a movie with Jason Stratham would be a Shakespearean drama or a documentary. And funnier the review of the maneuver mass that worship and repeat the same non-sensee in their reviews. If I see a Jaason Stratham's film called "Meg 2: The Trench", I know what I expect to see and I am very satisfied with what I have seen. My vote is seven.Title (Brazil): "Megatubar√£o 2" ("Megashark 2")

title: Don't listen to any review over a 4
text: Literally, it has the worst, and I mean the very worst writing I've endured in a modern movie.I'm a big fan of Jason Stratham but I've lost all respect after this.The lines are cheesy, unintelligent, old and all done before.There's no build up. It just gets straight into what is a pathetically over done plot.This movie is written by twelve year olds for 12 year olds.I'm astounded to see ratings of 7 and 8.Are these people insane?!It's so dumb it sucks any possible entertainment right out of the movie.This is an embarrassment for Hollywood which is churning out more and more rubbish.I wanted to write a witty review but I've lost half my IQ after watching this salty nonsense.I hope I recover soon.Please don't participate in this audio visual labotomy.

title: ABSOLUTE BONKERS BUT I LOVED IT!!!!!
text: I was a bit disappointed with the first movie so went into this one not expecting much. I am a huge Jason Statham fan so he was the draw card here for me. If you like Statham or shark movies you will not be disappointed with this film if you go into it expecting nothing but 2 hours of absolute BONKERS movie making!.What I liked about this movie was that they just threw everything in there- dinosaurs, octopus, mercenaries, corporate villains and not just one but 3 megs. The supporting cast was great too, especially Page Kennedy.The movie hits the perfect time limit as well, as I cannot do long movies anymore after seeing Oppenheimer. It does not take itself too seriously and the action/adventure element to it was on point. Another banger for Statham for sure.Bonkers but crazy fun and I loved it!!!!

title: Stop comparing
text: We should stop watching every movie like it is the next masterpiece to win 14 Oscars. Cuz that was not the intention of the makers.It is a great movie for a sunday afternoon on wich halfway your girl kisses you and you pause and then half an hour later you continue.Let movies be for what they intented to be. Like as everyday of our lives deserves an oscar. One day we elevate ourselves and have an Oscar worthy day and other days are just there to pass the easiest of times and deserve no memory space at all... just like some movies...As if everyday we want to see films like Schindlers List, The Piano, Wolf of Wall Street or Once upon a time... where ever is your fave. I know I don't so enjoy it for what it is and don't be a cinematic snob.

title: Leave your brain at home
text: I have no problem with 'brainless' action / monster movies, as long as they are done right. The first Meg was a decent enough bit of entertainment. The sequel is a very pale immitation.There are is a pointless eco=polution sub-plot that I assume are included to pad out the story. They add nothing to the story, plus they are really badly done with obvious villains who are revealed too early and have very predictable deaths.As other reviews have pointed out, what little Meg action there is takes place in darkness with average cgi. The acting is phoned in by most of the cast.The movie kicks into overdrive in the last act, where all hell breaks loose and we get a series of multi-monster / bad-guy action scenes. Even here, all logic goes out the window.It also doesn't help that this was made before the events of the Titan submersible disaster and anyone watching this will have a passing knowledge of the effects of incredibly deep submersion on the human body, so the entire underwater action in the first half is ridiculously stupid.This just isn't silly enough to make it worth a few hours of your time.

title: Only if you need something to fall asleep
text: If you compare this sequel to its predecessor, then the latter is by far the better one to watch.No depth of character, and since the female lead of previous movie is missing, one key element of the movie is also missing.I honestly watch this hoping to see. Jason and Fan Bingbing get together again for another (mis)adventure, but alas what I saw was just another attempt to grab some quick cash from fans of the series.Really, avoid this movie. Weak plot, not enough action from the main character (the Meg), blatantly laughable CGI, weak character development, etc.I'm having a nightmare just writing this..

title: MEGa Failure
text: To absolutely nobodies surprise, like the first, the movie is about a plan to inspect areas of the ocean in tiny pods that are absolutely guaranteed to fail while they get chased by prehistoric sharks that are said to be bigger and meaner than ever before. The graphics the movie uses for the supposedly advanced tech gear and pods looks like an early 2000's Playstation save screen.For the first chunk the actors are sitting on a set that is not at all convincing of an advanced underwater vehicle while communicating with one another with the most wooden script imaginable. Some sections it almost seems like the actors are reading it for the first time as the emotion put behind the words just comes across so stiff and fake. This is also on the actors as no good actor/actress would be accepting of this poor of work. Perhaps I am just expecting too much for a movie that has a slogan of "New Meg, Old chum." However, there are times in the movie where it in some ways takes itself seriously and doesn't accept entirely that it's all truly one big joke. When it takes that position I expect a little more quality.Much of the movie is the characters trying to joke around with each other with almost inside type jokes and none of it particularly is interesting for the main reason that we really know nothing about the characters and therefore no investment in them. I think the hope is that the audience will warm up to the characters more through these jokes, but for many characters we hardly and in some cases don't even know their names. The characters poor development makes their back and forth banter just kind of annoying instead of being plot advancing. It almost seems like the script was built as if this was the 4th or 5th movie in an established franchise where your expected to know the characters relationships prior.The reality is that a good chunk of people won't even remember the main characters name (Jonas) from the first one never mind the secondary characters. At the very least some sort of 5 min recap to get up to speed was likely necessary with maybe a possible flashback.As far as the lead, Jason Statham delivers the exact performance he does in every other role. If that's your thing maybe it's worth your watch.With regards to the quality of the story not much can be expected going in. However, the villains which were probably inserted to get the movie past 90 minute runtime were more of a distraction than anything. People come to see a shark hunting down the research team, but it seems they ran out of ideas on how to make the chases unique enough so they added the secondary villains to try to have some other side story to consider. I get the move, but at the same time it wasn't particularly enthralling. The villains trying to destroy the environment for their own personal fortune is a very common theme and this movie adds nothing new to that framework.Lastly , it is pretty clear that the movie is insecure with itself by trying to add a bunch of clich√© and stereotypical sections to the ending to try to keep it afloat.Overall the entire production feels like it was written on the spot 5 minutes before shooting kind of like when you didn't do your homework in grade school and try to scribble something together so as to try and not get caught by the teacher for not doing it.Lucky enough for the filmmakers this kind of weak pathetic movie can still sell in the summer. I get it's not to be taken seriously, but there are a whole host of other movies currently in theaters that will provide you more entertainment.

title: Easy watching fun
text: I watched the original Meg too and also this one.I would like to preface this review by saying it's not a serious movie. You won't be writing home about it.It's a stupid fun action comedic movie and it did a great job about that.The James Bond style was much better than the first meg, there was more drama, action and comedy.The actors all did a great job. The CGI was good too.I feel as though most of the negative reviews are expecting a proper serious movie which requires concentration and insight whereas this movie is not one of those.Like I said it's an easy watch, pretty fun, pretty funny and also some good action scenes.I enjoyed it, I'm not sure I'd be in a hurry to watch it again because it's quite basic but it's definitely worth a watch if you wanna kill some time and watch something fun.

title: A Watchable Summertime Sequel
text: I watched the first film back in August 2018. I loved it, even bought the Blu-ray.I watched this sequel today, towards the end of it's cinematic release, here in the UKAs a whole, the film is fun in places and has some good action with a few cliches. It is light on the science and factual side and does become a fight for survival.Not only against nature itself but also against an army of baddies.The story is fine, the CGi good. The acting is ok, along with the editing and pacing.Living up to the premise of the first film I would imagine would be a tall order.This film makes it over the line, hence my score of 7 / 10.

title: Mug 2
text: I watched the first one and was gutted there was no gore. It's a shark movie!??! I read afterward even the director Jon Turtletaub was upset they edited out the gore for a PG-13 release. Well, this sequel is even more Meg yet not a single drop of blood. It was Sharknado with better actors. I love action, monster or Sci Fi movies but as soon as I saw some parents walk in to the theatre with their 4 children no older than 8 and sit in the front row I knew I was doomed. If you want a giant shark movie that is fluffy and comedy centric than go for it. If you want shark action and suspense re-watch Jaws or even Deep Blue Sea. If I didn't laugh so much I'd cry spending all that dosh tonight üòî

title: Your typical mindless animal movie. Quite a fun watch
text: This is exactly what you should be expecting.It's a bs sequel to a movie about prehistoric sharks. Very very predictable plot. An absolute load of unrealistic bs that even fast and furious would be proud of.But all this made for a very fun movie. I feel it could've been even better with an R rating so they could swear and add in some gore/blood.DJ was a great character. Jason Statham was an absolute badass, Jiuming was also good. The kid seemed like she was gonna be a very very annoying character in the first part of the movie, but she got less annoying.Overall, definitely nowhere near the greatest movie of all time, probably not even the greatest this week. But nevertheless, was very enjoyable. Personally, I found it infinitely more entertaining than Oppenheimer.

title: Utter Chaos but so Entertaining
text: Before you decide to watch this film ask yourself this; do I need a believable plot to enjoy a film? If the answer is yes then this movie is not for you. However if the answer is NO , strap yourself in for an 1hr 1/2 of utter bonkersness which will leave you smiling for days.Like my son put it, the Meg 2 is like the demon love child of Meg 1, Jurassic Park and Mission Impossible. Put it simply they have create an utterly chaotic masterpiece. The action after about 20min never stops and it just keeps coming and coming with you never knowing what is going to happen next. Yes it is far fetched and it doesn't make sense at times but is a fantastic watch and so much fun.

title: Dialogue Sinks Beneath the Waves
text: "Meg2" fails to rise above its predecessor, being dragged down by its abysmal dialogue quality. The film's incessant use of 'guys' and 'you guys' reaches new depths of annoyance, eclipsing any potential enjoyment. When faced with the colossal Megalodon, a character yells, "You guys, we need a plan, like now!" This laughable line exemplifies the script's inability to craft meaningful dialogue during crucial moments. The constant stream of 'guys', 'what are you doing here?', etc, is lazy writing, revealing a lack of effort in character development. Despite boasting impressive underwater visuals, "Meg2" fails to dive into meaningful conversations. The excessive use of 'guys' and 'you guys' dilutes any emotional impact the characters might have conveyed. It's like watching a shipwreck of potential unfold, as the film's attempts at drama and tension are lost in the sea of repetitiveness. In a sequel that should have evolved, "Meg2" instead regresses into dialogue mediocrity. The constant refrain of 'guys' makes it difficult to take the film seriously. It's disappointing to see a potentially thrilling movie sink due to its own verbal shortcomings. Brace yourself for a dialogue-heavy disaster, unless 'guys' is your favorite word.

title: A bad film in most respects that not even 3 giant sharks, Jason Statham and low expectations can salvage.
text: The plot and acting are ok but the dialogue is poor, the special effects are nothing special, the villains are caricatures and the lack of gore and violence is noticeable, especially in the fight scenes. Boring for most of the first half with dark settings, predictable outcomes and a significant lack of sharks, it only improves in the finale due to the cheesiness and absurdity of the events. Even then, it's a mess, jumping from one action scene to the next with no concept of pacing. It has some charm as a bad film and there's enough of the creatures to offer some entertainment value, but it's a poor show all round.

title: Funny actiony
text: This movie tries too hard to be the abyss meets Jurassic park. Some of it's empathy timing is off. I fear some of it's science is off, but you have to have suspension of disbelief somewhere in a work of fiction I guess. My point was... I laughed. The action was fun and the premise, overwhelmingly easy to catch up on if you haven't seen Meg 1. A fun group movie for mixed generations.Favorite scene is when the main lead is fighting with someone and he drop kicks the enemy into the megaladon shark's mouth who was several dozen yards away at the beginning of his sentence forming the exclamation that he did not need a gun.

title: 2 Minute Warning!
text: Saw this trash on Thursday afternoon before the planned opening on 08/04/23. Never mind the $ spent can always make more but the 2 hours wasted can never be given back! This movie is now my 2nd worst viewed movie ever (Battlefield Earth.) From the brainless plot to the abominable acting to the supposed humor this movie lacks in so many departments. A real snooze fest awaits you if you're crazy enough to want to view it. Please NOT another sequel. This will bomb at the box! I'm sure the writers strike had nothing to do with this garbage, then again it probably was written by a 5 year old! 1/10.

title: Simply Fun
text: The movie was fun. Something to watch and not take to serious. I enjoyed the context of what was going on regarding their dynamic goal, not want to say to much. But i enjoyed the movie, great laughing moments. I loved how the movie imagined what it could be if humans are able to go beneath the treacherous depths of the ocean. Its something to imagine, not to be critical about how its unrealistic. Its obviously a movie, just pushing our imagination. The movie its not to deep as its plot being complex to understand. Its simply fun, that is all. The acting was good as it should be in this thrilled type of movies.

title: Horrible.
text:
I don't think there is much more to say. Horrible. Pathetic. I just don't understand why garbage like this get made. The makers shou be embarrassed.The movie continues to get worse every minute it plays. The science has to be explained because how dumb it is
I usually like Jason, he was about all the film had.Story is horrible.. Story is horrible.. Story is horrible
CGI is really really bad. Like cartoons. Save yourself the money cause it's not worth spending money on this one. Or watch it,,, and give it a review. Maybe someone will read it and feel bad for making the movie. I wish it was as good as the first one.

title: WORTH THE HYPE. NOT THE HATE!
text: Many people write negative reviews saying that its just a typical Hollywood movie . But it is just NOT worth the hate , the movie is supposed to be taken lightly and you should enjoy the fun. The movie was based on a three sharks and many famous actors . It was in my opinion a very fun experience and a must watch if u are a fan of good quality action , animals , plot twists and a whole lot of fun. The people should try to understand that this isn't your oppenheimer and shouldn't be taken seriously. The movie isn't stretched and it was very clear and concise in what they were trying to show . MUST WATCH!

title: A sh**e film, but still entertainment and I'm guess that's what it's there to do!
text:
I enjoyed the first film so thought I would *endure* the follow up.In essence this film is so far fetched that it doesn't really matter what else happens.Statham is his usual typical hardman who a little too obviously saves the day! (Over and over again!)
Less endearing than the first and they have not said what happened to Suyinü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
In all the usual deaths and near misses that this type of film usually get.If you want a film that has a storyline and for the film critics is a good allrounder, then this film is not for you. But if you are only looking for some rediculas action fighting some insanely big sharks (as well as some other creatures) then this film will entertain.

title: Mega Dumb Mega Stupid
text: Please don't make a third one. Was it supposed to be this campy? This definitely was not one of Jason Statham's best. Where does one begin to list all the stupid plot holes, inconsistencies, and just plain dumb writing.What I found most annoying was that for most of the first hour it's like an action/espionage movie with the sharks as a subplot. Given the title, shouldn't they be the main attraction?What's with the cheesy campy comments when several of the characters are in life threatening situations? I mean really. In any of the situations given in this movie the last thing anyone would realistically think of saying when they're about to die is something funny.I've got to think that the writers, director, and actors, all knew what they were doing but then again, maybe they just made a MEG of a mistake.

title: Bad, bad. Not bad good.
text: I have to start this review by stating that I saw this movie for free as my daughter works for a movie theater and one of the perks is family members see movies for free (I pay for all the concessions we buy to help support the theater as well as tip the person serving me). With that say, this is utter garbage. I know not to take this move seriously.. I know the type of movie it is but without a doubt this terrible. It is not even bad that it is good (kinda like Cocaine Bear). It is just simply bad. These movies employ 100's of people and I happy for that but I cannot think about how many better movies can be made the budget of this movie. Such a waste. Go see Talk to Me instead.

title: Wait to stream
text: A bunch of separate script scenarios thrown together. Editing is terrible. Characters you dont know anything about due to no introduction and without explanation. Plot holes. The story doesnt evolve seamlessly. And what happened to shark carnage? I love jason statham movies. A d i love shark movies. But its just more of JS usual movie types that this time just wasnt that good. The underwater scenes were getting good but its like they just didnt know what to do with it. While there was some fun to it i dont think it was worth the money spent at a theatre. Wait for it to come out on streaming. Sorry.

title: New Meg. Old Chum.
text: The sequel to The Meg (2018) that was based on the first book Meg: A Novel of Deep Terror by Steve Alten, now Meg 2: The Trench (2023) is based on the second book The Trench by the same author. Even though I think the first movie The Meg (2018) is better than this second movie, I do think the sequel Meg 2: The Trench (2023) is as fun as the first movie. It does have issues like the first movie, but when it comes to a movie like this, what were you expecting?Jason Statham returning as Jonas Taylor is still great to watch in the action sequences involving him going up against three Megalodons, along with stopping a malevolent mining operation that messes with what Jonas and his team are trying to do involving exploring a deep trench. Jing Wu as Jiuming Zhang was good; he and Jason Statham worked well together in suspenseful scenes and action scenes, along with him having a connection to one of the Megalodons that are out swimming loose. The return of Cliff Curtis, Page Kennedy, and now older Shuya Sophia Cai back in the same roles they played in the first movie, and they still do a respectable job.The three Megalodons looked good and had beneficial effects on it, but sometimes the CGI can be noticeable at times, along with some creatures that appear in the third act climax. The antagonists that are sabotaging Jonas and his team and doing the mining operation are standard seen it before antagonists that just make things worse for the characters in a way that is entertaining to watch when stuff goes down. The look and feel of the trench when they are walking through it looked cool with a dark feeling, but it had some cool designs, with certain ocean life with good designs.There are fight scenes between Jonas Taylor and the antagonists from time to time in the movie that was cool to watch, and well shot. In the third act was where everything went down with the great action sequences with Jonas Taylor against the three Megalodons, while other creatures attack at the same time at a beach; all of it was entertaining, nicely shot, and can be suspenseful. The first act was interesting setup for the movie, the second act was suspenseful being stuck in the trench, and the third act was fun and over the top to watch with crazy things happening.Meg 2: The Trench (2023) was just as fun as the first, though it has some moments that felt slow, and I thought the first movie was better, the movie was still entertaining to watch. Good acting, good looking sharks, beneficial effects with occasional noticeable ones, with good cinematography, and action/chase sequences that are suspenseful to watch. I would think if you liked the first movie The Meg (2018) then you will like the second movie Meg 2: The Trench (2023), especially if you are looking for a fun summer movie to watch this year.

title: "Meg 2" gives you exactly what you want
text: "Meg 2: The Trench" is entertaining; if you're a fan of the first film, a fan of Jason Statham, or just a fan of silly B-movies or action films, you're in luck because "Meg 2" is nothing but action, starring Jason Statham, with a silly B-movie flair.Listen: This movie gives you exactly what you want; it's a ridiculous film that's filled to the brim with sci-fi thrills, kaiju action, and Statham punching bad guys in the face, and it's honestly a lot of fun for what it is. "Meg 2" has very little down time - something is always happening, and someone is always doing something - compare that to the first film, which was primarily filled with boring characters having boring conversations, and you already have a recipe for success with this sequel.There are some similarities between this sequel and the first film - namely, all of the Statham on shark action occurs within the last 25 minutes of the movie. And while that bothered me during the first film due to how sleep-inducing the buildup was, "Meg 2" basically plays out like a separate Statham movie until the climactic creature feature shenanigans begin. So, you'll see Jason and crew fight bad guys, shoot monsters, and make their way out of precarious situations until, inevitably, facing off against the titular megalodon.And when they do finally fight the meg? Man, oh man, is it awesome. With enough sea monsters to make even the most seasoned creature feature veteran blush, the third act is bombastic and ridiculous and everything you'd expect from this type of movie - long story short, it's worth the wait. And "Meg 2: The Trench" is certainly worth a viewing.

title: Avoid at all costs
text: This is one of the worst movies ever!! It goes to show that it doesn't matter on the budget or cast if you have a shoddy script and questionable sfx the movie will be shite!!I rented on prime and after 48mins I had seen enough! I decided it was worth wasting the money and turning it off as to not have to sit through anymore!! So many plot holes, crap sfx, shocking script issues and appalling acting I'd had enough!I've seen better movies from the 60's with more convincing storylines and cgi!!The book was amazing.. I read it like 4 times, even the first movie was hmmmmm, acceptable but this?! This was an embarrassment! I'm actually disgusted that I even paid to see just 48 of the 116min runtime! What has happened to movie making nowadays?? Just crush something together and hope people pay money to see it... well I'm just sad that I was one of those people!! If I was in a movie theatre I would have walked out!! Total crock of shite!! Do not waste your money!

title: Baaaaaby shark do do, DO MEG 2...
text: You're welcome for that earworm.I really wasn't expecting much for a sequel to the first Meg I had rated a very generous 6/10, but wow was I pleasantly surprised with this sequel.I felt Statham was only cast in the first film to draw viewership, as he didn't do what Statham is know for doing - kicking butt. But in Meg 2, right from the opening scene, Statham does what Statham does best, and does so a few more times throughout the rest of the film, as well as a bunch of other insane action scenes. So right off the bat, you will get your Statham fix of action, and then some.Additionally, the humor is leaps and bounds better than the first film that was mostly misses, where in this one, we found ourselves laughing out loud many times. Sure there were a few misses, but the comedy was mostly hits, and well placed and executed.Even the story had non-stop suspense throughout, with little breaks to catch your breath, and the pacing was spot-on for the nearly two hour runtime. Sure there were some cliches and a few plot holes with some cheesy sub-plots, but overall this sequel was much more entertaining, tons more fun, and directed much better than the first film.All casting and performances were decent, and the S/VFX more impressive than the first film. Thus I can actually recommend this film, and give it a very deserving 8/10, because this film was more entertaining and real-er than the nearly triple budget Fast X nonsense.

title: Good adaptation
text: Well All I can say is wow as someone who is a fan of the source material And someone who read the second book that this movie is based on I honestly thought that this film Was very good And visually stunning in the action seems we're very cool And Some of the twist in terms that this movie takes Was very good I was pleasantly surprised. It is very Different From the original film but It's closer to the book And I would absolutely recommend anyone who was a fan of the series to watch this film I absolutely hope That they adapt the other novels into films And I also think that it was nice that it doesn't end on a cliff hanger.

title: Really bad
text: Not as good as the first. Not funny. Not entertaining. I was almost asleep the first 45 minutes. Once they finally got out of the water, it was a little more entertaining... but not much. I paid $40 for 2 tickets, popcorn and drinks. Man, I could've stayed home and seen something for free. This was so disappointing. I am the biggest Jason Statham fan and even he looked sorry that he was in this flick. He was a producer and there were no other named actors so I guess he could only afford himself. There will probably be a sequel but I'm not paying money to see it. Not worth the time. Not worth the money. Not worth the film used to make it. Really disappointed.

title: Meg 2 mess
text: As a Ben Wheatley stan, Meg 2: The Trench breaks my heart. Too many things going on, not enough Meg action. The majority of Meg action is in the last 20-25 minutes. This film should've been called "Creatures of The Trench", instead. This reminds me of my experience with Jurassic World Dominion where the giant locusts and the humans take center stage. I just want more Megs, goddamnit.Jason Statham is on autopilot Jason Statham and the supporting actors don't help much either. The performances range from downright poor to unconvincing to okay-ish. The saving grace of this film is its CGI creatures and Statham vs. Meg Part 2. The Statham and Megs showdown isn't even that exciting, to be honest.The story is painfully generic and super predictable. Of course, I knew what I got myself into. I enjoyed the first Meg! I'm okay with generic or predictable, but at least make it thrilling and fun! This isn't the Ben Wheatley I know. The worst thing any film could do to me is to leave me emotionally detached. It's better to feel hate - at least I felt something. With Meg 2: The Trench, I felt almost nothing.

title: Meaningless Action
text: Jason tried to act!!?? And failed horribly. This was probably the dumbest movie i have watched in a long time. The first half under water scenes were actually ok. If they had written a well thought script and proper dialogues it could've been something great actually. But unfortunately the writers must have been drunk. So yeah the writing is horrible. But scenes are visually appealing. The film goes downhill after they go up in the surface. It feels as if the directors, writers all passed out at this moment and put whatever the hell they wished and released it as a movie. If they had done this last part right this could've been an ok movie so yeah overall its just not worth it. A waste of time really.

title: Check brain at door and enjoy the laughs
text: I enjoyed it more than I expected to. It obviously isn't made to be oscar contention so just sit back and enjoy the ride.There isn't many Jason Statham movies I haven't liked but what I did like about this one is it didn't take itself too seriously. I mean com on if you watched the first one you know what to expect.The CGI is over the top and worth a laugh for that reason alone. I don't understand the negativity. It is what it is and if you expect anything else more fool you.My husband & I didn't expect to even last through it but we did suprisingly. Action a plenty, belief suspension a plenty but still worth a look even if it is to shake your head and say "what is hollywood thinking".The only thing I must say is the giant octopus was really not necessary.

title: Meg 2 is a dumb big movie that doesn't even try to be anything better.
text: Note that the movie seems to have been filmed at gunpoint, clearly no one involved wanted to make this.The movie is full of terrible twists and turns that feel deliberately made badly without any humor.While watching the movie you can sense how indifferent the makers have been towards it.It feels like every actor was completely miscast in their roles.Ultimately it's hard to talk about the story because it's so insignificant that by the end credits I had already forgotten what the point of this work was even supposed to be.The Megalodons only seem to be in the movie because the name of the movie is Meg. Otherwise it's bizarre that for the big shark no task was invented and they are instead mostly replaced with primitive moray eels whose existence, like this movie, has no reason.Don't bother watching, you'll thank me later.

title: Great Bad Movie
text: With "Meg 2: The Trench," I was hoping for a good bad movie, but based on internet reactions was afraid that it would just be a boring bad movie. But come on y'all....this is a great bad movie.This movie may be many things, but boring certainly isn't one of them. It's almost non-stop action. Now if that action has to make sense, then this might not be the movie for you.I did consider asking for a refund because my man crush Jason Statham doesn't take his shirt off once. He can't keep his shirt on in any of his other movies, so I thought for sure a movie that has him swimming around in the ocean for half the time would give him ample opportunities to flex those pecs. Sadly, no.It also helps that I saw this with my 12 year old son, who thought this was the greatest movie ever.Grade: B.

title: Approach with caution
text: No I'm not going to beat about the proverbial here! It's not often a movie makes me angry and prompts a walk out, but Ben Wheatley stab at the big time truly has me seeing red.Granted having left 40 minutes before the movie finished probably doesn't warrant a review of any kind but you know when you just have to vent?The original Meg was a let down, but being the Jason Statham fan that I am(Safe, Wild Card) being two of his finest efforts so I was hoping based on the trailer for the sequel things might be due for an upturn.Sadly such was not for happening!Now I never read the books but how on earth do you mess up when the golden goose is right there in the title.Cliff Curtis was seriously underused and looked I'll, The Stath looked his comfortable self but he was given mundane dialogue. As there was Chinese investment in the movie, we had to suffer through a small portion of subtitles.The trench sequences truly nailed the coffin for me, and as for the Meg itself, the way the story was developing, the prehistoric creature more or less took a back seat to the Die Hard elements that started to unfold.I realise this was a summer blockbuster, leave your brain at the door but this was just a misfire and definitely not one for the Statham collection.

title: Amazingly Better Than the First
text: After watching the first one; I didn't want to watch this one because that one was a mess. I like Jason Statham so decided why not; I'm bored. I'll give a whirl. Other reason I didn't want to watch it was because though I'm a scuba diver, I have a phobia of octopi and knowing essentially I'd be looking at the kraken with huge tentacles gave me the jeebs. Thankfully, that part of the show was towards the end and minimal. But though things were messy and far from perfect (antagonists were subpar at best but thankfully most were eaten fairly quickly); the comedy and bantering between the characters was amusing even in dire strait situations. It's not a film for everyone but if you want to just relax with some popcorn and have a chill evening, go for it. It is actually amazingly better than the first. That said, I hope they don't make a 3rd lol.

title: "MEG 2: THE TRENCH" REVIEW
text:
Directed by Ben Wheatley. A runtime of one hour and fifty-six minutes. With a PG-13 rating.Jason Statham as "Jones Taylor" is back in the sequel to "The Meg". The film about a massive Great White Shark. Now "Jones" is the adopted father to "Meiying" played by Shuya Sophia Cai. Since her mother passed away in the first film. "Jones" has assumed the father role but "Meiying" is raised by a village.Her uncle "Jiuming" played by Jing Wu, "Mac" played by Cliff Curtis, and "Dj" played by Page Kennedy. Picking up from the first film they have a "Meg" in captivity now. The trench where they got her from is being explored daily. With all types of exotic things and creatures that date back to before the dinosaurs down there."Jiuming" company is making new technology and advancing the company his sister and him built. "Jones" is still a wild cowboy now doing secret missions stopping people from hurting the environment while also trying to be a good dad.But when you have a "Meg" in captivity something is bound to go wrong. After a routine mission to explore the trench. Not only do they have to deal with an unruly teenager that's trying to be an explorer like her mom. Finding even more "Megs" in the trench along with other prehistoric creatures. They also have to deal with spies in the organization and people trying to go to the trench for all the wrong reasons.With this cocktail of disaster. "Jones" and the gang will have to stop whatever things follow them out of the trench a second time around. As well as stop these people trying to sabotage everything "Jiuming" and his sister built. In this wild big shark sequel."Meg 2: The Trench" was a wild ride. They outdid themselves with this film. Going above and beyond the first film. With more and bigger Megs on top of other massive deep blue creatures. Along with creatures we haven't seen before. You had an assortment of things to keep you busy. Then sprinkle in humans pulling double crosses and being money hungry.I felt like they had a meeting and said let's list every possible thing we can do that's over the top. No matter how ridiculous it is. Then they applied everything on the list to the screen. Some scenes were a bit ridiculous but it made for one entertaining film. You can never say this was boring.With a storyline that was simple enough. They focused on the action and the wow moments. With satire throughout the film. It made for a fun film. With newcomers to the franchise like Melissanthi Mahut playing "Rigaas", Skyler Samuels playing "Jess" and Sergio Peris-Mencheta playing "Montes. Who you might know from playing "Gustavo" in the hit series "Snowfall". They all brought that extra seasoning to a film that probably didn't need any extra. But who cares.Overall this film came out during the perfect time, "Shark Week". With great promotion. You got a wild blend of "Jaws" mixed with "Sharknado". It was supposed to be over the top and it worked. I had a fun time watching it. I was entertained the entire film. It gave you a way for a third film. So don't be surprised when it's announced. I give this film four mor fires üî•üî•üî•üî•.#CosmoandtheMovieWithin
#CosmoMovieBlog
#CosmoLanier
#Meg2TheTrench.

title: Mega a mess
text: Wooden acting, clunky and unfunny dialogue, PlayStation 2 generated cgi that when underwater is a chaotic mess that you can barely see what is going on; don't see it in 3D, it is pure torture. The action scenes seem to all be on fast forward and aren't remotely exciting or impressive. A dreadful wall of sound masquerading as music combined with Sfx is headache inducing.The story seems to sideline the Megs in favour of some other creatures and desperately wants to become a Jurassic park sequel. As much as I love Statham he seems sidelined by pointless and annoying characters that are just in the way. Lame environmental side story and bizarre double crossing early on make little sense or mean much. And having a Meg in captivity trying to train him like a poor sea park exhibit was beyond dumb. Still, this film would have got 10 if the Stath had punched the shark.

title: Amateur actor Statham out of his depth again.
text: Former bricklayer Jason Statham puts down his hod and cement mixer and heads to the ocean again in this atrocious CGI fest.Awful acting abounds here - the best performance came from a piece of seaweed which I couldn't take my eyes off.Yes, this really is basic entertainment for the McDonald's crowd. A burger with a curly human hair sticking out of it. Some fries with a cockroach on them. Not a pleasing experience. You get the general idea.Whilst watching this dreck I really did make a vow to never go to the cinema ever again. Where is the incentive to do so? Why would I wish to continue to punish myself like this?

title: Sink sank sunk
text: When one of the female characters pointed at a creature and said, "What is that?" I thought, "That's what I've been wondering this whole movie, sister." The only thing worse than bad dialogue is bad dialogue delivered poorly. The only thing worse than bad CGI is bad CGI that is the title of the movie. The only thing worse than wooden characters is wooden characters that you don't care about.Close-quarters, will-they-make-it-or-not scenes are only engaging if you become attached to the characters first. I didn't. I always knew who was next to "bite it" (I kept turning to my son every time someone gave a telltale line, and said, "Bye...") When I saw the commercials, I thought, "Well now I know he dies... and she dies... and they die." And those were the best kills in the movie, so they blew that (did they think I would forget and be surprised?) The inconsistencies in tone (Is that guy a serious scientist or a clown? Is that woman a tough hero or a scaredy cat?) coupled with really bad non-humor, and bad caricature (let's give the sassy black man more sassy lines) was often cringe-worthy. Even actors with some chops - I'm looking at you, Cliff Curtis - wandered around looking like they wished they were somewhere else.I love a good, brainless popcorn chomper once in a while if it is fun, or silly, or outrageously unbelievable, or cool to look at. This wasn't consistently any of these. It was like they put all the ideas in a bag, shook it, and pulled them out randomly. Now let's have an explosion. Now let's have an escape. A chase where the outnumbered pursued turn the tables on their pursuers. Now mercenaries on a boat. And how about throwing in some odd-buddy bumbling and fumbling, that will be hi-LAR-ious!When they threw in the old trope of a fight on a mining conveyor belt with the rock splitter at the top, I was done.So why two stars and not one? The relationship between Statham and the young girl was sweet, and made me smile. The rest of the movie had me grinding my teeth.

title: Fun but missed opportunity
text: The Director really missed many opportunities to ratchet tension while still having fun. Maybe Statham has producer could try to be more filmmaker than action star, something he clearly is. Being trapped on bottom of the ocean or being attacked by a Kraken should be easy to make exciting and terrifying.
