Plus, a golden opportunity lost with one shark and his handler could have made a real impact. That said, Statham being Statham is always worth the ticket price and he delivers all the toughness and softness with that perfect level of calm delivery that makes you believenhencN defeat a shark on a jet ski.

title: A movie with an identity crisis. I was expecting more
text: Meg 2: The trench, could have turned out as one of two types of movies: a serious action thriller or a comedy, we got a weird mix of both. This movie felt like it couldn't decide if it was 2020's "Underwater" or land of the lost. The first half of the movie took itself painfully seriously and yet failed to deliver on any character depth or plot depth. The movie had a great idea and should have done more to draw out and intensify the starting plot line of the movie. Instead it felt very rushed and choppy with terrible dialogue, the entire first 20 minutes of the movie were basically useless. The movie introduced several baddies with the decision making skills of someone in a bad horror movie, and wasted all of them in the end. The second part of the movie came along and the tone completely switched to a ridiculous action movie which was far my enjoyable because it was simple, men fighting sharks. If the movie had started with the tone of a ridiculous action movie and added some more comedy it would have been far far more enjoyable. Overall this movie was nothing more than a high budget B list movie. Minus points for "Haiqi" the worst CGI shark ever.

title: That's how it's done!
text: To begin with, you have to be realistic with your expectations. Just because a 250 EUR computer can't run the latest video game doesn't mean it's bad; it simply wasn't designed for that purpose. The same logic can be applied to this movie.A worthy successor to the first installment, properly pumped up with steroids. The action is unreal, the humor is silly, and everything that can be excessive is exaggerated to the point of absurdity! In short, Meg 2 is exactly what it should be, an action-packed adrenaline bomb.PS: I was thrilled to see Shuya Sophia Cai reprise her role as Meiying, but I'm very disappointed that Li Bingbing is no longer in it. She and Statham made an amazing pair!

title: Who wrote this?
text:
Well, I will be straight to my head line
Let's just go bk to 70s to the iconic jaws movie, I won't talk about directing, but for the god sake just compare the acting and the tension of the characters as they are facing huge dangerous situation, oh my god, at least do some effort, we are seeing ofc Indian semi hero,Asian like jackie chan,female warrior, American hero, black American hero innocent half American half Asian young scientist as a group who will beat the out of everything u can imagine until they will solve the problems of the audiences them selves, I can not handle the story and the plot, feeling like I am watching movie of the hendi movies where the actors can literally jump to the moon to take a selfie and return bk after defeating thousands of aliens, I am in a huge disappointment, that's not the 1st cheap plot acting movie in the last 3 years, specially the acting, what is happening in the movie making industries is questionable , politics, Ai scripts, worst acting performance with worst acting quality u could ever see, regarding the effects, there are lot of games now are better lol, sound track zero, effects 4 or 5, acting zero, directing 3, oh my, can't give more than 2.

title: It's A Fun Movie If You're Not Stuck Up
text: DJ was the most fun character in this movie. They levelled him up while keeping him the funniest character. The only disappointing thing here is how effortless Jason is at "beating" the megs as if fighting PREHISTORIC ANIMALS was an easy feat. The unbelievable stuff in this movie kinda brings you out of it cuz you end up cringing. However, it was still a fun action fantasy movie.Personally enjoyed the upgrade of the "tech" esp the submersibles. It brought me hope that one day we just might have that and we'd get to see live feed of their dives with water worlds we've yet to see.So yeah, if you're not too stuck up with the details, it's one of those fun action movies you can watch when you want an easy watch with just a hint of spice. It's not full on action, for me atleast. So better watch it for yourself and form your own opinions.

title: This is what happens when Chinese censors write your script
text: It's like underwater Jurassic Park meets low-budget Jaws. This movie is so bad, even Jason Statham should be ashamed of himself. It can't decide if it wants to be a buddy cop comedy, a Spielberg epic, a campy pirhana rip off, a James Bond spy film or all of the above.I'm it's greedy and cynical attempt to cash in on Chinese markets, Hollywood has sold its soul to the Chinese government and outsourced its script writing to its government censors. This movie has all the trappings of a big budget Hollywood romp, but the storyline and dialogue are so convoluted, you're rooting for the Meg to tear the entire cast apart in a single bite just to end the misery sooner.

title: Shark Weak...
text: Open wide and disengage brain folks... yep, macho-mumbling eco warrior come action hero Jason Statham is back with a sequel to 2018 summer hit The Meg, and boy is it one chum-bucket mess of a film.While the first instalment was an enjoyable enough mindless popcorn muncher, this one is all over the place and becomes a total over-the-top farce by the final frantic shark showdown.Never mind Megalodon, the screenwriters must have been on a mega-sugar rush in front of their laptops because they throw the whole kitchen never mind the sink at this ott travesty - ripping off elements of practically every underwater sci-fi/shark flick you can think of along the way (The Abyss, Underwater, 20,000 Leagues, Deep Blue Sea, Sharknado and Jaws of course). As usual Statham is basically being Statham - wisecracking, scowling, grinning and scrapping in a diving suit, while the no-name supporting cast are annoying, noisy, over excitable and as throwaway as the main plot about illegal undersea mining in 'secret' Meg infested waters.The worst part of it all though is while the plot and numerous sub-plots over-bombard you like a tsunami, the Megalodons are practically an afterthought until the last 20 minutes when it all kicks off into overdrive, and not in a good way!Even the cgi sharks (and also a giant octopus, and mutant lizards lol) are pretty lame this time out. Indeed there really is nothing other than some decent location filming and well choreographed fight scenes to keep you hooked-lined and sinkered.There is some good news though. Meg 2 has been a box-office bomb so it looks like the chances of having to endure another lacklustre, money spinning film franchise will end up as it should... as fish food. Fin.

title: Worst movie ever
text: One of the worst movie I have seen in recent years. Crappy story line, worst acting and cheap graphics. I don't know how Warner Bros produce such a low grade movie. Only two actors Jason Statham & Cliff Curtis did justice to their characters and all other cast acting was so bad. Emotion was completely missing and you don't even feel anything when shark is acting. Underwater scenes were of poor quality. I really felt like watching a B grade movie in theatre. It's really not worth to watch this movie in theater. It's just waste of money. First part was atleast better than this one. Please stop making these kind of movies.

title: Terrible
text: This movie is a major dissapointment, and this is coming from someone that actually liked the first part. Statham was pretty good in the first part and some of his jokes were really spot on there, but not in this one. When main characters are so annoying that you want them to be eaten, you know that the director has no idea what he is doing. The dialogs are terrible, the jokes are pathetic, even the effects are not that great. I expected a summer / shark movie, yet it became an underwater transporter/matrix and I am not saying this in a good way.I would strongly recommend you to skip this, as there many better things to watch and save your money.

title: A silly CGI fest but not as good as the first
text: Like the first Meg film, this was made for an international audience, especially Chinese, but it just didn't seem to work as well this time. The dialogue seems forced and it lacked the personality and humour of the previous film. Seems like a bit more emphasis on action this time around which is Jason Statham's staple diet. I think another problem was how many creatures they spread their CGI budget for, because it looked cartoon like at times. Maybe they just tried to do much this time and fit it too many ideas. However it's what you would expect, a silly goofy film, don't expect more and it's enjoyable.

title: megaladon :)
text: The shark didn't get much screen time , occasionally the "ooohhh spooky " appearances but the movie is funny and action packed at least for my little brain and lots of visual stuff like the background and the technology i think it's cool lol. Had me at the edge of my seat at parts but also had me at the skip toward button too sometimes, also i just wanna mention that DJ is so real sometimes. I love his character, honestly my favourite. I think it's an okay sequel to the first , i think the first is better than the second in my opinion though. It's silly wacky and funny and some things just don't make sense and i think that's what adds onto me liking it lol.

title: Oh boy!!!
text: You have to wonder how some films actually get made sometimes. Jason Statham isn't ever going to be an Oscar winning actor, however he's far more deserving than to be in a film like Meg 2.Do studios even oversee the films they bankroll? Because this is a new level of bad. I mean it's soooo bad it isn't even "so bad it's good".It's all over the place, I won't spoil it in case if you're reading this you still want to watch it, but this makes the original Meg look like Jaws. Hell, Meg 2 makes Jaws: The Revenge seem pretty good.I like cheesy films, everything doesn't have to be grade A cinema to be enjoyable, but come on. It's like someone wanted to make a huge budget version of one of those made for tv monster movies where a shark fights a mutant alligator.

title: This is a worthy sequel to the film Meg
text: This movie is very interesting. I liked the large number of marine and amphibious monsters. This film is improved by Jason Statham, who plays very well. Also, this film can be praised for the graphics. But including all the advantages of this film, it cannot be compared with the jaws of Spielberg. Now I will move on to the minuses of the film. The first disadvantage is a very stretched plot, this film could have been laid for an hour, but they made it almost an hour longer. The next minus is the bias of the ending of the film. In general, this is a worthy project in the genre of a mystical thriller. Against the background of the super premieres of Barbie and Oppenheimer, which all people are trying to go to, it will be difficult for this film to overtake even its first part at the box office. But I hope Statham and Ben Wheatley can do it.

title: Megdiocre
text: Franchise ender that's nothing like the first.The science in the original was shaky but passable.The sequel however presents a series of overcontrived and illogical set scenes complete with childish dialog dunked in melodrama.As some reviewers have noted, this was either written by or for 5yr-olds. It's more likely both especially after the little we've learned following the Titan disaster.Criticisms aside, one can always sit back, suspend reason and just enjoy a movie. Meg2 does require a dunce hat as well but it can be done, probably.At least until the movie plumbs new depths and hits the 'unadulterated corny' switch.Just ride along remembering to trust no one and it's all really happening in a suburban pool with inflatable fish.That works until they then turn on the humor.I thought at first Li BingBing was written out due to some disfavor. I was wrong. She'd read the script.

title: See you later, chum!
text: Meg 2 The Trench brings back Jonas Taylor and team, now working against the eco-terrorists by gathering evidence against them. Then there's Jiuming who has merged his company with his father's, taking over the ocean exploration mission while having a meg as his pet. On their mission into the Trench, they get trapped while their rescue pad is sabotaged, an inside job ofcourse. Their fight for survival extends to the surface as few megs and other creatures follow them through. Once again, the onus is on Jonas Taylor and team to take on the megalodons and save the day.The problem with this sequel is it simply doesn't try enough to entertain. The humor is flat for most part of it and with multiple creatures, it just misses the opportunity to go full on crazy. The Meg scenes aren't enough and less innovative. When you bring in an mega octopus, one expects more out of it yet what we get is lame underwater shots which simply doesn't do anything. The whole greedy villains thing is so one toned that in a creature flick, it sticks out as a sore thumb.Page Kennedy as DJ gets stale lines to deliver to evoke laughter, while none of the dialogues do work, he still manages to shine in two different scenes. Barring that, the film doesn't give much to Wu Jing to do. With the familiar characters, it somewhat is watchable until one realizes how underwhelming the creature scenes are. With it not getting violent or crazy enough, the third act gets badly monotonous and fails to entertain. Meg 2 misses the mark.

title: Keep expectations reasonable and just enjoy for what it is
text: What did people expect? ....an Oscar award winning movie? Thespians and shakespearian scripts? This movie is supposed to be a popcorn 'b movie' designed to be disposable and fun. I watched with my son and we both thoroughly enjoyed the silliness. Another reviewer suggested 'leaving one's brain at the door' and that seems a fair assessment. In terms of production values, it was pretty reasonable , the sharks looked real - unlike in movies such as Sharnado for instance (and generally leagues better) . Stalham does his usual badass-running about-kicking assessment routine with the odd cheesy throwaway one liners. It's fun. If you have no interest in such a movie then don't watch. It was exactly as I expected to be - and it enjoyably passed an hour or 2!

title: For the easily amused, unintelligent viewer
text: This movies for you if you're easily distracted by almost anything.Script writer's for this movie sure know how to dumb things down with their so called creativity. How these guys make a living writing this junk is mind blowing to me. Any teenage writer would have a better imagination.Acting was just horrendous. Acting didnt match most of the scripts tone in multiple scenes.Production and cinematography was decent.These chinese production companies really have to stop trying to cross over into the american market with their "rules" and old cinema (look it up if you dont get that). Its quite embarrassing and im chinese. The chinese just cant do big budget movies.Do not watch, dont spend a dime. Wait for this to be free on TNT or IDGAS network.This movie is the result of the wrong people having a big budget in the wrong industry. But if you love movies, this gives you hope that one day no matter how bad you are...you can be a writer, actor or director.

title: Trouble at mill
text: A dozen characters and Jason Statham await their turn to be eaten alive in bloodless fashion by giant sharks, a big squid and some dog fish dinosaur creatures which are equally hungry and capable in 26,000ft of water or on a sunny holiday beach ... yum yum Geoff hmmmm chomp chomp I knew these feet would come in handy one day me old son.Unfortunately two Indestructible Action Men - one Chinese, one from exotic Derbyshire - refuse to be oofed because movie stars. Jason Statham shows every sign of leading with his chin, and what a chin it is, into his 60s.Less people fall off boats in MEG 2 than in its predecessor.And man couldn't the shark at least have eaten the happy dog?Ridiculously troublesome times wherever you look, and not a single character's fate matters.But Ben Wheatley keeps the mayhem going for a couple of hours and my five year old thought it was great fun.

title: So bad its good
text: "See you later, Chum". One of my favorite quotes from the film. I think you can tell as to where I am headed writing this review. I wasn't expecting anything really from this film, but I actually enjoyed the first Meg. I was curious if they could pull it off a second time, boy was I wrong.Lets start off with the obvious. Where the hell are the sharks? You go into to this film hoping to see some shark terror action going down, not a boring half assed pretentious thriller. It is not thrilling for anyone wondering. The megs show up briefly in the middle of the film and towards the final act, that's it.I felt this film had way too many plots and ideas and instead of choosing one that is solid enough and go with that, they chose to make a mis- mash of four different films. The narrative was cheesy and messy. Even for films like this, you would expect some foundation to justify the characters' actions. In this film, Jonas (Jason Statham) has an adopted daughter called Meiying (Sophia Cai), who is the daughter of Jonas's love interest that SPOILER ALRET gets killed off in this film for some reason with no explanation whatsoever.Now for my favorite part, the acting. Look, Jason Statham is alright. He is very typecasted for these kind of films and sometimes he makes it work. He was great in ''Hobbs and Shaw'' and I liked him enough in the first Meg. In this film, it was just a little too much for me. His dynamic with Meiying didn't work in my opinion at all and felt forced. Overall, the writing is just god awful.With all that being said, I did have some good times in parts. Them being mainly the scenes with the Megs. The final act where Jonas kills the megs is pretty entertaining. I think part of the problem with this film is that it has a PG-13 rating which limits the possibilities to get creative with this type of movie. Some jokes landed and made me laugh and more serious scenes made me laugh too. I would say this film is so bad its good. Don't watch this expecting anything new or interesting.

title: Better than the first one.
text: I saw this movie in 3D 4X and I thought it was a fun thrill ride from start to finish. I knew what I was getting into when I went to the movie. I saw it alone and the action continues from the first part of the movie all the way to the end. I would definitely recommend seeing it in 3D with expectations for a non-stop thrill ride of fun and predictable outcomes. I thought the acting was better than in the first and this one had some added antagonists and a few new creatures to say the least. I found the 3D jumpscares very entertaining as typically this would be not the type of movie that I would pay to see but I was in the mood for a fun thoughtless wildly entertaining thriller with a predictable outcome and the Meg 2 satisfied.

title: So Terrible
text: If you thought of a film that China would produce missing the mark on everything and being 150% cheeseball - but in a pathetic - just got it wrong way - this is it.I can't believe some of the cast agreed to be in this abomination.It literally has no saving grace.From beginning to end it just gets worse and worse to the point you are embarrassed to be watching it - that is if you don't fall asleep (if you are a lucky one - you did fall asleep).Ill thought out - badly executed and plain stupid.Aside from which - they try to explain how our hero can survive swimming 25,000 feet in the ocean with the stupidest ... Oh never mind - the whole thing is moronic.

title: Wowee!
text: I don't normally review films but ye gods, this film (?) really moved me. I'll keep it brief. Also, I've had a few beers and I'm watching it on my father-in-law's TV without subtitles for the Chinese bits and it has that image smoothing thing on I think. That or the CGI really is this howling.Ben Wheatley - great director. What is he doing here? The first half's all in a dark little room/submarine? People just talking at screens. And then they finally go above surface and it's like a toddler's fever dream of a shark film. And not in a good way. At least the second half's semi-fun though.Isn't the cinematographer meant to be good? It's lit like an episode of Storage Wars. Looks like the budget was $8000, tops. And/or Warners have just given up.Enjoy!

title: This is Meg 2 cos those are 2 separate movies Chinese and English one squeezed into one monstrosity
text: Terrible movie. I expected silly entertainment, but this movie exceeded my worst expectations. Terrible acting, painful to watch and listen especially the terrible accent of Statham's Chinese sidekick, forced into the script to make the film pass through the Chinese censorship. The actor who plays him is known from such cinematic masterpieces as "Liu Lang (Wolf Warriors) 1 & 2, and at least 3 parts of "Zhan lang" , few "Zu Zong's" and few Pan Deng's' and it can be heard that so far he hasn't had much opportunity to practice his English with one exception the class D Scot Atkins flick, the rest of his cinematic output consists of films that are Chinese propaganda films that painfully show how great a country China is even in the face of the end of the world. Meg2 is not one film, but two - first one it is an English-language film about murderous mutant sharks and the other the Chinese one, is something like a Huawei advertisement where a righteous and brave Chinese inventor gets caught in the middle of a movie with sharks. Meg2 has huge problem with the chronology of events - as if someone tripped in the editing room and fell on the hardware before saving the final version. The drama is predictable and downright boring. Maybe I'm interpreting this work so negatively because I don't speak Chinese and there's too much of a cultural difference between me and the Chinese viewer to whom this film is aimed?

title: The movie script was written by a elementary school student
text:
So I can get the words to describe such an amazing story created by a boy or girl from an elementary school!!!Bravo !!! Yeaaayyyyy amazing!!Go and see I recommend!!!!I don't want to see this movie alone !I give a 4 star become of the effort of the team who work in this movie
The special effects and the rendering, the actors and actress get 2 stars and the best of the best is the history behind this movie!I see the movie until the end and I have to say that in 1980 shark movies put a very nice sound effects .... Keep moving forward??? No please do not make any other movie like this pleaseeee !!!

title: It's Not Epic But I Wouldn't Say It's Garbage
text: Wow. People are really going after this, huh?Look The Meg was no blockbuster and sorta ended up a bit of a disappointment. People who choose to watch this should've already known that and gone into it with the idea that this wouldn't be much better. At least, that was my mindset going into it.Was it pure gold? No. It wasn't. However, I actually ended up liking this film better than the first. I thought the story was much more interesting and I was a bit more invested.I wouldn't mind suggesting it but as I said, keep your expectations in check. You know what the first movie had to offer. This is more of the same. If you were frustrated with the first film, your likely be frustrated with this. If you found the first film tolerable, you might be like me and like this better.

title: Subtitle Should be 'The Stench' Because This STINKS!
text: Ok. The first Meg did ok at at box office so why was this done on the cheap?Everyone who watched this wanted only one thing - giant sharks - so why other Jurassic Park-esque rat/beaver whatever's?The sharks we DO get are really poor CGI - and as for the 'Meg Mouth Cam' shot - I burst out laughing.The story borrowed heavily from 'Underwater', with many nods to 'Jaws'.The supporting cast fell into slapstick mode by 2/3rds of the way in and were 'laughable' in the wrong way.They clearly couldn't afford Pedro Pascal as a baddie so got a tribute act in instead.I was foolish enough to buy this download without checking the reviews as I liked the first one so much - I was truly bitten.

title: Not Bad Seriously
text:
This movie had a lot to live on to however it lived up to it quite nicely
The Chinese man trying to speak English in the movie was an ear screech and ignoring the bad acting by some background actors as well as the main protagonist,this movie was decentThe physics of Jason forcing Air out of his nose trills at the bottom of the ocean doesn't add up,try going outside and you shall be crashed(not a pleasant sight). The Megs were done beautifully,the jump scare did their job and though it was obvious that the Chinese film industry had influence (not a bag thing),it was supposed to be subtle,more nunaced to give a better desirable effectI don't know why the previous actress didn't reprise her role but if she did,this movie would have been even betterOverall this is a fun movie,a blend of humour, entertainment and horror to watch on a Saturday night.Go in give it a try.

title: Worst Movie Ever
text:
I think Jason must have been thinking halfway through filming " What have I Done? "
It could not be anymore unbelievable.I thought I was watching a bad Sharknado movie.I guess pressure at the depths they were walking around at doesn't exist.The first Meg was not bad, I was looking forward to this one.Halfway through I was cheering for the meg. I think my brain stopped working and began to hurt but I continued to watch it to see how much more my senses could be offended. I so wanted Jason to be taken out so he would not have to commit to another sequel.Please tell me there wont be another.

title: Wtf
text: I'm a fan of bad movies from the Black and White era. And then there is this. Just don't. Really. Just. Don't. I loved and enjoyed the original Meg movie. But this is a new low. Meg 2 lacks any interest. We don't care about the characters. The bad guys are seemingly ancillary. And new sea monsters come from nowhere. There is zero suspense. And the bad quality lacks a laugh. This poor film takes itself seriously. And that is beyond said. I'm a huge fan of Jason Statham as a B movie action hero. This is beneath him. I write this as I still have 15 minutes remaining and hope that the credits are more entertaining.

title: This was just stupid. Why, why, why did you make this movie?
text: The best thing I can say about this movie is they didn't throw in a worthless nudity scene. This movie was stupid, bad, and formulaic. This was such an unnecessary and uninteresting movie. There was nothing that I liked in this movie. The story was bad. The actors were unmotivated. The director was asleep. The producer wasted a lot of money. For a while there, I thought they were trying to make a comedy, but all the jokes failed. In the end they made a version of the previous movie but left out all the parts that made it a worthy movie, like writing, a reasonable plot, acting, and good direction. Don't spend any money on this movie except as a gag Xmas gift for someone you don't like very much.

title: Fast and Furious with Sharks.
text: Atleast Jaws was a bit more believable that being said. This is not a film that is taking itself seriously. Its one of those fun popcorn movies that you can sit and enjoy after a long hard day and not have to really put any thought into it. Sometimes you just want large explosions and action that defies all physics. I can't even remember the story for the first one and most likely I will forget about this too in the near future but for now enjoyed it. If you are looking for serious thoughtful cinema look elsewhere, if you just want to watch a fun popcorn movie give this a watch. Give it a 6 out of 10.

title: Don't
text: Star wars is more real. Me achieving warp speed on a bike going uphill is more real. Swimming on Mars is more real.My cats act better. My 3 weeks old kid is more realistic and mature and can act betterCrows write better scripts. Earth worms have more brains than who wrote this.Who the hell approved this cesspit of uselessness I don't know but he/she and their family should be kept away from producing movies for generationsWhat I know for sure is that I want my time back and I should be paid in gold the equivalent of megalodon's weight for surviving this ordeal.Just be glad that I did and took time to write this review so you should never touch this.

title: Mildly entertaining but very chaotic
text: I enjoyed The Meg but it's sequel, Meg 2 definitely hit differently. Most of the characters are unlikeable and the plot was trash (which I can overlook for a great actin flick). They really did mash up just about every cliche (which mostly consisted of people repeatedly doing stupid things) and monster they could think of into this film. Keep your expectations low and be satisfied with some great shark carnage. This is the way. Anything more than that and you'll be unhappy. I enjoyed the action but likely will never watch Meg 2 again nor would I watch anything else from this series if it were to be made.

title: Loved it
text: I know a lot of people have given bad reviews but honestly I completely disagree. I won't go into too much detail as I don't think the movie deserves to be picked apart, the way some other reviewers have.I love a good shark movie and there are very few that are at the top of the list. However Jaws, Deep blue sea and Meg 1 & 2 are definitely my all time favourites.You have to take this movie with a pinch of salt, like with all shark related movies as all of them are pretty hard to believe.My only criticism is that, I know some parts of the movie are predictable, such as the sharks reaching the surface yet again and targeting a tourist island (same scenario in Meg 1), which in all honesty should at least have been a different concept. Maybe with the title being "The trench" it would have been more interesting to watch the characters fighting the sharks in their turf. However with that being said the movie doesn't dissapoint, with the inclusion of new and interesting creatures.The CGI I thought was brilliant. The sharks and other accompanying creatures are very realistic and badass. The sharks scenes are intense and thrilling.Jason Stathem taking on 3 gigantic prehistoric sharks?? I wouldn't expect anything less.If you want to watch a movie that is fun, entertaining and bonkers, this is the one. Ignore the haters because quite frankly for a shark movie, it's great. I have no problem paying to watch this again and I hope they bring out Meg 3.

title: It does what it intended.
text: If you're here for a second installment you already know what to expect but the opening scene does a great job at giving you an idea. I don't think you need to have watched the first one per say. Jason Statham does Jason Statham things and that's a good enough reason as any to watch a movie for me. Actions great with or without the prehistoric fish. There's things that happen that aren't logical but you're watching Meg, it's brain dead action movie and it delivers on that.The graphics are pretty good, only complaint I'd have is if the sharks, or anything big moves a little quicker, I guess they're sluggish cause if they're size but it would've been a little more thrilling. The green screen for the background was great, better than I expected and looks like they actually threw money and time into it. It's littered with last minute saves and coincidences that happen just to keep the plot going. It's pretty fun but I think at some point it felt like it was being dragged, a few things in the plot could've been hurried through or cut out, second half could be shorter. But it did go all out on the action, of course the story's nonsensical and predictable but the movie does what it set it to do, acting was decent from everybody so it didn't feel like you're just watching only for Statham kicking sharks. I wish we got to see more of the kraken octopus though, more integrated into the story, but the megs had to have the spotlight I guess.I think if you're going to watch this you're going with your brain shut off and in that regard it's close to as good as it could get. It's exactly what you'd expect, so if you're looking for dumb action you'll get it, it you dislike it for being silly I'd blame that on you 'cause you should've known lol.

title: A Meg 2 Far
text: "Meg 2: The Trench" wanted to explore the Mariana Trench but struggled to really do it justice. The first half was uninspiring and boring, the second half got more interesting but was too little too late in the film's two-hour runtime. Oceans make up 71% of Earth's surface, but only 5% has been explored. Over 80% of the world ocean is not yet mapped or observed; that pressing mystery is the film's unique selling point. But these great mysteries of the watery deep were rushed into. A suspenseful, well paced build-up was nonexistent, and that selling point was quickly squandered. Because the film is called "The Meg" it takes no guesswork to anticipate what's coming. They could have thrown a few other prehistoric sea predators to keep the audience on their toes or even surprised. They also could have also briefly gone into some interesting facts/details about these animals in a plotline consolidation scene to help the audience to properly appreciate these dangers of the deep from a paleontology perspective. Several of the film's jump scares were decent.The film's deep ocean exploration wasn't scientifically accurate and apparently broke the laws of deep-sea physics, which is tolerable as it's for "entertainment" purposes, but grates nonetheless when you think how unimaginative the plot is. I'm a fan of Director Ben Wheatley, but felt he wasn't given much creative licence here, having seen and admired his previous works, it just seems like this was a well paid job he was contracted to do transactionally. On this project not a lot of his signature directorial "fingerprint" really registered. Wheatley's signature natural and vernacular dialogue and acting methodology was nowhere to be seen. Much of the attention was instead predictably heaped upon Jonas Taylor (Jason Statham), the film's frontrunner. With DJ (Page Kennedy) having a few memorable moments and one-liners, as did Meiying (Shuya Sophia Cai). Statham's action sequences were pretty good in the second half though, he can really work a jet ski.5.4/10.

title: MEG 2 - THE TORTURE....
text: I had good expectation after watching the trailer because trailer of this film looks enjoyable & entertaining but the makers had easily fooled the audience in the film because there is nothing in the film that will excite you. First 20 mins God only knows what's going on the whole meg sequence is so dark that we can't even see the characters properly except for their voice. Conversation and the basic story plot goes on which makes no sense and it is very boring to watch. First part of Meg is so enjoyable and a thriller ride that keeps the audience hooked but this part is totally opposite of the 1st film. No storyline, no proper character development, screenplay is very weak and slow that will bore you till you sleep, even the actors performance feels below average. I don't know whh they had made this film if they don't have the proper story arc. Even the meg action sequences is so less that the time that Sequence will come you'll already tired of the film and want to leave the theatre.Jason Statham is the the only saving factor of this film rest below average.Highly Disappointed......

title: First half was great, but second half...meh!
text: "Meg 2: The Trench" took audiences on a thrilling deep-sea exploration and Megalodon hunt. With its attempt to improve upon its predecessor, the movie showcased significant potential. It managed to steer away from the A-rated label, yet despite its efforts, it still left viewers with mixed feelings. While the film provided an entertaining experience, it also suffered from several plot holes and inconsistencies. This review delves into the highlights and shortcomings of the movie, ultimately presenting an overall analysis of its merits and drawbacks.A Successful Attempt at Entertainment"Meg 2: The Trench" successfully captivated its audience with its intense underwater scenes and breathtaking visuals. The film's special effects team did an exceptional job of creating a realistic deep-sea environment and the majestic yet terrifying Megalodon. The tension built through the exploration sequences and the intense hunt for the prehistoric predator kept viewers engaged throughout the film.The attempt to tone down the explicit content and language from the first movie was commendable. By making it more accessible to a broader audience, "Meg 2: The Trench" managed to gain a wider fanbase while retaining its core appeal of adrenaline-pumping adventure.Loopholes in the DeepDespite its entertaining elements, "Meg 2: The Trench" suffered from several glaring loopholes in its plot. The transition from the initial deep-sea exploration to the hunt for the Megalodon felt rushed and lacked coherence. Some events seemed too conveniently orchestrated, leaving questions about the characters' motives and decisions.Furthermore, the science behind the prehistoric creature's sudden appearance in modern times was glossed over, leaving a sense of disbelief among some viewers. Exploring the concept of a living Megalodon required a more comprehensive explanation to maintain credibility within the movie's universe.A Balance Between Fun and FearThe film did succeed in creating a balance between moments of thrill and lightheartedness. The witty banter between the characters provided much-needed comic relief amidst the perilous situations they encountered. This interplay of emotions helped maintain a sense of enjoyment and entertainment, keeping the audience engaged.The portrayal of the Megalodon as both an awe-inspiring predator and a formidable threat contributed to the movie's overall appeal. The suspenseful chase sequences and underwater battles were well-executed, further enhancing the film's entertainment value.

title: A bit like a trench this film is filled with Sh**
text: But hey at least it's keeping Jason Statham in work....As we continue to learn throughout the world of cinema in 2023 if a film does well at the box office it's not a question of if it should get a sequel but how fast can we get it made.The Meg 2 is prime example of a cash in, somehow 2019s the Meg made half a billion dollars at the box office so here we are again with Jason Statham fighting giant cgi sharks.The plot is that a Trench has been discovered beneath the ocean floor which could house creatures as yet to be discovered by man. Therefore a team of I want to say conservationists (I may be wrong) that include the films star Jason Statham dive down to investigate after their company invents the technology to do so. What follows is about two thirds of the films worth of completely forgettable none-sense so much so that I'm actually struggling to remember what happens already. Followed by the inevitable last 30 mins balls to the wall action carnage and carnage is definitely how I would describe it. The film is disappointingly boring for most of its run time and the films final act isn't exactly groundbreaking as far as action films go, although with that being said it's considerably more entertaining that the first two thirds. None of the emotional moments land, you don't care about any of the characters and while bystanders seemed to get killed with ease the main cast seems near invincible.This film felt doomed to fail from the start and why a director with such skill as Ben Wheatley would sign on to this is beyond me. This is the man who gave us brilliant low budget British films like Kill List and Sightseers, why has he sunk to this to this level?Clearly the bright lights of Hollywood were too much to resist however hopefully and I mean this with the upmost respect he will now return to the British film industry as I can't see him having a load of offers on the table in Hollywood after this disaster.Not even Stathams charisma can save what is one of the worst films of the year.

title: Entertainment without seeking higher quality.
text: "Meg 2: The Trench", like its predecessor, tells a simple story but with entertaining moments, others not so many and others quite silly. The script is entertaining and full of clich√©s, made to have a fun time without pretentions. The cast puts in some decent performances for their typical action-adventure movie characters. The underwater cinematography is pretty good, but in the scenes on dry land it becomes very run-of-the-mill. The musical composition goes unnoticed as if it did not exist. The digital effects play a trick on quality, in many scenes they look like effects from a cheap TV movie from the '2000s and early '2010s, in a couple of scenes they manage to be good without major achievements. A decent film that is entertaining for much of its run but doesn't seek to stand out as a quality film.

title: The human action sequences make the presence of the Megalodons to sink to the bottom of the film.
text:
Meg 2: The Trench is the sequel to the first Meg movie from 2018. This sequel is directed by Ben Wheatley, director of Free Fire and Kill List
Jonas Taylor (Jason Statham) and his investigative team detect multiple threats surrounding the Trench. From here, prehistoric Megalodons and other, older sea creatures manage to escape and thus create dangers in the modern world.Jonas and his team must stop these creatures before innocent people are endangered. During this mission they learn that there is a mole in their team, which they scam to get out financially better with another party.Director Ben Wheatley has more experience as a director with action films, but tries to direct a monster film for a change. Thanks to the story, this movie comes across more as an action movie than a real monster movie. The film is more concerned with the betrayal of the mole and how this leads to two different parties facing each other. The presence of the Megalodons and the other sea creatures sink to the bottom of the movie because of this. So it ends more like a long-winded action movie without really interesting or comical moments instead of an exciting monster movie.Because Ben Wheatley has no real experience with monster movies, the visual effects of this movie also seem a bit less credible compared to the first Meg movie. The Megalodons and the other sea creatures seem most believable when they are in dark sea scenes. These dark scenes do provide a more realistic effect of the dark, deep sea, but because of the further darkness you as a viewer cannot clearly see what exactly is happening or is present. Because of this ambiguity, the film is no longer really exciting. The only danger is that sometimes a sea creature suddenly attacks the people from the darkness. This makes the film reminiscent of the film 47 Meters Down. They also copy moments from other films such as Jaws, Jurassic Park or Deep Blue Sea, so that this second Meg film loses a lot of its originality.Jason Statham does deliver good and appropriate acting as the main role of the film, but he was better in the first film and has actually done better acting in many other roles. Shuya Sophia Cai now also delivers good acting work as an older actress, but she deserves to act in better films. The other returning cast members also portray their characters well, but were also better in the first film. Of the new cast members, Jing Wu gives the best acting as Shuya Sophia Cai's uncle her character. The further, new cast members play more bland villains or else are more new prey for the Megalodons and the other sea creatures.

title: Deviated septums galore.
text:
I've given "Meg 2" some extra stars due to the extraordinary use of actors with serious "Millhouse Van Houten noses" instead of the usual Hollywood chiselled proboscis's. The lead actor's nose is actually a running gag if you'll pardon the pun. An Asian child actor doesn't have the usual button nose. Kudos! There are others :)
Noses aside, the movie is fanciful, but most of the soon-to-be-eaten actors play really annoying characters so we begin to feel a secret schadenfreude as each meet their grisly end. This is accompanied by an equally secret thankful admiration for the monsters of the deep as they rid the seas of annoying pests.Hundreds of bullets from other human enemies never hit our stars, and all the action belongs in a theme park.It's really just a 3 star movie with revolutionary and incredibley important noses.

title: What Walt's Watching
text:
The latest prehistoric shark movie "Meg 2: The Trench" picks up 4 years after where the first one left off and most of the original cast got chewed up and spat out, or worse.The Producers are saying: "New Meg, Old Chum!"
That's not a nice way to talk about Jason Statham.Meg 2 Director Ben Wheatley makes Jason Statham face off against not one but several giant, prehistoric sharks this time around.Naturally the only other talent to reprise their roles are those who didn't become shark faeces in "The Meg".This doesn't leave many cast from the original apart from Kiwi Cliff Curtis as "Mac".Shuya Sophia Cai is back as Meiying (who was cute as a child, but just downright annoying as a stowaway, smart mouthed teenager).And Page Kennedy as the token African American with the token moniker "DJ" returns.Of course in the interests of diversity there is Jing Wu who's a poor man's cross between Jet Li and Jackie Chan.Unfortunately he's neither funny nor gets to show off his martial arts skills.The producers should never have entrusted a Billericay Dickie like Ben with the directing duties for this sequel.In this outing we see a theme park along the lines of Jurassic Park and plenty of underwater shots in the 25,000 foot deep trench.They use Hi-Tech Submarines to navigate to the murky depths.Just ask the passengers of the Titanic Submarine how that ends...oh that's right you can't.In fact, the first hour of this film has very little Meg action."Jaws" got away with that in the Summer of 1975, but it's not going to cut it in 2023 with an estimated budget of $130 million dollars.The whole film feels like it was only made to serve an Asian market.There were so many subtitles I thought I was watching "Parasite", difference being this "Meg" movie has only picked up one award.I'd love to forgive "Meg 2: The Trench" for using so much bad science, but I've seen "Oppenheimer" this year, which made this movie look like "Dumb & Dumber To".That's right!The dumbest one from that franchise, not the original.Just wait till you hear how you pressurise a human body at 25,000 feet below sea level, it's stupidly hilarious.Warner Bros. Has a lot riding on the second film in this franchise (most of it on Jet Ski stunts) and were much looser with budgetary restrictions.However it wasn't money well spent.It doesn't even fall into the "it's so bad, it's good" category.It's just bad, with a few redeemable scenes, which you probably saw in the movies trailer.It only gets a 4 from me.#1 For somehow enticing bald, tiny, action man Jason Statham to come back as "Jonas".#2 The Megs (plural)
#3 "Pippin" is back, and,
# 4 Higher kill count
It's not much better than "5 Headed Shark Attack"...it's a real thing, a TV Movie made in 2017.I wanted to like this movie, because the first one was so much fun.It should a terrifying shark movie, instead it's downright laughable.

title: Just like the book, except completely different.
text: TLDR version: Same formula as first, but with less charm, humor, and absolutely nothing from the source material.I have a soft spot for shark movies. The first movie I ever saw was Jaws, and have been a sucker for any fin flick ever since.Shark movies are hard to do well. Jaws is obviously the gold standard, and then there's everything else. Deep Blue Sea was pretty good, if a bit brainless. Open Water was awesome, but not rewatchable. All these flicks have one think in common, in that the sharks have to have an active role in the plot, either contributing to the terror or having some element of personality.The first Meg movie understood this. Meg 2 reduces them to glorified extras. There's no depth to them. They are neither scary, nor to the seem to possess any sort of intelligence. They simply show up at predictable plot beats, eat nameless actors, and then submerge back into the depths.That's it. That's the movie.Statham is a bland version of Statham's Jonas Taylor character. There are so many attempts at witty banter and humor, all of which falls flat. The only chuckle I had in the film was realizing that the little dog in the movie (yes, the same little dog from the first movie is back) is named Pippet. A deep cut reference to the name of the wood-stick-chasing dog from the original Jaws.There are no stakes. No suspense. Even the attempted homage to Sam Jackson's surprise death in Deep Blue Sea, fails to register a jump scare.None of the plot points from the second book exist. They mash in some elements of the third book into this flick, but even then those plot points are stripped of any significance.Other than names and the fact that Mega are sharks, there's nothing of the books to be found in this movie. A generous 4-star (out of 19) review. Skip it.

title: Big Fish Boiiii!
text: I feel like the production team has a lot of good ideas, but are just not executed right. The script is actually decent if you look beyond the horrible editing, performance, pacing, production design, character motives... I take it back, the story is terrible.Wu Jing is a good actor, but that's only true when he's speaking Chinese. Whenever he speaks English, he can't act, and he can't speak. His accent is so bad that I simply cannot take any scene seriously when English is in his mouth. Ironically, his lines in Chinese are actually very well-written (I'm Chinese), but the translation is so bland it sucks out all the joy of it. So when he's speaking Chinese and doing a great job, regular audience don't get it fully, and when he's speaking English, audience just fully don't get it.Jason Statham also did quite a terrible job, but his badness is diluted but Wu Jing's accent. Always that tough guy look, tone, stance from Fast and Furious, as main character aura glows throughout the movie above his big bald stupid head. Also, not sure if it's because he's too short or the actress who plays Meiyin grew too fast, whenever they share a scene they look like they about to kiss each other. The little bow fixing, flirty glances, awkward hugs... I'm almost dug a hole all the way to wherever Fun Island is with my toe at the end of the film, and the process is not fun at all.Bad film, so bad it makes me wanna watch the first one again. The fight between Meg and giant octopus was alright though.

title: Stunning scenes and thrilling action
text: Quite a stunning film with amazing representations. 3 megs just made it spectacular and more thrilling. Over rated action but I loved it. Definitely recommend it for all ages. Definitely the modern jaws. If your looking for a good Friday night watch this is the go, it will surprise you. Expectations will be met then boosted. The jumpscares are great and send a chill down you back. The megs where very well screened, they were so enthralling that you could leave to go to the bathroom. Worth your time and money to watch it. Jason Stratham once again fulfilled his role with great enthusiasm and he just kicked the movie right off. Well done.

title: Chinese propaganda wrapped in a clich√© bow.
text: Blatant Chinese propaganda. The Chinese character, is portrayed as the daredevil, the genius, and the expert who knows everything. He is also the one who saves the day in the end.In addition to the Chinese propaganda, the film has also has poor acting, its ridiculous plot, and its lack of scares. The film is a mindless action sequel that offers few thrills and even fewer laughs."The Meg 2: The Trench is a terrible film. It is boring, predictable, and full of clich√©s. The acting is wooden, the plot is nonsensical, and the special effects are subpar. The only thing that the film has going for it is its underwater setting, which is visually impressive.If you are looking for a good action movie, I would recommend avoiding Meg 2: The Trench. It is a waste of time and money.

title: Pretty entertaining movie
text: I think it isn't bad as people say. I enjoyed very much. The meg scenes are very good and jumpscares are terriyfing. But i want more meg scenes. Jason statham's action scenes are so goddamn good. It's very stupid but very entertaining to. The other characters are good but it could be better. You can watch this movie 3d. It' one of the best action movie in this year. It' better than Ant man 3,Transformers and The Flash. Technicial the cinemotagraphy and visual effects are meh. I like Jing wu and his motivation. Meying is so cute and i like her too. Action is good. And the trench scene is good. Watch this movie guys.

title: 4/10 because 2018's THE MEG was a 5/10. This sequel is 60% of the film was bad.
text: Pretty mid movie. Nothing mind blowing. I was not a exciting or want to keep watching type movie. Definetely a one down grading because this is a 4/10 as the first one was 5/10. But you can get through the 1hr 56 minutes. Story is kind of a made ridiculous in the moment. Visual Effects aka Graphics and CGI on three sharks were dissapointing for a 2023 sharkbuster movie but there were some comedic scenes that I felt like it's not funny I was not laughing at all, I would rather watch Spingebill on YouTube that is way funnier than this. Please do not see this film because it will make you feel you left with dissapointment. 47 Meters Down and Jaws 1 & 2 were very good. The Meg and this sequel not the best franchise to me but there only one time watch and never watch them again or don't see this movie at all (thanks to critics), whether you choose its up to you.

title: Really Good Sequel
text: Ben Wheatley's "Meg 2: The Trench" is a poorly made giant shark movie that fails to bring the exuberant personality and boundary-pushing creativity of his previous films. The movie is plodding and poorly made, allowing the giant shark to take a backseat to an evil underwater drilling operation. Jason Statham's performance as Jonas, the deep-sea diver employee of the Zhang Institute, is visibly bored. The sequel reveals that the research facility has even kept one in captivity to continue studying it. Jiuming, the head of the institute, is even convinced that he can train the megalodon, but everything goes wrong when it escapes. The movie is not just a shark-escape-attack movie, but it is not as simple as it could be. The film "The Trench" by Jon Hoeber, Erich Hoeber, and Dean Georgaris focuses on a fugitive meg who escapes while the crew is focused on something else. Instead of focusing on the fugitive meg, the script sends Jonas and his crew deep into the ocean to the trench that megalodons have called home for centuries. They discover other megalodons and evil humans mining the trench for resources. Jonas and his team stumble upon an illegal operation in the middle of the ocean, leading to their vessels being destroyed. The sequence where they are forced to walk the ocean floor to a facility is poorly executed, with few personality-less characters getting chomped or blown up. Meiying (Sophia Cai) saves most of the faux tension. Jonas, Jiuming, Meiying, and a few others eventually make it back above the surface, fleeing the facility overrun with soldiers. They head to a resort called Fun Island, where they finally have a little fun, but it's far too little and far too late. The sequel to the deep-sea monster attack movie The Meg 2 is a dinosaur-shaped dud, despite the Stath-v-megalodon interaction and numerous shots of gigantic, battle-scarred fins. The Meg 2 steals from other pictures (think Jurassic Shark) and throws extra creatures into the mix, including multiple megalodons, ocean-dwelling fish-lizard-creatures, an unheralded tentacled monster, and a rapacious forces of consumerism represented by a silky-voiced villain. The screenplay loses the essential purity of the "man v shark" premise of the original and finds itself fighting a battle on multiple fronts. Wheatley's writing is ill-served by delivering OTT action but lacks the punchy, cynical humour and crackling dialogue of Free Fire. The main issue is the complete chemistry vacuum between the cast, who appear to be delivering their lines in isolation, oblivious to the other actors who are sharing the screen at any given time. The franchise needs to be buried at the bottom of the Atlantic for a couple of decades, along with some illegally dumped nuclear waste, perhaps then it might finally mutate into something entertaining. Jason Statham returns as Jonas Taylor in Meg 2, but the film fails to provide enough background on his past aquatic cryptozoology adventures. The absence of Li Bingbing's character Suyin Zhang leads to the replacement of Suyin's brother Jiuming as Statham's buddy. This lack of romantic tension deflates Meg 2, as Statham falls back into his previous action-hero stereotypes. Sophia Cai returns as Suyin's daughter Meiying Zhang, but the film's nameless companions and the imbalance between deep terrors and B-movie ambitions are superficial.

title: Nope
text:
ABSOLUTELY DIRE
I LOVE a shark film, Jaws is my favourite movie of any kind by a country mile. Deep Blue Sea is definitely in my top 10 and I kind of enjoyed The Meg for what it was. This however was a whole other kettle of fish , plotholes all over, truly awful acting and dialogue and was left wishing all the actors involved got chomped. 3rd act is nigh on a carbon copy of the first film for inexplicable reasons.I went with my sister who also loves a shark film and for her Statham is a thing .We both left the cinema in silence then laughed WTAF was that?We both considered walking out but both thought the other was enjoying it to a degree.This is the first review I've seen fit to post it's that bad.I rated it 3 , one for each shark.

title: A lacklustre sequel
text: I wasn't expecting great things from Meg 2. At best I was hoping for some mindless fun, but the film largely fails to deliver even this.Mostly this is because, like most monster movies, it gets too bogged down with uninteresting human melodrama. All of the sub plots and character interactions just feel so bland and uninspired, and dilute the main attraction of the film, which is of course the big shark action. As a result I actually think this film has a criminal lack of Meg action, and this made the whole thing lacking in tension slightly.As mentioned, the human side of things is lacking, and this is mostly due to the abundance of cliches, be it the characters themselves, the writing, or the performances. It's all just so generic and formulaic that it becomes a chore to even listen to the dialogue by the end of the film.At nearly 2 hours the film is far too long, and its pacing suffers slightly as a result. I really don't think a film with this premise should have you checking your watch.To give this film some credit, there are some pretty exciting sequences, but they are just too few and far between. The whole thing just needed more tension, more pace, and less distracting human drama.Meg 2: The Trench is a bit of a disappointment. I was hoping for some mindless fun, but it is just too frustrating to really deliver much enjoyment.

title: A sequel that fails to make a splash
text: When Ben Wheatley announced himself with his excellent sophomore horror outing Kill List in 2011, there was a hope that the talent on display in that feature wasn't going to be used in the decades after on films like Meg 2: The Trench.Sadly in 2023, here we are.A sequel to the fun if not exactly memorable big shark outing The Meg from 2018, The Trench sees the return of Jason Statham's one man eco-warrior and shark disposer Jonas Taylor, who along with a collection of new and old friends finds himself coming face to face once more with the most fearsome creatures of the deep, creatures that sadly don't get much of a chance to take centre stage in Wheatley's film, that for the most part squanders a potentially great set-up on a bland thrills and chills that will make one long for the razor sharp teeth of destruction to come in and save the day.Filled with as to be expected trite dialogue (at one stage a character asks someone why a previously captured shark is swimming in the ocean, only for the answer to be "she must have escaped?") and cookie cutter side characters, that this time around includes Chinese superstar Jing Wu as kindly billionaire Jiuming and Sienna Guillory in a rather thankless role as corporate woman Driscoli, The Trench is going to disappoint many who came along to see the films dorsal finned stars take the spotlight, only to find them hidden in the shadows for much of the films first half that is going to bore rather than grip viewers.Spending more time delving into the deeps that the first film only scratched the surface of, Wheatley had a chance to create something fun and unique here as our main ensemble go to previously unexplored depths but once we enter into the black abyss after a strangely stagnant and po-faced intro section, The Trench gets bogged down into a CGI heavy slog that goes for far too long, leaving the films bonkers and insanely over the top finale on and around "Fun Island" with too much work to do to salvage a film that wasn't able to give us enough of what we wanted to see for too many minutes of screen-time.There's no doubt The Trench knows what it is, every few minutes there's a quip, an unbelievable moment or Jason Statham being Jason Statham but there's no denying that this is one of Wheatley's least inspired film yet in a career of topsy-turvey outings, at least even the worst type of Wheatley films like In the Earth and High-Rise had an eye on doing something differently with The Trench happy to coast along on its big budget, delivering nothing more than a few moments of fun in an otherwise bland and washed ashore refuse of a feature.Final Say -Meg 2: The Trench seems to understand what it is but fails at the same time to focus on what would've made it the next B-grade guilty pleasure, with a bland first half that will have viewers dozing off on the high-seas, not even an explosive and chaotic final act can help this sequel make a splash.2 figurines out of 5Jordan and Eddie (The Movie Guys)

title: Poor attempt at being like Sharknado
text: I watched and liked the first Meg movie so I thought this one would be just as good or maybe similar. I was sadly disappointed with how this one was. It felt like they were trying way too hard to make it work. While they do have some good jump scene, they don't have a great plot. There is some level of hilarity to expect but this one doesn't even come close to being funny, rather it makes you scratch your head and wonder how this got approved the way it was laid out. Save your time by watching something else that is actually good, funny, and suspenseful. Unfortunately, this one is a good one to skip.

title: Light hearted fun sequel
text: It really hasn't changed too much from the original. Worthy nice two hour distraction. Jason is Jason and there is no disappointments whatsoever. Even thought it's predictable, liked how some of the bad guys got their due. Like the first, some actors are very good supporting cast and a few a bit of "huh?". They could have chopped out a few unnecessarily questionable scenes involving the kid but I guess this is to cater to the Chinese market. The trailers do show a Jaws like scene when everybody is to get out of the water but it was a bit surprising how long it took a lot of people to get out of the water. Once in a while you need some silliness, embrace the silliness with this one.

title: Meg(a) disappointing.
text: If you've seen the trailer for 'Meg 2: The Trench (2023)', you've seen all you need to see; the minute of man-on-meg action you get in the preview is pretty much the same minute you get in the final result. There's some decent, super silly stuff in the last act that ought to be fun in its own schlocky way, but it's far too little far too late. By the time you get to what you came for, the feature has bombarded you with a boring and barely-there plot that lacks any sense of danger or escalation (despite a number of deaths). Worse still, it doesn't really spend all that much time on its titular beast(s) - or, rather, it doesn't give them enough attention (they're just sort of... there?). The flick just feels as though it's been cobbled together with the least amount of effort and passion possible. It's genuinely dull no matter what's happening. I can't believe this is directed by Ben Wheatley, who - for all his faults - usually at least has a distinct vision. It's one of the - if not the - worst movies I've seen all year. I'd say it was meg(a) disappointing, but I didn't think it would be any good in the first place.

title: If You Hated it, You Probably Missed the Point of the Movie
text: Anyone who watched this movie and is complaining about the ridiculousness of it, completely missed the point of this movie, which is to be ridiculous! It's like ordering a hamburger and then complaining that it contains beef. This movie is absolute over-the-top nonsense in the very best way. Everything about it is impossible and completely illogical.This is what makes it so much fun to watch. I laughed out loud and was thoroughly entertained. The performances of the actors seemed to acknowledge this, without being self-conscience about it. At its worst, it was completely stupid; at its best, completely fun and engaging.It's not the worst thing to spend two hours being mindlessly entertained.

title: Same ol' same ol'
text: I didn't see the first Meg, because I knew what would happen. What convinced me to go was the preview, i.e, the food chain scene, which was copied from Jurassic Park. The walking underwater scene was way too long. However, what gets me is the octopus in the movie. We all know that there's going to be a fight between the octopus and the Meg. But when it happens it is so short and quite frankly a dud! Why is it when film makers have scenes like this, they always cut it short. ALWAYS! I was expecting a serious battle between the two and it was totally insignificant. In fact, you really don't know who won. Simply awful! Could've been cut out altogether. It reminded. Me of Godzilla King of the Monsters. Fans want to see those battles, but directors cut them out. Cut out that stupid dog. Did we really have to be inundated with the amphibious creatures throughout. We want creature fights in movies like this. Won't go back for an encore.

title: This is completely mind blowing!!!
text:
Howdy fellow movie enthusiasts! I'm Karen, a proud Texan at the ripe age of 56, and I just had to share my thoughts on "Meg 2." Y'all, let me tell you, this film is nothing short of amazing; it's as cool as a Texas breeze on a hot summer day! It's safe to say that this is hands down the best movie I've seen since the unforgettable "Titanic.""Meg 2" took me on a heart-pounding journey beneath the waves, and I was on the edge of my seat from start to finish. The underwater world they've created is truly mesmerizing, with jaw-dropping visuals that made me feel like I was diving alongside the characters. The action sequences were so intense that they had my heart racing faster than a bull at a rodeo.What's even better is that this film isn't just for us grown-ups; my kids were absolutely captivated by it too! It's a rare gem that manages to strike a chord with different generations. The storyline was engaging and kept all of us hooked, young and old alike.And speaking of greetings from Texas, yee-haw indeed! I couldn't help but feel a swell of pride as a Texan watching this movie. The spirit of adventure and tenacity displayed by the characters resonated with that classic Lone Star state attitude.So, whether you're a seasoned moviegoer or just looking for a film that the whole family can enjoy, "Meg 2" is an absolute must-see. Grab your popcorn and buckle up for a wild underwater ride that'll leave you talking long after the credits roll. Here's to more movies like this that unite generations and deliver unforgettable cinematic experiences. Until next time, y'all! ü§†üé¨üåäWarmest regards from the heart of Texas (TX),
Karen.

title: It REALLY needed to be RATED R ! But otherwise mindless fun monster movie.
text: I will say it right away, this movie should had been Rated R ! Its a fairly enjoyable movie but when you have giant sharks and monsters eating and killing peoples left and right and there is basically no blood, no gore, water as clear as it can be, it totally kill my "suspension of disbelief".That being out of the way ... This movie is kinda different from the first. They already know about the Trench, the Megs and everything. So they kinda blend a lot of different stuff to make a hodge podge of a movie. You have Jason Statham doing action scenes like fist fights, wich he didn't from what i recall in the first. You have some tension scenes. And finally the movie at some point just become one of those monster movies where plenty of peoples dies and you just enjoy (but without much blood as i mentioned).Since i saw it in theatre some of the scenes looked cool on the big screens. Don't get me wrong, its really one of those "gotta turn your brain off" movie and really do not try to find logic in some of the situations, but if you do this, you should had a good time. I REALLY wish tough an UNCUT version would release on bluray, altough i doubt adding THAT MUCH blood and gore (to match what happen) would be possible without the movie looking weird as it was made to be PG-13.

title: Garbage
text: Garbage garbage garbage garbage and so much garbage. This is one of the worst movies ever made. Dumb plot, idiotic acting, pure rubbish. What a waste of time. Who in the world created this movie? Have your head examined, and who cast all these sub par actors, was there even acting in this, because it is just an amalgamation of nonsense piled from other action movies and assembled with Scotch tape into the biggest piece of junk ever made. And who cares about the Chinese speaking trash . Really, simply don't watch because it will upset your stomach or make you nauseated, erase this junk from it all.

title: Silly movie which is almost a parody of itself, but still kinda fun
text: To no surprise this is not a good movie. You can tear this apart bit by bit and on almost any point this film is silly and pretty bad. However the movie also know this, and does not try to be anything else. The acting is solid, and the production value is pretty good. At the end of the day, if you have absolutely nothing else to do this is not so bad, it is even kinda fun at times.First of, you cannot take this for serious. If you sit down and watch this and immediately start complaining, seriously? I mean, look at the name of the movie and the movie poster and the trailer, what did you expect? Secondly this is not the worst C-movie you have ever seen. Sure it is laughable and almost cliche but also a bit entertaining. I can see myself having a few beers and a pizza late at night watching this just for passing time.My main issue with this movie is not the production value or the silliness, or big CGi sharks. All those things I can forgive. As said this movie know what it is, and for what it is its not so bad. What I cannot forgive is the cliches - an evil corporation using big enormous sharks for shadowy stuff? Oh, that is original... And the message seem to be that capitalism is bad and we should not allow executives to come near water. Very tiresome.I give this a generous 4/10. This is a pretty bad movie, but it is a watchable bad movie so if you have nothing else to do, why not? You can definitely do worse.

title: Not as bad as the critic score
text: Meg 2 is an action adventure film directed by Ben Wheatley and like the previous film it follows a group of scientists that must outrun and outswim the megaladons when a mining operation threatens their missionI think the meg 2 was an ok film. It was better than the first one so far.the film definitely wasn't good as the Audience are saying but did have some enjoyable moments and more action than the first one and the only difference it makes is that there are are more creatures in this movie than they were in the other one they both are mid but the other creatures just make this film a little bit better than that one. If you liked the last meg and adventureful shark films you might like this one too.

title: Off-the-rails
text:
Nothing but cocaine-fueled writing that is so dumb it's fun. The first half has a new tone that expands this world in a good way. The rest is complete nonsense that goes all out in extreme ways. Embrace the stupidity & enjoy..

title: 4 is more than it deserves
text: Imagine professional people with all these technology wearing pant with nice belt and fancy dress shirt diving 25000 ft deep in the ocean...just imagine that!!! Where is the diving suit... too much CGI for no reason... really I can't make any connection between sharks and lizards came from everywhere...and that giant octopus appeared from nowhere...Jason Statham just disappointed me in this movie, and I can't understand why he act I a movie like this one after Wrath of Man...it was very good compared to this!! I couldn't put less than 4 as a rate..just because I like Jason and wouldn't make it zero..

title: This is for fans of 80s action films.
text: This movie is silly mindless fun but it is 80s silly mindless fun. The action isn't just over the top. It's over over the top. Every moment that can be dramatic is 100% dramatic and a near death experience.Every explosion almost gets someone. Every close call with a Meg is the closest of close calls. It is so ridiculous but it's glorious.Jason Statham is single handily keeping the 80s action movie alive. He's embraced his role as the star of these utterly ridiculous action movies and he's great in them.As far as the movie goes it is what it is. Writing is fine. Acting is okay. CGI is laughable at times.I see people complaining not enough Meg but I think it's enough. The octopus is a nice touch. Overall just enough creature mayhem for me.I give this an 8/10 as an 80s action movie not as a great piece of cinema.

title: Jurassic Shark
text: This movie is bad, but really fun. All of the creatures were over the top as is everything else in this movie. Jonah has turned into a eco warrior and he's running around beating people up fighting pollution so he's basically a brooding Captain Planet. Most of the crew from the first is back minus Ruby Rose and Bingbing. There's a few other new additions, but the biggest is Wu Jing who is a huge star in China so this movie is going to crush it in China and pretty sure that's the only reason he's in this. He just feels like when another actor replaces the original actor of a longtime character like in the show Spartacus. There is winks and nods at other shark movies like Deep Blue Sea and Jaws the Revenge. I didn't like not having Rose and Bingbing back and my other issue was it's like two movies in one. The beginning is save the planet from people to suddenly having to save the planet from monsters. The first half slogs, but the last half goes completely bonkers.If you liked the first one then you'll like this one. If you didn't like the first don't waste your time because you're not gonna like this one either.

title: Better watch any old shark movie
text: Waste of time and money,its like watching cartoon.Go and watch old shark movies those seams more realistic and scary.in order to make the hero shine they actually forgot the theme of thw movie. Not at all scary at every point its more of comedy and scie-fie movie. Sharks looks likes cartoon. No work of ahark ina shark movie.Go and watch jaws or anyother sharks movies they will thrill you more .Complete waste of time and miney, wanted to leave theatre in half way only.actors in this movie are more powerfull than batman and superman,can tear shark in half with bare hands,no logic, no making of sense.

title: It's insultingly stupid
text:
This movie is made for specific audience.Only people with brain damage can take anything seriosly in this movie
Species evolving over the course of an hour or two, guy is swiming without suit on 7500 meters deep (it's okay he has deviated septum) there arr predatory undertones between main character ans 14 yrs old girl. Stupidity of this movie is so toxic, I wanted to leave after 30 minutes. This is movie for kids without any kind of basic in reality at all. The main actor is brooding around being a tough guy which was so fricking funny (I'd say it was the funniest part of the movie) It's pity.

title: Attraction Ride
text: It was great action combined with a great story around Meiying played by Shuya Sophia Cai who also played in The Meg (2018). This film has also a lot of dark humour and made me laugh at times. There are various creatures besides the meg surfacing to visit us. Luckily The Stat is back with his friends to take care of them.This is truly a movie where to expect what to expect. Jason Statham is always great in this kind of action movies. He brings you seriouness, humour and action. It was a real rollercoaster ride! This one is for you if you wanna sit down, grab a big box of popcorn, enjoy and have fun seeing big sharks in action.

title: Silliness and goofiness only gets you so far
text: Well, I went into this movie not expecting much. I enjoyed the first one, so I figured I'd give one a shot, too. I said to myself, "I'm only here for big sharks and people getting chomped". It just wasn't enough to carry everything else.The acting was terrible. The CGI was meh. The absolute dismissal of anything to do with deep water physics. And, by that, I mean * absolute *. They're not ten feet down, people!I walked out of the first one entertained. I walked out of this one wishing I had the nine bucks to buy a cheap burger.I'd say wait for it to hit a streaming service, but I don't think it's even worth your time.

title: Not Enough Meg but still a fun time
text: I was going into The Meg 2 will optimism since the first movie I really loved but with this it has that same charm as the first film it seems to be going in a direction that doesn't fit Shark movies while the shark action I loved here and was more bonkers then the first but I felt there was too little of it and it felt a big chunk of the movie was around this evil organization that didn't need to be in the movie I came to see Megalodon action againt Jason and everything else the trench has such as a giant Kraken and while it delivered on that,there was too little of it which I feel weighs the movie down. All in all the last 30 minutes makes up a little bit for it but if your expecting the runtime to be beat for beast Megalodon action you may be a little disappointed.
