title: BAD
text: The meg 2 movie looks awesome when I first saw the trailer and since then I am very much waiting to watch this movie although I had not watch the first Meg movie due to mixed reviews but glad I did not watch the first because second one is awful in my opinion shallow movie not much to offer very bad comedy, acting is also average and action is not very well done last 20-25 minutes are here to watch but these are also mediocre. Jason Statham is just a superhero without powers fighting giant sharks. I like Jason Statham even with Jason Statham this movie is a flop. No thrill at all in this movie.

title: Awful movie, total waste of time.
text: Script is as seen in hundreds of similar moves; acting is really terrible, leading actors are "just doing their work" and supporting cast is typecasted from the rest of similar movies, complete with their fully predictable actions; CGI is really bad and completely unconvincing, totally ridiculous, with a few exceptions of frontal shots of megalodon which are nice but don't really redeem the rest.At the end of the day, this move is just another "summer movie", time certainly not well spent except one is truly dying of boredom. However, this movie will not help at all due to all aforementioned deficiencies.Awful.

title: skip the first hour
text: Jonas Taylor (Jason Statham) is catching polluters on the high seas. He and his friends on Mana One have also been researching the Megalodon in the depths of the Mariana Trench. They come to battle a nemesis doing illegal mining and try to rescue tourists at a tropical resort.I don't remember the story from the first Meg. I don't even remember that Statham was in it. All I remember is a giant shark eating tiny people. That's all I really want from the sequel. Chomp! Chomp! I don't actually care about the human story. I'm not carrying anyone forward from the first movie. That's a problem for the first hour. It takes over an hour before they get to the resort and the tasty tourists. Once it gets there, the movie becomes cheesy ridiculous people-eating action fun. Quite frankly, impatience viewers should just fast-forward the movie and you won't miss a thing.

title: Disappointing to say the least.
text: I gave the first movie a 5 just because the idea and narrative of the movie were depicted fairly. Still it lacked quality and that wasn't there.As for the Meg-2 however, it came extremely short and nothing more than a low end movie. So 1 would only do justice.I understand fiction and thriller can become extreme sometimes, but once it is mixed with BS and too much crap, then it becomes kids movie.Also, the movie has drifted away from the Meg and the Meg is just a aide story.I do not recommend watching this movie. Jason Statham did not do a favour to himself and his fans playing in this movie.

title: Weaker version of the first one
text: Movies being what they are these days there will probably be more sequels. I don't think there should be, from an artistic viewpoint. If it makes money they will repeat as many times as they can.Meg 2 brings very little thats new.The whole premise is predictable, and less enjoyable.Take The Meg, Jaws, several generic disaster movies, stick bits together, add in some double crossing and extinct animals and you're there.That said, it is enjoyable, its just not original or particularly memorable.Switch off, enjoy the humour, root for the big fish and its friends. Don't expect a masterpiece.

title: Don't expect too much from this movie, BAD ACTING
text: We watched this movie last night and I was shocked as to how bad this movie was. We made it througj the entire movie though. I typically enjoy Jason's movie and can re watch them. The first Meg Movie was enjoyable to watch. And I can re watch it. This new movie, how did the bad acting of the other actors get past the casting crew. Was this movie paid for by the Chinese? The Actor Wu Jing. Sienna Guillory and Sergio Peris. Bad,Bad,Bad acting. CGI to the Max. Way over the Top. Jason you need to rethink your choices in the movies you do in the Future. Act with other good actors for more enjoyable Flicks.

title: I guess I don't find things over the top
text: Most of the people that watched this movie hated it for being over the top, and I guess I kind of understand this. However, I suppose I don't find many movies over the top, such as Old, Black Adam, or the two Escape Rooms to name some movies labeled over the top that I really loved. Meg 2 is another one of these over the top movies that I found entertaining throughout it's never ending action, intensity, and decent amount of humor. If you're like me and rarely find movies over the top, then don't hold yourself back from watching the Meg 2 due to it's low ratings like I was going to do, for you'll have a fun time watching this.

title: so bad....it's boring
text: Although a big badget shark film with statham in it and yet it fails as a movie to deliver the goods if u exclude like last 20-30 minutes or so.Unfortunately this entry is nowhere near the original meg film which also was not a masterpiece but still delivered the goods if u are a shark film fan.The movie had a ridiculus plot and the villains were laughable and so idiotic their motives.They even tried to present the meg as a...pet which can be controlled...etc..bull stuff.A bad and boring film alltogether with only last 30 minutes or so to be entertaining enough with the big sharks final showdown and massacre and also the inclution of other monsters as well like that superb giant octopus.Even if u like b-shark films u will be disappointed by this big budget film especially like 30-40 minutes in the middle of the film were so boring u want to go fast-forward.Grade // C-

title: Move over Jaws the revenge there's a new worst shark film
text: I'll start off saying I enjoyed the first Meg (7/10), I went into the cinema knowing was going to be one of those films where I switch my brain off and just enjoy the ride and that's exactly what I didWent into this one with the same mindset but jeez it's so bad! The acting, the plot, the effects just everything about this film is poor. And for a film about Megs it takes halfway through the film for them to actually show up. We get a plot in the middle so boring I was thinking about turning it off and wish I had because it never got any better!How hard is it to make a good film about giant sharks!

title: An Average But Fun Film
text:
One of the more popular monster films in previous years has its sequel Meg 2: The Trench and yesterday I had the chance to watch it and here is my review for it. The premise of the film is years after the events of the first film, the group of scientists look to explore more of the ocean and this leads to the ire of many different enemies.Main Character
Jason Statham is back to reprise his role as Jonas Taylor and he gives a very similar performance to the one he gave in the first film. He is pretty stoic with a deadpan humour but there hasn't seemed to have been too much character progression between the two films. Statham works in this role but it isn't the most interesting character ever.Supporting Characters
Jing Wu plays Jiuming and he may be my favourite character in this film. He is just filled with so much enthusiasm and excitement during the film, I liked his chemistry with the other characters and he was a real star here for me.Shuya Sophia Cal reprises her role as Meiying. I didn't talk about her in my last review but she was an okay child actor, but she is slightly older here and I thought she was much better. She has good chemistry with the other actors and I think this could be the start of a longer successful career for her.Cliff Curtis reprises his role from the first film and gets way more to do here and you can tell he is having so much fun in this film. He is very entertaining and is clearly a great part of this film and I am glad there was more for him to do here.Page Kennedy reprises his role as DJ and I found him really annoying in the first film but he was really funny in this film. He has learnt from the experiences of the first film and it leads to some really funny sequences. Just in general, this group of characters together is way more entertaining then the people that was in the first film.Story
I criticised the story of the first film but at least that story was pretty simple and focused on The Meg. This film is all over the place and tries to focus on way too much, it does the worst thing a film this can do, it takes itself seriously. The film is at its best when it is just silly but whoever decided on these plot points missed a lot of that.Script
The script was funnier then the first film. The last half of the film had me laughing pretty consistently and everything was so over the top that it just worked. The drama is hammered onto the first half of the film especially and it just does not work, even though I enjoyed the performances, it was hard to truly care about what was going on.Style
The style of the film is more mixed this time, the film looks great. The film spends more time exploring the ocean so is forced to use more CGI and I think the majority of it looks really great. The action scenes are fun and the last 20/30 mins of the film were the absurd action that I wanted. But the pacing was just off, the first half of the film was a bit boring and dull and then the 2nd half was ridiculously fast paced and it made the film feel a bit unbalanced.Overall
Overall, Meg 2: The Trench is an average film. It is similar to its predecessor that if you want to watch a film that sees a lot of crazy action and funny one liners then this is the film for you but as a film it really isn't that great.Rating - 5/10.

title: JAWS, YOU ARE OUT OF YOUR LEAG!
text: THAT was FUN!!!This felt more like a version of JAWS in a clown suit. The most fun i ever had for 2 hours. Maybe the should hire J. BOND And Jaws for the next MEG so they can make a stew on this one.. Or maybe Jaws can chew them to bits with his steel teeth next time. I hope that they speed up the next movie so wee don' t have to wait 2 hours to se the end of that movie. But , still a fun movie and worth to watch again if you don't have anny thing otherwise to do that day. IF you can take that presure on that depth were they going next time. If not, see Spielberg's JAWS. A lot more fun and MORE rhan this.

title: Beyond terrible
text: The Meg 2 left me quite disappointed. As someone who found the first installment watchable, this sequel felt like a considerable step backward. To be honest, I even contemplated not watching it until the end.One of the aspects that stood out to me was the noticeable shift in tone and pacing. The first movie managed to strike a balance between suspense and action, creating an enjoyable aquatic thriller. In contrast, The Meg 2 seemed to lean heavily towards over-the-top action sequences, often at the expense of character development and plot depth. It felt like the filmmakers were trying too hard to outdo the original, resulting in a somewhat chaotic narrative.Another point worth mentioning is the cultural aspect. It's evident that this film was made with a different target audience in mind, China, and this may explain the disconnect for Western viewers. While the first movie had a broader appeal, this sequel seemed to cater more to a specific taste, which might not align with what Western audiences typically look for in entertainment.In conclusion, The Meg 2 failed to capture the essence that made its predecessor enjoyable. It's a reminder that cultural differences in entertainment preferences can have a significant impact on how a film is received. While it had some visually appealing moments, the sequel's departure from the balanced formula of the first film left much to be desired. If you're a die-hard fan of the franchise, you might still find moments to enjoy, but for most viewers, it falls short of expectations.

title: Madness
text: I went into this with my 7yr old as he loves the 1st one. It started off all serious but then just descended into absolute madness and I was all for it lol.Dinosaurs, Sharks, baddies and yes Pippen was back lol. Jason Statham was his usual charming self, the supporting cast who made it out the trench were funny too. I'm not sure why it was called the Meg 2, The Trench though as there was hardly any Megs until the last 30mins and they didn't spend that long in the Trench.This was just 2 hrs just to switch off and not have to think about anything.If you want total escapism and action packed adventure with all sorts thrown at you then you'll love this film.

title: Dumbest movie ever
text: This is just plain dumb! Flat characters are only the start. No emotion is built up as characters die one by one. And one character makes constant stupid decisions, one after the other. But she seems to be soooo important to save by everyone, for some inexplicable reason. Just to think of all the resources that have been spent making this idiotic movie is staggering!Do not waste time watching it. You will just be angry with yourself for spending time watching stupid writing, illogical story plots, flat characters that you just wish dead so you don't need to sit through the whole brain dead movie. You have been warned!

title: In my top 5 "Worst Movies I ever saw."
text: The idea that a group of people worked on that, and willingly attached their name to it, and even showed their face in it, is baffling.It's terrible, dumb, ugly, no scarry nor funny, not even unwillingly funny. It's just embarrassing and sad.A total waste of time.There's never any blood shown, not even a drop, which means those big sharks pretty much gobble people - they got teeth, but apparently those are designed to chew threw metal and wood structures, and boats that are in the way. That, they like to eat somehow.. Entire wood piers, that's like biscuits for them.There's a guy who managed to tame a shark, and that shark escapes... for what ? Is it going to be useful (i was hoping, because that's the only original idea in the film). Alas, no, itcwas just there to show that this guy tamed a shark for nothing.Don't watch it.

title: Nearly unwatchable
text: The first one was decent, but this one is super lame. With the unnecessary fast speaking Chinese and subtitles., it really puts you to sleep. It's even more unrealistic in the first one. I mean I get it. It's Jason Statham playing Jason Statham, playing Jason Statham, playing Jason Statham.I was surprised at how unrealistic this was they didn't even try to make it seem real. The CGI was done poorly too. I gotta admit that Chinese was just horrible to watch or to listen to. There really wasn't a need. It could've been just English and gone a lot smoother and not put me to sleep.Good luck to all who watch. Or don't.

title: Vacuums take note or Call of Duty Marine life Warfare
text: This movie jumped the shark at least 3 times. Then the shark jumped Statham. There was a point when Statham is saying shoot me; I honestly believe Jason wanted to be killed to get out of this pile of Jurassic Sharktopuss.This movie could teach them anything or two about sucking. I mean, you take one of the scariest natural predators, show us the peak of it's existence, and somehow make it suck mire than Jaws 3 and 4. It's like the movie is a star collapsing in upon itself and taking the one bright Statham, with it.Jaws had us scared of the water still in the late 90s. Shark week gets everyone excited. Ik trying to say, sharks are amazing and we known what they can do. But apparently nobody decided to teach the people who wrote this movie. I read the book the first movie was based on, way back in the early 2000 around the time it was written. I can't really remember much about it, and yet it was so much better than anything this movie attempts.You have to feel bad for Jason. The man has had a pretty amazing career of solid folks to inspire fans to rewatch. I didn't realize he was dying, completely broke, and needed the money for a life saving operation. I hope he pulls thru.There's a point when the call he has no problem making 4 times in the first movie, suddenly he won't do it for this guy who got shoe horned into the story because nobody with sense wanted to come back. We never hear about the brother in the last film. Suddenly he is this important expositional tool. Nobody learned anything from the last movie, and I'm fact, suffered serious brain trauma because they are considerably more dumb.Monster mash movies doit have a history of solid story. Sure most the Jaws movies are forgotten. They are still more believable than this. The first movie had us able to suspend our disbelief to a way this prehistoric creature survived. Ok, I could buy it no problem.They decided to make something that was impossible to believe at any point. Deep Blue Seas 2 and 3 sucked too, but this? This is like that, but big budget enough to go to theaters.The whole point of a Meg wouod be shark earring stuff. Put us in the water with it and let's go. It's clearly from the HBO parent company because most the beginning of the movie when the shark action is happening, we can see as well as that amazing battle in Game if Thrones season 8. You know the battle. It was so amazing you guys, like you've never seen anything like it. Nobody has because why show in a movie.The stupid rat dog and idiot lady make a surprise cameo. Like that was what anyone wanted. There is a moment where someone tells another grown adult that he needs to just imagine he is doing cosplay. If you are that much of a loser, there is no way you would be part of a team going down below the trench again. Apparently we got these COD Advanced Warfare exo frame suits that make it easy to go chill in the most mythical, secluded areas in history.Yeah, it's cool we get the giant squid, because the 80s gave us that too. Hard to get excited about it tho, when everything is shake your head stupid. So the sharks you door get to see. There's this new creature from the beginning that is some dino hybrid that can go on land and water. Doesn't look anything like anything. The things remind me of the og Yoshi in the crapfest Mario movie from my childhood. I still believed that was more realistic than these small plot devices. We have 3 megs we barely get to see, but let's be scared of these water raptors.All the conflict in the movie is human on human. Yes we know, humans suck. Given every opportunity to be horrible, they will be. So let's focus on that, even in the face of absolute impossible to believe situations. People die but you can't see how it even know who it is. It's ok, they weren't likeable anyway the crew is full of people you'd be fine seeing eaten. The only problem is we don't get to see it happen. Jason was apparently super angry he spent a movie fighting something he couldn't actually fight. Now he has to remind people he was in talks to be Bond before, but that ship is forgotten, and lost in the triangle. I like marital arts and love those movies. I don't want a shark movie to see Statham try to be 00 Green-peace.My head hurts from eyes rolling.

title: Seriously- is Jason in a lot debt
text: This is probably the worst movie I have seen in the past 10 years. Do yourself a favor and put your head through the television set if you're gonna watch this movie I can't believe this movie almost made a half $1 billion. What is wrong with the world. Honestly, if this is what people find entertaining we should all collectively kill ourselves, I mean who wrote this a two year old a 90-year-old it is seriously one of the worst freaking movies anyone could ever watch make produce, Acton, etc.. What are they gonna make Meg three where are unicorn flights out of a sharks butt and then tries to take over the world .

title: Where's the Meg?
text: The first movie was incredible. This movie includes the Meg. But it was a side note on what the movie was actually about. The trailers showed it all about fighting the Meg. Those were the majority of scenes of it actually in the film. Quite disappointing considering how good the first was. Was it alright, yes. But a complete letdown compared to the first. We didn't need a whole other side of environmental corruption is evil to make this movie. The little beast fishes were more prominent in the film and did most of the destruction. The Megs just seemed to be very destructive nuisances. Worth a watch, yes, but don't expect to much.

title: Meh 2: Another Divebomb
text: A shark sequel that actually makes Jaws: The Revenge more enjoyable. Now, that impressive feat is worth the additional and overly generous star.I honestly don't want to spend too much time writing this review. Lord knows I just wasted 2 of my hours on this disaster.Nothing works in this movie. Not the humor, dialogue, believability or surprises. It's predictable and not even a so-bad-it's-good vibe. It's not even a good homage to the MUCH BETTER 80/90s Sharksploitation films. And worse, it's just dull.Honestly, I have almost completely forgotten the original I saw only once 5 years ago in 4 days. I think I was overly generous with my 3/10-star rating I gave the first one and I was about to give this the same, but I just couldn't think of a redeeming quality. It DOES earn that extra star because I didn't hate life through it. It was just a chore to watch and I couldn't wait for the nightmare to be over.To sum up the synopsis: Jason Statham, his daughter from The Lost World, her shark-whisperer uncle, LL Cool J reprising his Deep Blue Sea character and other throwaway comic reliefs must battle Die Hard henchmen who follow a cartoon villain so bad even Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom would've rejected her. There's a half-thought-out environmental message, but then again, everything's half-though-out here.Oh, and sharks do what they do best: attack a climatic tacked-on water resort. Admittedly, there was ONE cool scene here: Shark-Cam - the view from within the shark as it gobbled down cardboard characters.This just ended up making me miss those deep-sea movies of the late 80s, such as Leviathan, DeepStar Six and The Abyss. Whatever flaws they had, they were still 10x better than this unfunny joke.I wouldn't recommend either Meg. UNLESS, you like those Sharknado/ Mega Shark Versus Giant Octopus movies. Then this might seem like a masterpiece to you.***Final Thoughts: One of the worst parts of this movie was the screen ratio. Not sure if this was the streaming service's fault or whoever's, but the only way to see everything on screen, all objects, but mostly the humans, were stretched thin, much like the old Godzilla movies. I tried all settings to fix this so people's heads went back to normal, but with each change it lost a bit of the visuals. And even with the "best" setting, it still cut off some of the movie. That didn't help this already-disaster.

title: That's too Many Megs
text: With one obvious exception, "Shark movies" are not very good. They can be an enjoyable distraction, but they are typically just mindless shlock. Throw in Jason Statham spouting one-liners and you could have a fun time. But this movie even fails to jump over that low bar.Simply put, there is too much going on in this movie. They have 3 giant sharks, a kraken, some dinosaurs they refer to as "land sharks" and some Captain Planet villains to tie everything together.The movie could have been two separate films, there is one half that is "The Trench" and the other half is "Meg 2". Once they get to "Fun Island" that is when "Meg 2" begins with some crazy giant shark action. Before that we have a lot of deep sea exploring and Statham taking care of a kid.The story is all over the place. The heroes feel too invincible to have it feel perilous. Of course, the science doesn't work, but even by their own rules there's no consistency. And the ending feels anti-climactic, setting up sequels they hope to get.Statham's character of Jonas said, "This is a hot mess."

title: A dull, dumb, implausible & uninspired shark turd of a sequel
text: 2018's "The Meg" was a perfectly passable fun actioner... its dumb sequel, "Meg 2: The Trench", most certainly is not. Jason Statham (with daughter Shuya Sophia Cai), Jing Wu, Melissanthi Mahut, Whoopie Van Raam & crew get stranded in a deep ocean trench while under attack from baddies, massive prehistoric sharks and other creatures - while Cliff Curtis works on rescuing them from above. New director Ben Wheatley churns out a parade of uninspired & wholly implausible set pieces; returning writers Dean Georgaris, Erich Hoeber & Jon Hoeber have a mare this time; and the performances are uniformly dreadful. It's a dull aquatic shark turd - flush it.

title: Could not finish
text: I will not be reviewing the entire content of this movie as I could not finish it. Awful acting, main Chinese guy was annoying AF and I AM Chinese! Got on my nerves immediately with the cocky 'I'm better than everything' stupid oblivious and complete lack of self awareness attitude within the first 10 min.Secondly. Meiying is no longer cute. In fact, very very far from being cute physically. What's much worse is that she is more annoying than the main Chinese ignoramus. Her delusional self confidence and typical teenager perceived invincibility is not endearing, cute, or funny. It was irritating to the core.Could not finish watching when she decided to just sneak into the little submarine during a deep dive after being told no repeatedly.

title: Nice movie
text: Nice movie it's so good and fun to watch i really like it, this part was so amazing , especially the events and the storyline was amazing and fun to watch.The best thing is jason statham is in the movie , this actor is one of the best i have ever seen and if there is another part of this amazing movie this legend jason statham of course should be there , he always adds excitement and fun to the movie i mean this movie will make you laugh even if you are sad it's so fun , in fact i wish to see another part of this amazing movie , this movie deserve a spot and more good rating and i way not maybe we will see part 3 soon.

title: I have to confess that i'm a long-time fan of TV's . . .
text: . . . shark week, despite such implausible plots as toothy finned fiends chasing people up high-rise stairwells. However, MEG 2 seems like a flop that was rejected by television's bean counters before getting dumped onto the bigger screen. Most of this picture is wasted on corporate back-stabbing shenanigans, featuring "Greed is Good" proponents. Then there's a character from the Philippine Sea, chasing putative hero Jonas like Captain Ahab pursued Moe Richard. Throw in a little girl who tries to be EVERYTHING EVERYWHERE ALL AT ONCE, an improbable resort island populated by party people even more oblivious than those in a piranha flick and a unconvincing mercenary army falling prey to giant lizards before the giant squid can dial their number, and viewers are left with bite-less cold sushi.

title: .. and I thought first Meg movie was bad
text: I don't really know where to start. Lol. I sometimes wonder what screenplay authors think before coming up with the laughable silliness and genuine ridiculousness like this. Then actually get funding to make a circus of a movie. But moreover, what do actors think, when reading the script and taking up roles like these? Did Jason Statham read and thought this is a good sequel? But if he agreed to the first one, then I guess this explains it. The silly, primitive dialog with his patented tough and gritty voice, along with shark like creatures that can swim and walk, sounds terrific lmao. This takes over from Sharknado.

title: Where were the megs
text: Was so looking forward to this movie ,the first few minutes at the start were very interesting and very good but everything went down hill when they all got stuck under water where the storyline went haywire and it seemed this movie wasn't taken seriously ,the comedy and action DID NOT GEL in this movie, it wasn't funny and tried so hard to be funny and the Megadallion sharks hardly even stared in the show, which was a shame because the graphics were good of the creatures ,other creatures not the sharks (as they are hardly in it), its hard to believe this is a sequel to the first one as they are completely different , if your looking for a good shark movie please do no waste your time,

title: I expected nothing and was still disappointed
text: I love Jason Statham, he is a very friendly guy but yet with a flick of a finger can be a menacing and powerful figure. Many movies he saved with is presence but this one he can't. The script is the worst ever, the CGI is from 20 years ago and the acting is cardboard like. With Meg1 you could feel the fear of the people for the monster, this time it's all light heartedness. The Meg is a pet you can train. The crushing depth of the deep ocean? Neeeeh, literally a walk in the park. The disaster with the Titan showed how extremely dangerous the pressure is, the tiniest mistake can cause an implosion, vapourizing the occupants in seconds. But here? No problem, suit up and step outside. Even a depth of 300m would cause a diver to be crushed and his whole body pushed inside his helmet. Can you imagine the danger? I wished I would have felt the danger in this movie, but it's a movie for kids at the most (and they probably hate it as well). Forget it and go see a real movie.

title: Statham must be broke
text: Worst movie ever made. The CGI (and I use that term very loosely) is pathetic and the script is something a 5th grader wrote. I can't even go into the rest of the pathetic attempt to make some action movie. Cheesy and lame is all I can say. I've seen better acting on 1980's PSA commercials which isn't saying much. The movie isn't even worth having on as background while you're doing other things. That's how annoying and horrible it is. I hope the Director has a back up plan for his career because this certainly isn't his calling. Jason Statham must be close to broke or he lost a serious bet and is now paying for it.

title: Unmemorable
text: If you like mindless action and Jason Statham in a stereotypical Statham role, this movie is for you. I thought "Meg" was unoriginal and "Meg 2" was unnecessary but here we are. Hollywood has been unable to produce a quality shark movie since "jaws". Meg didn't do anything to change that and neither did this. I found it hard to focus throughout as it couldn't keep my interest. It's one of those movies which receives an over inflated budget to minimally entertain, an issue all to familiar in the movie industry. Excessive CGI, lacklustre plot, and melodramatic acting also plague the movie. If there's a "Meg 3" I'm not watching.

title: When Jason Stathom picked up that helicopter blade..
text: I knew he was going to stab the shark with it. Freaking awesome.This movie is for people who can turn their brain off and enjoy a goofy, somewhat satirical action movie. Anyone who saw this and took it seriously just misunderstood the point of this movie. I mean, the beginning has a giant shark eating a T-rex. That was a clear vibe check for anyone seeing this, basically saying "if you don't think this is cool, leave now. You won't like the rest."Loved it. Achieved the point of an over-the-top action movie perfectly. Hope they make a bunch more of these. If Fast and Furious can have 10+ movies, we deserve a couple more Megs.The Meg 3 for President!

title: In a Word: DUMB
text: I could write a 20,000 word dissertation on why this was a bad movie, but I just have the energy.This movie was horrible for 1,000 different reasons.The actors sucked. - Like, I started laughing at some of the dialogue about 5 minutes into the movie.The writing sucked. - same as above.Graphics sucked. - I mean, you have 3 megs swimming in a perfect line or "V" formation?Unrealistic Sharks - Give us all a break. By the way the swim and act, they'd be the smartest creatures on the planet. - Just DUMB.I could keep going but I just don't care.HORRIBLE MOVIE.JUST DUMB.Avoid at all costs.

title: Fails Even at Being Good Trash: A Monument to Missed Opportunities
text: It's astonishing how many logical inconsistencies this movie has. Usually, I can turn off my brain and enjoy films of this sort, but that's difficult here. Many scenes come across as thoughtless and shallow. The film does attempt to include exaggerated moments with a wink, but fails miserably at it. These scenes are so poorly executed that you can't help but shake your head at the wasted potential. It seems as if these over-the-top scenes are there just to distract from the lack of attention to detail in the screenplay. If you're going to make a trash film, at least have a love for the genre. But here, it seems the sole purpose is to exploit the genre and visuals to crudely lure people into the theater.

title: Thought I went for a shark movie. Ended up watching a kids movie instead
text: Was really disappointed watching this because I did enjoy Meg 1. Was this movie about sharks or dinosaurs or prehistoric octopus and lizards I have no idea. It had no story no content and no thrill at all. We understand glorification of the protagonist but there needs to be some form of reality which was inexistent. Can't imagine I sat through the whole thing hoping for some excitement. What a true waste of time. I read a previous review stating "even if I was on a flight and it was the only movie playing I wouldn't watch it". Couldn't agree more. Wish I read this review before I made the mistake of watching it.

title: Awful, just awful.
text: This a definite C grade movie, made with an A grade budget. There is not one ounce of originality to be found at any point in its bloated run time. The dialogue is diabolically bad. It's jammed with multiple attempts at humour that all fall flat. Statham whisper talks and constantly mugs for the camera but just comes across as a 'straight to video' action star. He's done so much better films than this monstrosity, and should cash his pay check and move on from it as soon as possible. The acting, particularly from the 'bad guys' is terrible. In conclusion, if you like movies that seem to have been written by middle schoolers, for middle schoolers, you will love this.

title: Brilliant film if you enjoy sheer fun
text: This was everything I expected it to be. A ridiculous story, fabulous action scenes, silly one liners, funny and brilliant. If you are expecting the same experience as Oppenheimer you will be very upset, if you want a fun couple of hours to just forget about the outside world, go for it. I don't understand the negative scores, if you went to see this expecting something else, you really didn't do your research and have never seen the Meg. I'm really not sure what you expected. As for 'this is the worst film I've ever seen' this doesn't come close for me. I'm glad I went, totally enjoyed myself, came out smiling.

title: Clearly not for brain users
text: Who was this movie for? I started watching and for some reason Jason Stratham is an eco warrior for the first big scene? I guess he's doing his transporter role. Wait no. Eco guy but beating up 5 guys at once. He confirms it on the boat later. Sure buddyStory aside, it's bad. Idk man what do u expect from Hollywood. Where did the octopus come from? 3 "megs"? That's what they call em. Hip abbrev slang. Gotta be edgy. They have a suit to survive 5 miles below and show it punching holes in CONCRETE. But that's it. What was the point in that?Horrible movies not made for usa. New fast and furious. Sellout trash. Never watching again. Even the finale song is Chinese. Good to see they own us.Character met. I'm done. Garbage.

title: Meg 2: The Trench
text: Directed by Ben Wheatley. He brings none of his trademark style from his low budget British horror films. Wheatley can't even bring any flourish from the two episodes of Doctor Who he directed for the Peter Capaldi era. Although one of the Who episodes did feature a dinosaur.Meg 2 begins in the dinosaur era before it cuts to the present day. Jonas Taylor (Jason Statham) is now an eco warrior taking on the big fishes that destroy the environment.Jonas is still involved with Mana One, the ocean station that explores the deep Trench. Unfortunately one deep dive mission is sabotaged and Jonas and others find themselves trapped with prehistoric creatures.The firs Meg was a silly homage to Jaws that could not be taken too seriously. The first half of Meg 2 is set in the deep murky waters, where visibility is not so good.The second half gets sillier as the action moves to Fun Island, a paradise resort. In short this wants to be Jurassic Park meets Jaws.

title: This movie didn't know if it wanted to be Jurassic Park, Jaws, Deep Rising or MacGyver
text: Meg 2: The Trench (2023) is a movie my daughter was excited to watch so we caught it in theaters this evening. The storyline follows a research facility who has a megalodon and new underwater vessels that's allow them to go deeper than humans have ever been in the ocean. The old team gets back together to test the vessel and encounter some underhanded black market dealings in the process. Meanwhile the megalodon escapes making the underwater adventure more interesting.This movie is directed by Ben Wheatley (A Field in England) and stars Jason Stratham (Italian Job), Jing Wu (SPL), Sophia Cai (The Meg), Cliff Curtis (Training Day), Sergio Peris-Mencheta (Snowfall) and Page Kennedy (SWAT).This is bad in every way you expect. The storyline and dialogue is painful. The CGI is top notch, but this movie didn't know if it wanted to be Jurassic Park, Jaws, Deep Rising or MacGyver. The fight scenes are well choreographed but over the top and the action scenes were horrendous. For having such great CGI the kill scenes are even disappointing. It's too bad because Jason Stratham and Jing Wu in a film should be way better.Overall, this is a commercial horror film that relies on an overuse of CGI and ridiculous plot points/scenarios for entertainment value. I would score this a 2/10 and recommend skipping it.

title: Disaster
text:
PLEASEEEE...dont waste your time..this movie is the worst movie ive ever seen..Statham vs the sharknado universe..CGI for babies..0 plot..0 acting...
My rate is 2.1
2 for the movie
1 for Statham.I tried so hard to watch this movie..even with short brakes..i spent 1 week but i did it..i finished the movie 5 minutes ago and i have an obligation to warn all of you..please dont...dont...you will agree with my if you do it...this is the last time in my life ...Statham movies end for me..i live you with my love..have a nice weekend....please go for a walk..running..swimming..but NOT this movie for sure...

title: BOLLOCCS
text: Couldn't finish the 1st one ...& this one reminded me why I couldn't even finish the 1st one.The best thing about this one was the opening scene, then the rest is a load of horse manure, the dialogue, the choreography on action scenes was so painful to bear I was gasping wondering who on earth was giving a green light for all this horse manure to be the final productJason statham, im sure was paid a sheetload of money to even agree to be chuck Norris, coz I kid you not, half the stuff he did there gives Bollywood fiction a run for their money.The story, Lord have mercy, oh my God whoever selected the storyline was coked out coz no way sober minded intelligent beings could use this storyline for a shark movie.So glad I didn't waste a penny on this garbage.

title: Pretty unbelievable
text: I get it's a shark movie but the graphics were very heavy CGI and the scenes were super unbelievable. From people staying alive in suits thousands of feet below the sea to one dude being able to kill a Meg by single handedly shoving a steel rod in its mouth, somehow avoiding the shark clamping down on him is just unbelievable. Nod to the Sharknado series when the shark and octopus fought. Just way too many unbelievable things happening for me to stay engaged in this film. I really wanted to like it bud sadly just couldn't. I'm curious if this will be the end of this series or if the next installment will go straight to cable.

title: Are you serious?
text: I can't even come up with 1 positive thing about this movie, its so far from reality and so bad that it blew my mindüòÜ don't waste your time on this. Movie hops from scene to scene without any background story, animals from an island are all of the sudden attacking 6km under sea level, from under water out of water with dry hair, group needs to hurry to a safe place but takes time to discuss topics under water, even my wife fainted and was lost for words. I think I will have a peanut butter sandwich now and try to forget about this sad sad waste of time as soon as possible. Why people make such movies is not even funny.

title: Love the propaganda. /s
text: I don't remember either of the books being this full of a certain counties propaganda.The first one was bad, but this one is ludicrous. News flash, the country being shoved down our throats does not have the worlds or enviroments best interest at heart.This might as well be martyring a certain moustachioed guy from the 40's.They left out most of the science from the books (which were not terrible) and just went full Marvel/Michael Bey as a distraction from the blatant flag waving.I almost never review anything in print, just a number. I am just soo tired of everything we've ever enjoyed in life being remade as political point.

title: Seriously!?
text: I am just wondering.....at what point does Hollywood or any of its actors take responsibility for the wasted dollars it spends on crap movies like this?! I can only imagine the amount of good those same dollars could do if put out into the world to help veterans or homeless!! It's just a shame that these actors sign on to do the most ridiculous stuff all the while knowing that kids are starving and people all across the world are striving to make their lives better! Meanwhile......they are wasting millions upon millions of dollars making a movie (#2 POS) and all for literally nothing!! I hope these so called actors enjoy their spoils.

title: CINEMATIC MASTERPIECE
text: BIGGER, BADDER, and BETTER! This movie is camp. Pippin steals the show per usual. Any other reviewer knocking this masterpiece needs to get laid. Dont be a LOSER. This film is oscar worthy and i'm not sure how people don't see that. I love a bald man taking on massive prehistoric apex predators AND he's now a FATHER?! Amazing. Couldn't have asked for a better movie. I want to thank whoever funded this movie, because the graphics were the best i've ever seen. James cameron could never. I think we should all destroy the internet by voting the Meg 2 as the best movie of the summer. You're either with me or you're against me!!

title: Disappointing...
text: The first Meg is a guilty favorite of mine so I certainly understood what to expect and was not looking for high art, but this sequel was just not good. Everything felt really rushed, the underlying story was barely there and the "bad guys" were just terrible caricatures. Overall the acting was bad, it was clear the actors were all pretty much phoning it in (even Statham, whom I love). Some, however, stood out as particularly terrible - the wealthy benefactor (Driscoll) has to be the girlfriend of one of the producers because wow, she cannot act to save her life, same with Jess - just awful. Most of them sounded like they were just reading the script without any effort at all to act. Part of the fun of the first Meg are the comedic moments, unfortunately whoever wrote the script was trying to recreate that and just went completely overboard with jokes so dumb and predictable they pretty much all fall flat.I was really hoping to like Meg 2 as much as I enjoyed Meg but there just was very little to like about it.

title: It's a chinese movie...
text: Made by and for china. You can tell because it's cringe, bad acting, not funny, over the top nonsens and bunch of dumb one liners.People wonder if this movie is bad or knows what it is so doesnt take itself seriously.... It's none. It simply a generic chinese movie. The only difference is that there's so much money involved that they could afford Jason Statham. I love Jason but i'm pretty sure he's just here for the paycheck.The chinese actors are bad, that woman in the first one (Lin B.) is a terrible actress and that Wu guy is no better. That half asian kid is beyond bareable and let's not start with the main vilain....Don't waste your time. Life is not short, ot's what you do woth it that makes it short. - Seneca.

title: Another Lukewarm PG-13 Movie
text: This movie could have been great, but it's just too PG-13.Already at the beginning, the emphasis was placed on some other things, the fun is in the background. That's always a sign of a bad movie.The casting is good, Jason Statham in the movie, that usually guarantees good entertainment, but here even he doesn't help, because the script is bad.The director did his best, but even he can't do better with a script like this. Movie companies make these lukewarm PG-13 movies thinking it will attract audiences, but in most cases it turns viewers away.Not every movie can be lukewarm and watered down, this one was supposed to be a movie for adults and ended up being for no one.I personally gave up going to the cinema when I saw that it was just another PG-13 movie. Luckily, I watched it for free, so I just wasted some time, but that's a shame too, because time is precious.The CGI is not convincing, it would be better if they made an animated version of the film and that's it.There are some funny moments in the movie, but too few. A movie that is seen once and forgotten, it should have been more brutal.Some movies at least stretch the boundaries of the rating, so some PG-13 movies actually slip through with some scenes that belong more in R-rated movies. They didn't even try it here, the film looks like a cartoon.Do yourself a favour, skip this PG-13 cartoon.

title: The worst movie
text: The worst movie i watched for a while , graphics are so bad ,so many big and nonsense mistakes, i would rate it 0 .... went to watch it in Cinema and we were the only ppl in the room. Its terrible.I dont understand how Jason did such an ugly and terrible movie ,its too boring and tge first hour was nothing , litrally nothing and the rest of it was full of obvious mistakes and nonesense sequenseThe whole movie felt like nightmare , slow and too silly , makes u feel back in century where graphics were elementary and felt like stupid watching such an ugly movie , it is really sooooo ugly and doesnt worth time.

title: Only climax was good
text: I enjoyed the first part as it was a surprisingly enjoyable from the start till the end. I was expecting the same from this sequel but nothing worked in favour of this sequel. The story was nonsense and disjointed from the start to end, the screenplay was next to bad, the direction was loose and the performances were okay. The climax was the only positive point as the main action and thrill took place. This thrill was needed in the whole movie but it was all boredom and nothing.Overall, I might not recommend this movie to anyone. You can watch the first part as it is enough to give you thrills.

title: Disappointing Sequel
text: Well... the first "Meg" was really funny. Meg 2 is really a bad bad bad experience. If you are not drunk while watching it.The acting is so bad, the script doesn't make sense ans the worst of all: Even when you low your expectations by a minimum, there are so many "dumb" scenes - I shake my head and roll my eyes around 50 times while watching.I expected a "no brainer" with great shark action. First of all, the sharks (Megs) are really unnecessary for the whole movie. The new "dinosaur" part is a shame.Unrealistic movies with over the top action are great. But "stupid" Unrealistic action is not forgivable.You liked the first Mag, like I did? Great. Don't waste your time with the second part.The only "positive" thing to tell about, is only in the special effects corner. They are really great. But combjnated with the scenario and action, still a dissapointing experience.

title: Disappointed is an understatement
text: I love these kinds of thrilling but knowingly unrealistic shark survival movies. I loved the first Meg, so I was excited to see this one when it came out. Sadly, I almost walked out of the theater this time. The film was terrible: the acting felt contrived and forced, very campy, and went to levels of Sharknado in so many lousy ways. The CGI, acting, plot levels, and action scenes were all terrible Sharknado levels. At the serious moments, you couldn't help but laugh; the stakes and emotions were so robotic and unimportant, and so far in left field, paired with the bad graphics, I was taken entirely out of the film from start to finish. Overall, -20/10, and I would never watch it again willingly.

title: Not recommended
text: I strongly recommend to don't watch this movie because The movie is not even 1 percent good The whole time I was watching the movie, I was very annoyed. I don't understand why Jason accepted such a bad movie like this megs are shown very well in The meg Part 1 but in this when we saw megs it's look like normal sharks Even after Meg entered the movie, I was still waiting for the big fish, not thinking it was Meg. After I realised oh this is meg that too they called that sharks meg that's why I understand that the meg. Very very routine movie and very boring movie I was waiting for this movie to end not only movie who watch that movie they definitely feels like this.

title: An awful film with an awful plot and structure
text: Meg 2 is one of those films that does not know what it is trying to be, it is neither a comedy, horror, thriller, drama, or action movie but tries to be a bit of both, ending up a jack of all trades, master of none.By it's title one would expect Meg 2 to be about Megs, but no that is not the case. The film is hijacked by other creatures, for no apparent reason whatsoever.The main characters cannot be killed no matter what they do. If they put a loaded gun to their heads and pulled the trigger there would be some really stupid and completely unrealistic reason why it did not blow their brains out, in fact it would probably work out really well for them.The 'stunts' are just plain daft! They are absolutely ridiculous to watch and depressing.I have watched a lot of films that are so unrealistic and plain silly that are fun and a good laugh, with a good feel at the end of them. This is not one of those films. I felt sad and almost ashamed that I had watched the Meg 2, foolishly waiting for it to get better and it never did!

title: Meg 2: The Cringe
text: From the beginning to the end, it's filled with cringe worthy dialogues, this movie is a flop in every aspects from plot to VFX, it is nothing but a stupid caricature with clickbait thumbnails luring people to watch hoping to see something mind blowing out if the deeps of the ocean, but it's just a huge nonsensical disappointment they made, enough to make your brain hurt, they hired some popular actors who are famous for their action movie roles, which is very well to appeal kids age upto 12yr/o, but as a teenager you will feel bored and will leave half way, because it's just too stupid and boring with a very predictable plot.Overall, please don't waste your time, find yourself something better and logical.

title: Thiiiiis isss Chiiinaaaaaaaa!
text:
As a shark fan, the temptation is unfortunately too great, even if you already found Part 1 more than mediocre, know the current bad reviews and know that it is a China product. And there is probably the crucial point, a typical creation of this origin. Completely imitated, badly copied, penetrating every market, nothing of its own, high-quality at first glance, quickly exposed as cheap and inferior. "The products are slowly getting better" - no, they are not! In terms of film, it will stay that way, China is not Hong Kong and vice versa. But watch out, zeitgeist too, the yellow peril now has the confidence to dare not to dub the parts in local language but to subtitle them. So the days of walking bent over and not looking each other in the eye seem to be long gone, unfortunately.Technically, what is shown, see previously explained, is a kind of high-budget Asylum production. And here's a kind of fun fact: Meg 2, as you can read, has a budget of 185 million dollars. No, I kid you not, but the producers were apparently given it at / by one or more places.Other findings:
Annoying-child factor present, but even poop gets messed up, that plays less and less of a role as it progresses.Jason Statham is not a man of honour.The shark factor for shark fans is no longer tangible due to the grotesque alienation of all necessary criteria.Hardly useful for trash fans either, takes itself seriously, wannabe blockbuster that is.

title: Dumb and Dumber...
text: When Jason S. Decides he is going to beat three Mega-Megalodon sharks - you know it is exactly what he is going to do. If you watched the first movie, which was released almost four years ago, you know exactly what to except from this one; that of course if you remember something from the insulting script and lazy ass Screenwriters.This time and as a direct continue to first movie's plot, the one the Jonas (Jason) loved died, without mention it too much and now he is responsible for her teenage daughter and her uncle - both Chinese and both will help to sell tickets at the east side of the globe.And then the movie begins and it has a shark. And then goes two third of it for a road trip in the bottom of the ocean. They walk, they talk and they fight a boring and generic antagonist characters which are made to get the shark even meaner.After making you go to sleep out of boredom the movie tries to wake his audience with dumb shark action scenes and why not through some other pre-historic and unrelated historic monster just because they can? They clearly saved money for visual effect and screen writing, so why not get wild?Bottom line is that this one is even stupider then the first and shows somewhere the depth of Statham's professional crisis. The one that held hands with Guy Richie is sinking parallelly to the great director and this time he is doing it separately from the one that discovered him with some of the greatest films in modern history.

title: How did this get to screen?
text: I wonder which idiots actually thought this was good enough to show anyone? It's absolutely crap. I think they secretly wanted to make the worse film ever made in the history of films. All the so called actors are useless. The story is useless. The special effects are useless. The music is useless. The dialogue is useless. Everything about this film is useless. title: Unbelievably bad
text: Awful so so bad, script is terrible, the acting not much better.So many plot holes and so many too far fetched moments, combined with the poor writing, bad actors and a story that just isn't interesting that fails to make sense.By the half way point it felt more like a b movie or a bad comedy movie that you had to laugh at the stupidity of the writing.Normally you want the good people to survive, for me this time it's different, I'd of preferred to see them all get eaten or die in the most ridiculous way possible, it actually might have made the film better and killed off any further movies for this poor poor series of movie.Jason stathom has done some stinkers but this is next level.

title: Shockingly soulless
text: After watching this film I had to turn on something else, just to make sure I was actually still capable of feeling something, anything at all, and there was nothing wrong with me. Because Meg 2 made me feel Nothing. I wasn't even repulsed by boring, shallow, badly-written characters, dialogues or the amount of CGI; I had zero interest or sympathy for any of the human characters, and couldn't care less whether they lived or died, succeeded or not.I can't even call this film a mindless escapism, because it doesn't provide any. I was in no way entertained, even though I'm open-minded for anything with Jason Statham in it and never expect a masterpiece.And, no, we should not put up with stuff like this or 'just enjoy it for what it is', like another reviewer insists. Bad products should not be consumed and paid for. AI could've made a much better job than people who created Meg 2. Have a little self-respect and skip this film.

title: Shark Movie Masterpiece
text: If you didn't enjoy this film, then you have no business watching shark or monster movies.It knows what it is and plays into all the over the top tropes we love about the genre. It's fast paced, fun and funny. It has nods to loads of the Sharksploitation movies.The acting is brilliantly OTT and in the best way! Statham delivers his usual brand of hard man antics and one liners. While the rest of the cast are brilliant at bringing the comedy, villainy and emotional pull to life.If you're looking for an Oscar winner don't go by see it, but if you want a good time it won't let you down!Loved it!

title: Meg 2: The Mindless Ocean
text: "Meg 2: The Mindless Ocean" is a sequel that dives headfirst into the abyss of mindlessness. While the first film had its share of entertaining shark action, this installment takes it to a whole new level. The movie is a relentless barrage of over-the-top shark encounters and improbable scenarios, leaving little room for plot or character development.The characters, including Jason Statham's Jonas Taylor, seem to have lost any sense of depth they might have had in the first movie. They're now just there to provide quippy one-liners and serve as shark bait. The dialogue is filled with clich√©s and cringe-worthy moments that make you wonder if the scriptwriters even tried.The plot, or lack thereof, is a thinly veiled excuse to showcase bigger, badder sharks and more jaw-dropping stunts. It's as if the filmmakers threw logic out to sea and embraced the absurdity of it all. You'll find yourself questioning the laws of physics and biology more than once.Despite its mindlessness, "Meg 2" manages to deliver some spectacular visual effects and heart-pounding action sequences. If you're in the mood for mindless entertainment and can suspend all disbelief, you might find some enjoyment in this oceanic adventure. However, if you're looking for a movie with substance or a coherent story, you'll be sorely disappointed. In the end, "Meg 2" is a guilty pleasure for those who can appreciate its sheer silliness.

title: Meg 2 does not deliver!
text:
The opening editing style was so not my vibe.I also wasn't a fan of the first act and the built up towards the main storyline.It's not rushed or anything it just doesn't make any sense, things are happening cause they need to happen.Like Jonas (Jason) says throughout this movie: we work the problems one by one should've been the moto of this film.The giant Megalodon's are the most comment sense in this movie.I know it's about giant sharks and all but everything around those sharks didn't even made any sense.Jetski's outrunning sharks is just a small example of that..
I wasn't even a second in suspense throughout these 2 hours...

title: Nice visuals, bad everything else
text: OK movie, 6 out of 10 to start with. Looks nice, the visual effects are nice so that's a +1. But. The rest. Bad acting (for the most part), bad writing, obligatory child-in-danger, standard Stratham fighting, obligatory Chinese main characters, bad jokes. I had zero reason to give my full attentions to this movie. So -3 to get to a 4 out of 10. There is not much more to say really. Evil people doing evil things. Heroes are being heroic. There are sharks and big sharks and bigger sharks. Don't go in expecting a masterpiece, expect a fluff action piece where paying attention is a bd thing. Than you can enjoy it for what it is. Popcorn. Bad for you, still a bit of fun.

title: Fantastic beats and jurrassic park
text: First of all, the first movie was better.Because the first movie made more sense He was constantly passing by sharks and under the sea. But it wasn't like that in the second movie Different creatures were included in the movie It was like a fantasy monsters movie, not a megalodon Actually, if Jonas was a cop and caught criminals, it would be a more meaningful crime detective movie. If you have time, watch the movie. It was okay even if it wasn't a waste of time. I hope there won't be any more ridiculous things in the third movie.because she said the shark would be pregnant It's like I watched Jurassic Park, Terminator Mechanic, Fantastic beats It was a very complex movie, I hope 3 will be good, thank you so much.

title: Fun to Watch
text: To be clear, this is not a classic. I did not go into this movie or the first one expecting Jaws. I did not expect drama, suspense, or great acting. I expected a silly monster movie with eye-candy, over-the-top action, laugh-out-loud moments, and ridiculous, suicidal, anti-heroism stunt work by Jason Statham. This delivered in spades. This was a highly entertaining movie that was even more enjoyable than the first one.The film knows what it is and does not try to take itself too seriously. When you have giant sharks and other monsters eating people you couldn't care less about faster than I can eat my popcorn, all at a place called Fun Island, complete with comedic perspectives that include a camera shot from inside a shark's mouth; you know the filmmakers were not going for realism.If you want an Oscar winning cinematic experience, skip this one. If you want to watch something fun, be prepared to laugh and give this a try.

title: Maybe the worst movie of its year
text: The first film was redeemable. But it was definitely the least suitable to have a sequel, and as expected, Meg 2 didn't come to fruition. It sank with its illogical logic, with its horrible CGI, with its never adequate movement cinematics and with its irritable script. This sequel becomes its own unintentional satire. It's a joke without intention. It can be accepted that from time to time there are one or two inconsistencies with the most basic levels of physics and biology, but come on! The whole movie? After a moment, the characters stop interesting you, you want them all to die and for a forgettable footage to end soon.This sequel passes through the thermocline, lower than Tremors and Sharknado. At least in these last two sagas you know that you are going to laugh for a while.In short and in order not to continue prolonging this torture of continuing to think about this film, Meg 2 is one of the most hateful films of the year.

title: Bad.
text: Oh.. I don't know where I hace to start. First movie was good, actually I love this genre and I can watch as far as not too stupid... I watched this one to the end and yes it was bad. Really really bad. It started good, but after they reached the sea surface, film has been stupid. I didn't understand creatures in fun island. How did it happen? What did I miss? I really didn't understand how they arrived the island. There are lots of unbelievable scenes. I will not say I was bored when I watched but it could be better. I liked DJ character, he was funny. I watched for Jason Statham's name and moreover I paid for this movie on Google TV. Well, probably that will be trilogy and of course I will watch and I am sure it will be better.

title: I hate to say it but it's kinda garbage
text: I went in with low expectations just looking for a creature flick. What I got was a horror movies mixed with God knows what. Love a good horror movie but kinda took me off guard. Head popping scene will stick with me forever. I honestly don't even remember finishing it. I think Jason stathom did something close to the end to beat all the sea creature, I don't know. Its worth a watch. Good luck.it was kinda like watching Peter Jackson's King Kong and it goes from super boring to 100 outta no where. Not saying it's boring. Enough ridiculousness to go around but like come on. The plot is beyond terrible.

title: First Meg is fun, this one is dumb
text: I'm writing this as a fan of the first film.Meg 2 makes the first Meg movie look like a work of sophisticated, cinematic genius. There's such a thing as dumb fun, but Meg 2 is just plain dumb. The first half of the movie is unrealistic, yet watchable and even exciting at times.As for the latter half of the film... well, they just stopped trying. As the film turned into the Sci-Fi Channel cheese-fest I expected the first film to be, I lost interest. I hung in there to the ending that never felt like it would come.I suppose the writers and director thought all the comedy would make up for the sheer ridiculousness of it all, but it would have had to be a lot funnier than it actually was. Silly doesn't mean funny. The only bright spot of all the madness is Jing Wu. He seemed like he was genuinely having so much fun. His fun, likable character somewhat saved the moments he was on screen. As for everyone else, let's just say I don't think this movie was good for anyone's acting career.Directer Ben Wheatley should be embarrassed. The sheer laziness and sloppiness on display is agitating. If it were a Sharknado sequel, then it would have delivered on expectations, but people expected more out of this sequel.

title: The first movie was plausible.
text: Just got through watching the Meg 2. I thought the first one was a stretch, but maybe could happen. This one, while interesting was just so farfetched and ridiculous. That I was asking myself...how LONG is this movie. Is it over yet? That's a bad sign. I appreciate that most of the cast returned for the second movie, but the constant comedic quips and outlandish fighting scenes, like firing a .50 caliber firearm while leaping sideways to shoot a prehistoric creature is just one such instance. I know movies like to go bigger and better than the first movie, but really...it was a bit TOO much. I'm praying there isn't a Meg 3 in the works. Peace.

title: Not as enjoyable as the first
text: Hopefully, if they continue to adapt Alten's novels, whoever gets their hands in takes more from the first Meg than from this sequel. Don't get me wrong, the creatures were great - especially the Tyrannosaur and little Protosuchus-looking beasties of the opening scene - and the cast were decent enough (plus it was nice to see them bring back some of the supporting cast from the first one), but it just kinda felt a bit flat? On the note of the returning cast, though, I was a bit saddened to see Suyin disposed of so carelessly...It was almost like they were trying to make one movie out of two movies worth of plot. Like, I feel like they could have easily made a full movie out of the 'rogue mining operation' plot from the start of the movie, then left us with a cliffhanger leading into the second half. OR maybe make a slightly longer movie with everything from this movie but a bit less squashed in?If they'd given the movie a little more runtime and room to breathe, it might have even lived up to the 'legacy' of the first, and been just as fun to watch. Sadly, it's a bit of a step down...

title: A solid blockbuster mainstream killer shark film with a few issues
text: Still working at the institute, the team working with the sharks descends into the trench again to look into reports on disturbances down there, but after these actions release more megalodons into the world's oceans must band together to stop the creatures from running wild on the water.Overall, this was a rather fun follow-up with a lot to like about it. One of the better features here is the enhanced sense of connection here with the original. Furthering the idea of exploring the trench using more advanced technology to pierce beneath the protective layer preventing them from escaping, the enhanced technology to do this and remain connected to the institute that holds the other shark in captivity has a lot to like here. Moreso, the family drama that was a major part of the original with how he was raising his daughter that's another carryover from the film has some great storyline choices to be had here. As well, there's quite a lot of spectacle-filled action here to really keep the pace high. As this utilizes the high-end technology present to get there, the sequences involving the training sessions in the tank, the initial dive into the trench where they get trapped by the other crew, and the subsequent race to get to a piece of secured mining facility while being attacked by the fish down there including the sharks are all generally impressive sequences. Filled with some fantastic effects-work on not just the sharks but also the locations for each setting that includes some fantastic stunts and escapes, these scenes give this some solid action scenes. This leads nicely into the wild finale where the full-bore attempt at unleashing the sharks and the other creature along with them brings sheer full-throttle action. Consisting of tons of battles both on land and sea battling the creatures throughout the resort, this brings about the kind of high-energy spectacle-driven sequences that are quite thrilling producing the scenes of the group taking out everything they can while trying to avoid the forces trying to stop them. It's break-neck enough to be enjoyable and keeps including a logical series of obstacles being presented that are all fun enough to give this one a lot to like about it. There are a few minor drawbacks to be had with this one. One of the biggest issues is the need for a completely underwhelming and unnecessary subplot about the terrorist group being involved in stealing the equipment used to explore the area. The use of such a team is wholly unrealistic and makes no sense with a laughably illogical and unrealistic, their existence turns the middle of the film into a thrilling if unnecessary shoot-em-up Action movie and highlights the other issue here in quite a drastic decrease in shark action since this whole concept has to be fleshed out. These issues manage to bring this one down somewhat.Rated PG-13: Violence and Language.

title: Braindead intertainment!!!
text: I haven't enjoyed a movie this much for a long time. It has everything - sharks, an octopus, dinosaurs, crazy lizards, covert deep underwater bases, and even a brotha with a survival kit. Nothing makes sense, everything is over the top, the acting is what you expect, and the nod to the Chinese market is unapologetic. It has thrills and action, the only thing you have to do to enjoy this gem is to turn off your brains and come with the right expectations. It is a perfect candidate for an evening with friends and beers, easy-going entertainment with no virtue signaling, politics, or gender wars, which is a rare thing nowadays.

title: More big fish.
text: I didn't love The Meg, but it was simple stupid fun. Did we need a sequel? No of course not, but when has that ever stopped anyone. It certainly wouldn't stop The Stath, he's back as Jonas Taylor for more madness and mayhem. Subtle this is not. It starts with a T-Rex getting eaten and the most unlikely needle drop of Queen's 'Under Pressure', as Jonas breaks out of a shipping container on a cargo ship in the middle of the sea. Something dodgy is going on of course and it's not long before he's kicking bad guys. Truth be told, story isn't especially important here, to the point you don't need to have seen the first film to follow what's happening here. The people Jonas is working with are exploring the oceans, specifically an area ominously named The Trench, where giant dinosaur era fish called megladons rule. Jiuming Zhang (Jing Wu) is the boss of operations and thinks he can train megladons... Jonas disagrees. They have a megladon captive, one raised from a baby, but it's a baby no more and doesn't want to be locked up. That's the least of their concerns though as they dive into The Trench and find that they're not the only ones playing in the water. Where it's thin on plot, it makes up for in action, dramatic OTT dialogue and The Stath's cold hard stare. Things obviously go pear shaped and when things go wrong underwater, bad things happen. The Meg relied just on the spectacle of a big fish though. This tries to add meat to the bones with some double crossing humans chasing money, obviously. It doesn't really work and all peters out anyway in the final act as director Ben Wheatley seems to just decide upon dialing everything up to eleventy stupid. This isn't as good as the first film and that's saying something, it's riddled with holes and gets bogged down needlessly, but you're not watching a film like this for clever plot twists and philosophical narrative. The good guys are good, the bad guys are bad, there's lots of explosions, fights, peril, CGI monsters and it is fun to watch. Let's hope there's no Meg 3 though.

title: More sea monsters
text: Meg is a movie that didn't seem to deserve much to have a sequel, but even so they decided to do it and bring us a movie that goes up a level and is at the same level as its predicted. Meg 2: The Trench further expands the experience by bringing not one, but more megalodons and other sea creatures of prehistoric origin hidden in the depths of the ocean. The world is a vast place and many undiscovered species lie hidden, so the film offers us a glimpse into the possibility that some prehistoric creatures still roam the deep oceans. Jason Statham returns again and to be honest, he is one of the most essential elements of the film and his fight against the ocean creatures that pose a threat has become the most essential of this saga. It's the great British action star that makes this movie worth giving a shot. The special effects and action sequences are the most enjoyable. The movie has some humorous moments and there are script holes. It actually feels like a SyFy Channel movie, but that's what makes it quite enjoyable. It is a film that manages to offer a good amount of entertainment without the need to take it too seriously. Meg 2: The Trench is a sea monster show that does not seek to be a great movie, but to offer entertainment to the viewer. My final rating for this movie is 8/10.

title: Jaws meets Jurassic World
text: Overthought, overblown, and overly complicated, it's a typical sequel to an action thriller movie. The attempt to reproduce all the success of the first movie by moving the sliders to full on complicated plot, eco-bad guys, blood-thirsty monsters, and bigger, badder, and more menacing sharks seems desperate in the extreme. I enjoy gratuitous action and unbelievable heroics as much as the next guy, but this was too contrived even for me. Jonas Taylor is promoted from dedicated marine contractor to special forces super soldier, Meiying has grown from perceptive innocent school girl to fearless teen hero, and DJ is transformed from most-likely-to-get-eaten extra ("I didn't sign up for this") into a buff, highly trained badass ("Get some!"). The Meg was a wonderful pizza, Meg 2 was a pizza with a rack of ribs on top covered by peanut butter and chocolate overspread with fries and ketchup. Who wouldn't love it? Me.

title: Thank God we have Nolan
text: Every time you see that Jason Statham is going to be in a movie, we think, "oh, that's going to be a good movie." Well, we have seen several times that this is not always the case. Despite the fact that Statham is an interesting actor, to which charisma contributes, this still does not save a bad film. A few effects and angry fish just aren't enough to make a bad movie a good one. The story is absolutely hilarious. At one point you'll wonder if everyone in the story is stupid or what. Then there are the "action" scenes. One of these is presented in the picture with which the film is advertised. A shark that overturns a small ship stops with its foot. Anyway, movies today are crap, no doubt about that. Thankfully, this world has Nolan, but his masterpieces are not made as fast as every true art. Meg is a joke. I give it 3 stars because of Statham and the fact people tried to make a movie.

title: I put it in the refrigerator to rest my brain while watching the movie
text: I've watched so many stupid movies in my life. This is a production that will rank among those ridiculous movies. An exaggerated action was made so that it would not be a clich√© shark movie. Coincidences are endless. There are a lot of dialogues and characters that try to be funny, but they are forced.Action and thriller movie made in 2023. A group of researchers studying undersea life and new creatures set out to cross the ocean water layers during ocean floor research. Meanwhile, they pass giant sharks that live in a layer gap. Then illegal miners looking for rare earth elements on the ocean floor explode on the bottom. They crash to the bottom as a result of the blasting and they try to walk from the bottom to the main station. How crazy isn't it? But no, the real nonsense starts from here. While watching, IQ drops by 3 - 4 points.There is no sexuality or nudity in the movie.

title: Physics thrown out the Porthole and Jar Jar Binks
text: Broke every law of Physics that we know of. Beyond ridiculous sequences, excluding the beast scenes which we know are just crazy. People walking 5 kilometers across the ocean floor at 25,000 feet. That's beyond the scope of anything, except maybe Jar Jar Binks. Haha. No suit is going to keep you from being crushed. It's not thought out, overblown in every aspect, and way too complicated. And really far too long. Cinematography was so dark you couldn't figure out who was being attacked by what. Dozens of menacing sharks plus the tooth critters seems desperate in the extreme. I enjoy reasonable gratuitous action and unbelievable heroics as much as the next guy. The nemesis mining guy looks like an extra they pulled out of the local garage. Jonas Taylor is promoted from dedicated marine contractor to special forces super soldier, Meiying has grown from perceptive innocent school girl to fearless teen hero, and DJ is transformed from most-likely-to-get-eaten extra into a buff, highly trained badass ("Get some!"),

title: The Bad Outweighs the Good.
text: I should have known by the trailer that this was going to be a poor follow up to the original film. All the underwater scenes were boring and the film should have been kept to on the water, not below the water. It would have given more opportunity for carnage and Meg mayhem. Then there are so many questions... what happened to the kids mum? It is not explained at all. And speaking of the kid, she is meant to be 14 in this film but acts like a 2 year old with her behaviour at times.Jason Statham did his best with what he was given. I think throwing every other creature at the film did nothing for it. I was disappointed, but not surprised by that.

title: Check your brain at the door and enjoy the ride!
text: Giant sharks, Octopuses, commandos and a jet ski Meg hunting Jason Statham, what more could you ask for? This movie was just what the summer needed. If you liked the first Meg you'll definitely dig this one. Giant sea creature carnage galore. Clifton Collins and Page Kennedy back for more comic relief. Who cares if it makes a lot of sense, it's the Meg! Grab that big bucket of popcorn, put on those 3D glasses, have a drink and enjoy the bone crunching, underwater action.
