Oh yeah, there is no post credit scenes to hang out for. Definitely a fun and mindless summer movie. A great escape from reality.

title: Meg 2: The Trench is campy ... But not in a fun way.
text: I am certain that this film was made for the sole reason of giving the actors and crew a reason to go on location in Phuket, Thailand. I expected the film to be a bit of fun or maybe have some funny moments, but nope ... that didn't happen. My viewing standards have changed over the years so maybe I simply cannot get into these sort of movies any longer. And here's a very strange observation: Anyone in the cast who had a villainous role was a poster-child for bad cosmetic surgery and/or 'roid use. The only character I liked was DJ (Page Kennedy) who is reprising his role from 2018's "The Meg". I liked him because he seemed like the only half-way believable and sane actor in the entire film. And the monsters were cartoonish.

title: Messed up...!!!
text:
Ben Wheatley couldn't withold the sucess of prequel and failed to create the magic on whole...
The first thing that spoiled the whole flick is a baseless plot,illegal smugglers,snappers(lizard like creature)&giant octopus so despite focusing on a brilliant camera work and VFX the plot is pretty messed up leading to cast and crew going clueless whether to save themselves from snappers or giant octopus or the Meg which was supposed to be the highlighted one...
Despite its poor show the flick managed to get around 350 + million dollars which is possible without the help of Asian market for Hollywood. ..
On whole better to skip and a superflop in his list of films for statham.

title: It could have been so much better!
text: Meg 2: The Trench (aKa Shark 2, The Meg 2, Meg 2, and The Trench ) is a 2023 science fiction horror action hybrid film directed by Ben Wheatley (Kill List, Free Fire, High-Rise, Doctor Who, and The ABCs of Death). It's based on the 1999 novel The Trench by Steve Alten. It is s sequel to 2018's The Meg. It was written by Erich Hoeber and Jon Hoeber (The Meg, Transformers: Rise of the Beasts, Red 1/2, Whiteout, My Spy, and Battleship) with Dean Georgaris (Paycheck, The Manchurian Candidate, Bluff City Law, Quantum Leap, and Lara Croft: Tomb Raider 2). It was produced by lead actor Jason Statham (Expend4bles, Fast and Furious presents: Hobbs and Shaw, Viva La Madness, and Operation Fortune). The budget was $139 million and it grossed $395 million worldwide at the box office!!!!Five years after the previous events, Jonas Taylor (played by: Jason Statham from The Expendables franchise, The Transporter franchise, Crank 1/2, Fast and Furious franchise, Mechanic 1/2, Wrath of Man, Death Race, and Snatch) has been involved in fighting environmental crimes while also helping Mana One in exploring a further deep part of the Mariana Trench where the Megalodon had been found. Jonas has been raising teenager Meiying (played by: Shuya Sophia Cai from The Meg and Somewhere only we Know) alongside her uncle Jiuming Zhang (played by: Jing Wu from The Wandering Earth 1/2, Wolf Warrior 1/2, and Ride On), who acquired his father's company alongside financier Hillary Driscoll (played by: Sienna Guillory from Love Actually, Eragon, Resident Evil franchise, and Inkheart). Mana One has also been studying an 80 ft (24 m) female Meg called Haiqi, who was discovered as a pup and trained by Jiuming in a reserve in Hainan. Jonas and Jiuming lead a routine submersible exploration to the Trench, with Meiying stowing away to see the trench for the first time. Fellow Meg survivors DJ (played by: Page Kennedy from The Meg, S. W. A. T, and FML) and Mac (played by: Cliff Curtis from The Meg, Sunshine, Avatar: The Way of Water, Blow, Push, Training Day, and Bringing out the Dead) observe the group from the Mana One. Jonas and his team discover an illegal mining operation in a station captained by the mercenary Montes (played by: Sergio Peris-Mencheta from Resident Evil: Afterlife, Rambo: Last Blood, Snowfall, and Life Itself), who has a vendetta against Jonas for his imprisonment some time before. Montes causes problems with Jonas plus his crew in an explosion to cover up their activities.The crew with the help of fellow Mana One analyst Jess (played by: Skyler Samuels from The Gifted, Scream Queens, and American Horror Story) and security officer Rigas (played by: Melissanthi Mahut from The Other Me, Assassin's Creed games, and The Sandman) discover that the rescue pod has been sabotaged which forces the crew to use exosuits to walk towards the station in the creature-filled trench. As the crew surfaces, they discover the rupture from earlier which leads to several of the creatures, including the three Megs, a swarm of lizard-like creatures known as Snappers and a giant octopus escaping the trench and reaching the surface. The monsters are now out in the public and they are ready to feast. Everyone now must fight for their survival!!!!The Meg 2: The Trench is a little odd, it's basically two different films put together as one. The first half here doesn't really feel like a Meg feature at all but second half is exactly what you would expect from a sequel from the franchise. I know that they changed several things from the original source material for this follow up. I personally didn't mind them taking a different approach for the beginning here. It had a solid set up for all the characters. Action superstar Jason Statham in his element here, this is his bread and butter when it comes to cinema. The Meg 2 brings back several characters from the original which will make fans happy but it also adds multiple new cast members for The Trench. This one definitely got a mixed reaction on it's release but it performed great at the box office so who knows what future this franchise has. The original movie was much better but The Trench was still decent especially the second half which was a blast. They amped up everything at the end here. It's currently streaming on HBO Max so give it a shot!!!!

title: No bite
text: A few years after the first Meg adventure, some of the old characters are back with a few new characters.Jonas Taylor (Jason Stratham) is out saving the ocean from nasty polluters. Then Jonas is called into action to go deep into the ocean. Jonas leads a team deep into a trench on the bottom of the ocean floor. While exploring the trench they find out someone is taking valuable minerals from the ocean. They soon learn they have been double crossed! Every now and then a meg shark is spotted, you kind of wonder is this film about megs or not?.After some close calls Jonas and team end up at a holiday resort island, fighting some baddies that double crossed them. Also the megs come into the film a bit more, with some other nasty creatures from the depths of the ocean.The story telling in Meg 2 is mostly boring. Its not really worth mentioning any of the other characters as they are bland and forgettable. The first Meg was good fun, Meg 2 lumbers along and is cheesy/tacky.

title: "I Saw Ben Wheatley Drinking a Pina-Colada Down at Fun Island...His Movie Was a Mess"
text: A Messy Movie...A Team-Up This Time of so Many Monsters...Why Not?A Sequel to a "Monster Movie" is Going to be (usually) a Messy Movie...A Mess of Fun...A Mess of Dollars to Spend (and Collect)...and No One will for 1-Second Take this for Anything Except for What it is...A MEGA BUDGET Seat-Filler for Fans of the Genre (Monster Movies...Sharks a Sub-Genre) and Newbies Slumming-It...And those "Chinese Investors" are Paying the TAB and Only "Claim to Fame", as Far as Their Contribution to the Art of Film-Making, to the Americans at Least is Kung Fu and John Woo.The Project Gives a Lot of Jobs to People Looking for Jobs...Estimates Run into the Tens of Thousands for a Big-Budget Movie.Everyone will have Fun in the Sun Making this Fast-Food-Film that will be Devoured and Forgotten Before Anyone Noticed or Cared Because there will be Another Fast-Food-Film Opening Next Week and the Munching will Begin All Over Again.So Uppity Film-Critics can Blast this Movie Out of the Water with Their 1-Star...Thumbs -Down Reviews but Does Anyone Notice or Care?After the Release "I Saw Ben Wheatley Drinking a Pina-Colada Down at "Fun Island" (what was left of it),,,His Movie was Still a Mess".Also, a Mess-of-Money to Count and a Lot of Film-Critics to put on a Hit-List...This Time Seated Next to Him was Jason Stratham Raising a Glass.For Monster-Mayhem that Doesn't Make a Lick of Sense and Some Fun in the Sun ( Movie-Theatre or Home,,,Your Choice) the Movie is...Worth a Watch.........(for Film-Snobs it is Recommended...Place Paper-Bag On-Head)

title: First and foremost a comedy
text: If you want a serious action thriller don't watch this. It is first and foremost a comedy.I wanted to love it, and then maybe wanted to dislike it but I landed somewhere in between. It's fundamentally entertaining watchable nonsense.Expect dramatic stunts by Jason S. Plenty of impressive graphics and a ridiculous plot which ignores science and logic in its entirety.But fundamentally it's good fun. Embrace the ambition of the film which appears to be impressive stunts and comedy and you'll get along fine with it. My husband and I giggled and laughed throughout, occasionally picking it apart and poking holes in it but all in good humour.

title: second half is like watching sharknado
text: The firs Meg was fun and easy to watch. Mindless fun. Even though is barely based on the books and the main character of movie Jonas is the completely opposite as the book Jonas the movie was still fun to watch.This second entry started off good(ish). Over the top action with unrealistic stunts. It was like watching any of the latest Fast & Furious crap. The nerdy scientist that Jonas is in the books (yes, there are several of them) is turned into an international man of action a la Mission Impossible style.Still watchable in a way.Bu then at the second half of the movie everything sunk.The lack of bloodshed made the movie lame. The action scenes were flat out dumb. Some scenes had horrible special effects. It was like watching another sharknado movie.I was looking forward to this, but I ended up highly disappointed.

title: Not Sharky Enough
text: I agree a with Jason Statham the film's scaling down in the gore department is a downer.It also lacks the true over the top elements that the original delivers.When you are watching a movie of this ilk you want to forget plot and realism, so take the gloves off and go hard or as they say go home.The effects are solid but not great, which is the same as the plot.So look, its a fun film and Statham delivers as usual but the film is not much more than mediocre.When they eventually make Meg 3 (and I'm sure they will) it needs donosaurs, aliens and Clint Eastwood to really push the envelope :)

title: An absolutely awesome movie!
text: I can exaggerate here, just like when I watched Jurassic Park as a kid, with those majestic prehistoric creatures. But this movie, to be more precise, is like taking a shark and turning it into a Fast and Furious version of Godzilla. I kid you not, the most unbelievable thing about the whole film is that humans actually win. It's practically a masterpiece of human arrogance. Still loving how the director nails those unexpected shots perfectly. The writers really know how to put the massive Megalodon and us puny humans in scenes where the odds are totally against us. Jason Statham's action fits the audience's taste too, even though he's all swagger and bravado when facing these monstrous creatures, giving us some epic showdowns.

title: A Genre-Bending Ben Wheatley Trashterpiece.
text: In Meg 2...the megs seem to be secondary to, well, almost everything else that is going on in the film.It starts out as an environmental espionage thriller/Statham driven action film.Before turning into a sci-fi version of Jurassic Park...only...with space being at the bottom of the ocean, instead of, you know...in space.With the plot revolving around a rogue mining operation, which has been harvesting rare earth minerals from the sea floor, beneath the thermocline.Though, it probably would have been cooler if it were aliens.But I guess that would have been too ironic...considering it evolves into an escape room thriller akin to Alien.That is, if the Xenomorphs were outside of the ship...so as to prevent the trapped crew from escaping.Eventually they do escape, however.And the whole thing resorts to a game of Shark Attack.Only, featuring humans armed with bombs, instead of fish.Before, inevitably, culminating with a kaiju-esque battle.And a (somewhat predictable) feel good ending you (at one point, at least) wish you had in the previous film.Director of this trashterpiece, Ben Wheatley, clearly learned from the mistakes of the original.By keeping the action going right from the beginning, straight through to the end.Removing that dramatic lull from the middle, that made the first installation slog on unnecessarily.Unlike The Meg, Meg 2 manages to keep you fully engaged throughout.With it's hodgepodge of genre-bending characteristics, and non stop action.Cheese factor aside...my only beef with this film is that the transition from the original storyline, to the one featured here, isn't very smooth.With there being an 8-10 year gap; the unexplained loss of a main character; and the uncritical return of an absentee father, formulating the crux of the storyline.And how the main antagonist gets his comeuppance, as well, I guess.I felt that was a bit rushed and lazy.That being said...if you are looking for some high concept, mindless entertainment, that is chock full of bad CGI.Then look no further than this.Because, compared to this year's other giant shark feature- Black Demon- this film is a freaking masterpiece.Just don't go into it expecting actual greatness.4.5 out of 10.

title: It just never ended.
text: This was sadly just awful, it's like if Jurassic Park was done by the Wayans Brothers!!. So many times this pig should have been done, and yet it just kept on going. I sincerely thought it would never end. It had every possible version of a cheesy ending.....plus a few. The acting was beyond mid, almost to the point where I thought it might be more of a 'skinimax' type film, yet that never came to be either. I wish this wasn't meant to be a serious movie, as I think I would have enjoyed it more at a satire type comedy!! All in all, I wouldn't suggest watching this, unless you are doing it ironically or to upset your parents!!

title: Boooooring
text: I went into this movie to just enjoy a bad movie because why not? We all have our guilty pleasures and mine is watching bad good movies. This...was not one of those movies...at all...fell asleep at LEAST 3 times watching the movie. It wasn't until the last 30 minutes where I decided to actually sit up and see the mayhem occur in front of me. But I literally cannot stand anything in this movie just because of how goddamn boring it was from start to almost finished. I enjoyed the Meg 1 and enjoyed it because it was bad good but this was just bad bad and a MAJOR disappointment in my eyes. So sad to see what could've been a good movie be a bad one instead.

title: Poor on poor acting
text: The beyond poor acting in Meying took off 5 stars off my rating. Makes you wonder who gave that actor a spotlight role where she smiles all the dam time. Terrible, had that poor actor not been in the movie it would have been a camp fire type of movie for me but well people get lucky with roles in blockbuster movies; I don't know.Climatic build was good but needed more definition in character build before it to counter the fear of losing the movie to the bad guy ( fish ). Back to the horrid acting in Meying, this movie is all about technology and hopefully one day they will invent something you can erase characters from movies.

title: Dont listen to the wannabe movie critics! Great action movie!
text: I dont normally write reviews but after seeings all of these wannabe movie critics writing serious reviews about a GIANT CGI SHARK movie, I had to put my 2 cents in.The film is superb for what it is, a sequel to a movie about giant sharks coming out of some hidden crack in the ocean floor. The acting is great for an action movie Jason Statham is great as always, the CGI sharks are...believable, there is the constant feeling that something is just about to happen throughout, that is when something isn't actively happening on screen, rarely a dull moment throughoutand the ending gives you a nice warm feeling.P. S. I'm sure the people giving this movie 2 stars were the "really fun at parties" kind of people.

title: Jason Statham's worst movie
text: I am going to get right to the point. This was a pretty bad movie. I decided to give it a second star only because the CGI was stellar. The story was terrible. The acting was a mix between decent actors and b rate actors. The camera angles were silly. There was a lot of mondless action sequencies. Just like the first movie, the parts of this movie that was meant to be funny were silly. It made the movie awkward.The bottom line is, without going into the movie and providing spoilers, I would simply suggest to consider watching something else and not waste time watching this dud of a movie. Regardless how bad it is, I'll bet there will be a Meg 3 that will be just as bad if not worse.

title: Meg 2: Now with less Meg
text:
Most of the movie doesn't have much Meg in it.But it does have forgettable characters, bland writing and quite a few "China good" moments to remind us who funded it
.It doesn't even rate as a good, bad shark movie; which I enjoy. Even with questionable CGI and Statham action scenes that look like they were lifted out of Crank with the slightly oddly paced movement when he is running or on a jetski. It just seemed disjointed and odd.I couldn't manage to make myself care who was in danger, who was killed and who was surviving; largely because everyone was so bland. The one guy seemed to be channeling Jackie Chan a couple times, which was entertaining but it didn't fit with his character at all.

title: Not bad, but not good either
text: I loved The Meg. I watched it and immediately bought a copy. Something about it brings me out of a funk or calms me down. I watched it three times one week because I was having a very bad week. That said, when The Meg: The Trench came out, I bought it without bothering to watch first. This sequel is along the lines of Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey. It's related to the original, has a lot of the same characters, relationships and snappy dialogue. But it just falls flat. The land/sea creatures are a non sequitur, trying to lead your attention away from banal action. They tried to pack too much in without any cohesion. It's not a bad watch, but it's not a great one either.

title: Perhaps the worst movie ever made.
text: There are horrible movies, and then there are really, truly horrible movies. Meg 2 was not the fun romp that The Meg turned out to be. Gone was any hint of acting ability, gone any directorial, writing, or any skill. It's like the crew was adept at being terrible. China produced movies, always seem to have the air of 1982 propaganda attached to them, and this was one took the cake. Showing how any American is a horrible person and should rightfully be eaten by a shark, octopus, or dinosaur. Yes, it had dinosaurs. And I'm not talking about Statham. Watch to see a truly remarkable example of failure.

title: The scriptwriters really phoned this one in
text: The first Meg film was watchable. This was a very lazy follow up. It doesn't feel like the scriptwriters even attempted to create a worthy narrative - perhaps complacent and overly confident that audiences would naturally watch the sequel. The visuals were OK although the megs looked fake. The underwater physics were all wrong - ie lack of crushing pressure at 25000 feet down. Boulders falling underwater without resistance except for one isolated incident. Bad guys just turning up without any rationale. Very formulaic. Was the script written by A. I.? And then not vetted by humans. The director and cast must be embarrassed. They should be.

title: Exactly what you need sometimes (and the audience enjoyed it)
text: I was close to cancel my ticket, because of the bad reviews from critics, I consider trustworthy. Glad I didn't!Meg 2 is dumb fun, if you manage to shut the part of your brain, that deals with logic, down for the movies runtime.But you do that with "The Fast and Furious" franchise, and some other recent flicks, all the time. So why making such a deal of it in this movie?Yes, it has almost nothing to do with the book(s) anymore. Yes, it got especially one scene, that the writers/director could've handled better (I just say diving without suit in those depths).But other then that you get your highly entertaining, fast paced, fun, action/monster movie madness. And in times like this, sometimes you want to switch your brain off and have a good time.And that's exactly what "Meg 2" delivers and what the audience, at the theater I watched it at appreciateted, based on the reactions.If you wanna enjoy some action and fun with some thrills here and there, just give it a try. Just don't expect something Oscar worthy (though who can take the Oscars seriously anyway, nowadays)

title: As ridiculous as the first one
text: I both do and don't get these movies. There's lots of action, thrills and spills. It's a great roller coaster type movie. Movies like this are few and far between these days and the fact it made it onto screen is a blessing.However, as a film, it fails on so many levels. The plot is ridiculous. The science is made up as it goes along and changes to fit whatever the characters need to do in that moment.The cgi is sketchy and looks like it came from a computer game from the 90s.The film meanders along with our protagonists getting into fix after fix that they inevitably get out of. In the end I couldn't care less than I did.

title: Average sequel in which Jason Statham and friends must now face a terrible old enemy for the second time
text: Thrilling film in which a scientific team goes horribly wrong, releasing the deadliest ocean predators that have ever roamed the seas since prehistoric times. Jonas Taylor: Jason Statham continues to dedicate himself to the environmental care of the oceans and collaborates with the Hainan Oceanographic Institute, China. In this place, Haiqui, a female megalodon that the director of the center intends to train, is kept imprisoned. Technological advances are evident, and now the team of marine ecologists can embark towards the unknown depths of the sea, however when the underwater expedition begins, Haiqui escapes. Then a trench and a malevolent mining operation that explodes free extinct vicious carnivorous animals causing bloody events with lots of gory scenes. As the deep-sea scientific team encounter the largest ferocious marine prehistoric predator that has ever existed - the Megalodon and in its own way wreaking havoc. Get ready for the ultimate adrenaline rush this summer in "Meg 2: The Trench" !. Dive into uncharted waters with Jason Statham and global action icon Wu Jing as they lead a daring research team on an exploratory dive into the deepest depths of the ocean! Immerse yourself in the most electrifying cinematic experience of the year with "Meg 2: The Trench" - where the depths of the ocean are matched only by the heights of sheer, unstoppable excitement !. New Meg. Old Chum. Back for seconds. There is always another one. Terror has never run this deep...Fear runs deep.You already know that this movie is about a prehistoric mega-shark rising from the depths and terrorizing the scientists crew. An inferior and literally larger-than-life thrill ride that supersizes the 2018 blockbuster and takes the action to higher heights and even greater depths with multiple massive Megs and so much more. It's a so-so action monster monster movie with a creepy creation of tension , thrills , terror and lots of bloody attacks. The released prehistoric man-eating Megalodon that joins with others of the same species deliver the goods, as the swimmers become their next meal while the scientists must band together to stop themselves from becoming fish food. Here our heroes and heroines pitted against colossal Megs, gigantic octopus, huge toothy monitors and relentless environmental plunderers, our heroes must outrun, outsmart, and outswim their merciless predators in a pulse-pounding race against time. This is a peculiar rip-off to classic Jaws (1975) by Steven Spielberg and Piranha (1978) by Joe Dante, taking parts here and there of these films . Stars Jason Statham giving his ordinary acting as a two-fisted veteran deep-sea rescue diver must confront his fears and risk his own life and the lives of everyone trapped below. If you liked Jason Statham in the first The Meg movie, you will enjoy this follow-up with the iconic actor doing his thing, and facing more monsters than ever. The hunk starring is well accompanied by a fine cast , such as : Jing Wu, Sienna Guillory, Cliff Curtis, Sophia Cai, Page Kennedy, Sergio Peris-Mencheta, Skyler Samuels, Melissanthi Mahut, Whoopie Van Raam, Kiran Sonia Sawar, among others. The motion picture was mediocrely and with no originality directed by Ben Wheatley (The ABCs of Death, Tourists, Rebeca, High Rise, Doctor Who, In the earth, Free fire).The first ¬®Megalodon¬® (2018) by John Turteltaub with Jaon Statham, Bingbing Li, Rainn Wilson, Cliff Curtis, Ruby Rose , Winston Chao, Sophia Cai, Page Kennedy , Darri √ìlafsson, Robert Taylor, Jessica McNamee and Masi Oka has already created a mini-subgenre with imitations and rip-offs about this prehistorical animals , though some of them had been previously made , such as : ¬®Megalodon (2002)¬® by Pat Corbitt with Robin Sachs , Al Sapienza, Mark Sheppard.¬®Shark Attack 3: Megalodon¬® (2002) by David Worth with John Barrowman, Jenny McShane, Ryan Cutrona. ¬®Megalodon¬® (2018) by James Thomas with Michael Madsen , Caroline Harris. ¬®Megalodon Rising¬® (2021) with Tom Sizemore , Wynter Eddins, O'Shay Neal . ¬®Bigfoot vs Megalodon¬® (2021) by BC Fourteen, among others.

title: Ugh
text: Well, first off, shout out to Netflix for putting this movie on so I could watch it for free rather than renting it. Second... Ugh. I knew from the start this would kind of suck. At no point in the film did I change my mind. It's like the crew relied on the massive amounts of CGI to make the movie interesting rather than have good actors and dialogue. It really annoyed me how there were no captions for the non English dialogue. I couldn't understand half of the movie. Everyone was making stupid decisions. And when they came to "fun island" I literally facepalmed so hard I think I left a mark on my face. It's such a cash grab and it seemed very out of place. At least they could have named the island something more realistic. I did not understand the point of including the giant octopus, as if 3 megalodons aren't enough. It reminded me of Sharknado. Just ridiculous and the story isn't compelling at all. I was rooting for the sharks after most of the movie.

title: Fun, at the very end
text: I was excited for this, it looked like an absolute blast from start to finish. So when I saw it, I really enjoyed it! At the very end. Everything else I completely forgot. Meg 2 (should be called Meh 2) delivered at the very end as the film tests your patience with terrible writing, characters we don't care for, and action that while fun, is all shown in the trailers. If you watched the trailers, you saw the entire 3rd act. Granted there's fun moments but instead of making a splash, it took a bite out of me. If your gonna watch a shark movie besides jaws, just watch the shallows or deep blue sea.

title: Below Expectation
text:
Wowwww.... this maybe one of the worst movie I've seen. Sad...so sad...., although the story may be quite good, but how everything executed was total disaster. I know that I could not expect much, but this was way below my expectation. Meg 1 was entertaining, some ridiculous scene here and there were acceptable, but the Meg-2 was not just ridiculous but it just did not entertaining at all. Bad Jokes, bad dialogue, no sense of emotion, the movie seems does not trying to give anything to the audience except just people moving around on the screen... wow... just wooooowwww...
I could not even finish the movie..., I stopped watching this movie somewhere when the story reach the FUN ISLAND.. Not funny, not thrilling, not anything..... Sorry Jason, this is your worse movie ever.....

title: Better than jaws
text: I honestly cannot see how this movie is getting so many bad reviews. It is pure fun and entertaining. Great special effects. Meg 2 dives deeper (pun intended) and has more action and adventure than the first movie. It's like Jurassic park meets jaws meets King Kong meets Godzilla. And it's got a littler bit of everything including science fiction (heavy on the fiction), suspense, drama, and comedy. There is a lot going on all at once, adding to the action and suspense. Just when you think one problem is solved, Jonas and crew have fifty more hurdles to climb. I suggest grabbing a nice big bucket of popcorn, sitting back, and enjoying the ride.

title: Disappointing!
text: I'm Ok with films that aim to be nothing more than escapist nonsense. This is certain one of those. Unfortunately, it didn't do it very well. The cast looked as if it had been recruited by an equal ops personal officer desperate to ensure that it was truly representative, though of course it still had the male macho lead ultimately triumphing over a very large fish. The story was banal in the extreme, the shock/horror content almost non-existent, and the fish not really very scary at all except for a few scenes right towards the end. There just wasn't enough megalodon and too many irrelevant sub-plots adding little or nothing to the narrative. There were lots of in-your-face graphics, but it is really lacked any sense of suspense and build-up to scenes, so became more of an action hero movie.

title: 2 Stars Is Generous
text: The writing is so bad. Nobody speaks the way these characters do. Nobody is such a melodramatic clich√© of a bad guy like the ones here. Bond villains are way more realistic. Even cartoon super villains are not as fake.Speaking of "fake," the computer graphics are way overused, and it is 2006 quality (maybe worse). It seems like every scene is using this garbage CG. Even the diving helmets are CG! Why?! Also, why do the sharks look THIS silly in 2023?The first movie had charm to it; Rainn Wilson added some good comedy, and the characters were a bit more interesting. It's enjoyable as a goofy shark action/horror film. This movie is just boring from start to end. The fact they were able to get Statham may be the reason it's so bad (they blew their budget perhaps).So bad!

title: Flip Side of the Same Coin
text: I went into the first Meg film expecting a big, bad, stupid movie that I could have fun laughing at and came away pleasantly surprised. Yes, The Meg was big and stupid, but I am pretty sure it was not bad. It was good at being stupid, making sure the audience was having fun the whole way. And it was an awesome celebration of the shark movie as a subgenre to boot!The Meg 2 is much harder to love. I went into it with the same expectations I had for the first Meg, and came away incredibly disappointed. First and foremost, nearly everything that happens in this film is entirely inexplicable. Secondly, no, this does not mean the movie is freewheeling and fun, as it still pretends to have a plot and wastes a lot of your time doing so, even when literally nothing adds up. At least the laugh out loud bad dialogue will keep you occupied.Third, and possibly most importantly for your enjoyment of the movie, almost everything that happens in the titular trench is worth fast forwarding. It's dark, hard to see, shaky cam, adr nonsense. Characters die and you will only notice moments later when a shoehorned line of dialogue confirms your suspicion that something just happened. All the creativity that could have been used to create a cool Subnautica inspired setpiece went into... something else instead.The problem with The Meg 2 is that for every moment of goodbad enjoyment it gives you, it makes you trudge through three moments of pain and drudgery. The Meg 2 is a beer that can only make you hung over, but never drunk. Here's hoping The Meg 3 still happens after this lurking pool turd ruined everybody's day.

title: Meg 2: The Trench Jumps the Shark
text: Hey, Streamers! It's August, which is typically the slowest summer month at the box office. Since there isn't much coming out in theaters this month, we have to be pretty generous with those flicks we are willing to let entertain us. I'm not embarrassed to say that I have been looking forward to the sequel to The Meg, which came out it 2018. Let's pretend it's still Shark Week and enjoy the Meg 2: The Trench.Meg 2: The Trench takes place five years after the events of the The Meg. Jonas Taylor (Jason Statham) has been fighting environmental crimes and continuing to be involved in the exploration of the Mariana Trench, where the Megalodons lurk. Taylor has also been involved in raising Meiying (Shuya Sophia Cai), who's mother has passed away in the interim. Meiying's uncle, Jiuming (Jing Wu), has created a super-suit that allows people to travel into the depths of the trench to further explore the creatures below. Throw in some more pre-historic sea dwellers, some nefarious corporate overlords, and environmental jargon, and you've got a sequel to the original giant shark creature-feature. Chum-chomping hijinks ensue.Yes, I was looking forward to the ridiculousness that would be the sequel to The Meg, but I was disappointed by the direction of Meg 2: The Trench. The first hour of this flick is pretty boring. There is a lot of set-up of a new plot focused on environmentalism and corruption, and the Megalodon is only a vague specter in the background. These pre-historic sharks are supposed to be terrorizing the people populating this movie, but it takes too long to get to any of that. Moreover, the characters make very dumb decisions, especially the very annoying, Meiying. Teenagers are typically annoying in these disaster movies, but Meiying takes the cake. Then, the visual effects look bad as well. The underwater scenes are too dark, and the rest of it looks no better than a Sharknado sequel. This movie has to have a bigger budget than Sharknado!?!?!Statham does his best. He has that deadpan, action hero energy that we expect. He's fun despite how dumb most of this movie is. If Statham wasn't in this movie, it would have been a real slog. I'll also shout out Page Kennedy, who plays DJ, an engineer with Jiuming's company, Mana One. Although he's a fairly stereotypical black character in these disaster action movies, Kennedy is very funny. He has some of the best lines and some surprising action acumen. When Kennedy is on screen, you can expect at least a slight chuckle, which is better than the nothing that the rest of the movie is giving.Ultimately, Meg 2: The Trench is not the exciting sequel I was expecting. It has a boring environmentalism plot that isn't really important to the overall film. There is too much delay getting to the Megalodon and the action sequences. The acting and effects are no better than what you'd see in Sharknado. Except for Jason Statham and Page Kennedy, there really isn't much positive here. Am I being to harsh? I don't know. I can only give this one popped kernel and say only watch on streaming if bored.

title: Low-brainier, shark-fuelled, roller coaster
text: As a Summer holidays, fire and forget movie with the kids, Meg 2 delivered predictable entertainment at a pleasing pace. Suspend brain activity, avoid overthinking the marine biology aspects of this flick and settle back for espionage, ecological preservation, sub-aqua disaster and relentless marine terror.Stath delivers indestructibly and the supporting cast provide a great balance of endearing, funny and consumable.Maintains a great pace throughout ,with no flat spots. Felt more enjoyable than the original with a more comedic feel to the action. Some nice nods to the classic shark daddy Jaws and a hint of Jules Verne too.Go see it. Just don't over think it.

title: Kinda stretching it
text: The first Meg movie is actually a decent shark movie, the writing was fair, but as for The Meg 2: The Trench?? What exactly are they doing that Hollywood has done for decades in their movies "a science team makes the discovery of a lifetime and some off-shore, 2-timing, back-stabbing mercs take the real payload to make millions and the cost of lives" change it up Hollywood, the audience want new materials, new storylines, don't just recycle old stories and put barely a twist on them, give us some real stories to treasure, give us new life lessons that don't deal with politics/religion or wealth, give us something to remember and not migraines.

title: Disengage brain and enjoy
text: For me I took the wrong approach to this film for the first 15 minutes and was almost at the point of getting up and leaving when I thought hang on a minute this is just a popcorn film and when you look at it like that it's one hell of a popcorn film. It has Jason Stratham, it has three large sharks, a giant octopus, baddie, goodies and a bunch of references to the proper shark film 'jaws'. (see how many you can count). There is nothing about this film could remotely be factual so don't assess it is so, just sit down immerse yourself in the silly world of prehistoric sharks and enjoy the popcorn.

title: A disappointing sequel
text: This movie is what everybody fears about a sequel. Granted, the first one wasn't a masterpiece, but it was entertaining for a B-movie. "The Trench" tries to expand the universe by adding more elements, which disturb rather than benefit. The film has shifted genre to a more ridiculous shark movie, unfortunately distancing me as a viewer. I wasn't captivated and felt no involvement. There were a lot of setups to involve me as a viewer and make me feel, but they felt out of place in a movie like this.After watching the film, I immediately turned off the TV and went to do laundry - which was more entertaining than the movie.

title: Pretty bad
text: This may be JS worse movie, or close to it. 95% of the movie has nothing to do with sharks, and when it does, it's just so bad. Put this movie on when you're planning on doing something else in the back round. This is BAD, BAD. I only give this two stars because I'm a JS fan, But wow was this bad. It almost seems like they wanted to make it a action, thriller, but they forgot it's about... sharks? The CGI was somewhat decent, but for what it was worth, don't waist your time. The main bad guy (I won't say who) was one of the worst acting I've ever seen. If you want to see the "MEG" skip about you hit 43:30 min left. If not, enjoy the action movie?

title: Where's the adrenaline rush?
text: MEG 2 confirms the truth universally acknowledged that sequels always disappoint. Jason Statham is back with a whole pod (or whatever the collective noun is) of giant prehistoric sharks. There's a subplot involving a rogue mining outfit who are mainly there as shark-bait.The first MEG just about got by on novelty value, despite blatantly rehashing the PIRANHAS franchise, which in its day was a mash-up of the JAWS compendium. The island resort finale in MEG 2 is a rehash too far, seriously stale. Jason, bless, tries to put some meat on the bare-bones script, but this role enhances his pension fund rather than his reputation.Stephen Spielberg's original 1975 JAWS had moments of high tension and shock-horror despite the plasticky-looking shark. There is no adrenaline rush in MEG 2 - and the CGI monsters sometimes look a bit plastic. Victims tend to be swallowed whole, often by the boatload, rather than bitten in half, so even the horror element is diluted.A major disappointment. Correction - a minor disappointment.

title: Maybe Shark
text: Before you watch Meg 2 : The Trench you need to ask yourself one question, do I like giant sharks tearing stuff up? If the answer is yes then this might not be the film for you.The first Meg film was something of a sleeper hit, suggesting people quite like watching giant sharks. The marketing for this film suggests the studio know people quite like giant sharks but they don't seem to have passed that information along to the people actually making the film since, after a brief introduction, the megs (and the cool giant octopus from the trailer) are mostly relagated to final part of the movie.Instead what you get is a series of bland, human focused, action set pieces. There's some dimly lit plodding through the titular trench, like a less good version of 2020's Underwater. Then there's some guys with guns running around a research station like a really crap Die Hard. Even the creature focused final act focuses as much on some dog sized land lizards (evolution has left them with legs despite millions of years confined to life underwater) giving the impression of a lame Jurassic Park.To be fair Jason Statham at least looks like he is having fun, especially when he gets to play around on jetski. He is joined by Wu Jing (basically the Chinese Jason Statgam) who is also enjoying himself despite the limited script. In fact all the cast do pretty well with what they are given.With the previous film taking a large bite out if the Chinese box office, The Trench doubles down on appealing to the same market. In addition to the casting the story is very China friendly, the bad guys are comically evil capitalists and while The Stath gets to kick ass it's teamwork that ultimately wins the day. Some people seem to really hate it when a big movie aims for an audience outside North America but personally I enjoy the slightly different flavour and it certainly is not the main issue here. That remains the lack of OTT fun.The Meg 2 is in on its own joke it just doesn't tell it loud enough.5 paddling puppies out of 10.

title: Poor Storyline and A Lack of Special Effects
text: Poor storyline and a lack of special effects in the movie. If you take Avatar 2 as a base to compare with this, Meg 2 does not even stand a chance.Also, why do you speak Chinese in the movie? Was not necessary. The girl named Meiying was annoying out of me the entire movie.I do not even know what her role was in the movie. Not necessary to add this kid to the movie. What a waste of $6.50 dollars to rent the movie.Dear directors, if you are trying to make prehistoric animal movies, please please spend your time on storyline and special effects. I really want to watch prehistory animal movies but with awesome special effects. We do not mind to wait, but invest your time and your heart in the movie. If you gut tell you, it won't look good, that mean it won't look good to us.

title: So awfully bad that it's watchable just for the fun of it
text: This can be the worst best movie ever. It is so freakishly bad that it is actually fun to watch because it being so ridiculous that your laughing about it.I don't know what they where smoking while coming up with this but it has to be ayausca strong!Jason Statham has done his absolutely best role ever by the fact that he kept a straight face through this awful movie. The fact that he could even film an entire scene without laughing at himself and this ridiculous and awful plot is worth an Oscar.As long as Jason can sleep at night... the absolut best part of the entire movie that got me laughing for 5 min was when Jason was forced to swim on the outside of a underwater base below 7800m, but it was "fine" as long as he didn't have any air in his sinuses... so he swam in open water below 7800m, amazing! Totally amazing.

title: Gradually descended to a trench
text: Meg two is a light hearted shark comedy that should have spent more runtime with the waters. Dragging the story to shores seemed to be a mistake. Emphasis made on child's safety was like the go-to option to get the story going. And man killing prehistoric giant shark single handedly is best suited for a bedtime story. Whatever the limitations the production had the movie could have achieved much more with a little bit more imagination. Acting was alright great special effects to capture the chomps in shark's POV. Dialogues weren't the best but greta audio covered that up well. Meg two is not perfect but not too bad either.

title: Exciting and entertaining!
text: I had a chance to watch the film by the pool invited by CMC. The experience was great! The story is cliche but who cares since it is an big action film with giant monsters. Recommend to go to the theater and see the Shark on big screen!The Chines actor Wujing is handsome and a kungfu master. Lots of great action scene between him and Jason!There is also some funny moments. But the ocean, the trench is amazing. It feels like a Sci-fi thriller, fighting against alien on a different planet once they are in the trench.I will rate 8 for the VFX and overall experience! Storyline is just so so.

title: "I had to save the dog"
text: The Meg is back! Now with more Megs.There's something in the plot about villains mining a resource, stealing advanced technology and more investigation of the Trench,, but it is all quickly set aside for Monstrous creatures and our lead characters running for their lives.Frankly, this movie is SO dumb it stops being fun at one point.Constantly asking myself "but why!?" at most developments and constant unintelligent decisions from almost everyone involved made me want to stop watching. It is a spectacle, though!! And I can see why some might appreciating the last 40 minutes for the nonsense it brings to the screen. But aside from the well made sets and technological apparatuses (and overall look), I don't think I enjoyed anything in particular. The dialogue, action scenes, "jokes", characters and core story all leave a lot to be desired.Even if you like Statham, he doesn't shine as brightly. I do appreciate the scarce tense moments and the "realistic" stakes and constant deaths, but boy did I not like this.

title: Dino Sharks
text: Ten years after their first encounter with a megalodon, the team returns with new leadership and the same goal: exploring the ocean's depths. While on a routine mission to map the depths, they encounter another group in the depths. With conflicting interests, the teams clash, and chaos erupts, allowing the ancient beasts to escape and wreak havoc on the world.This movie is straightforward: a group of humans doing things they should not do and should have learned their lesson the first time. The movie defies many scientific facts. Then again, it is about a dinosaur shark, so it all fits the premise. The movie is worth a stream in the background when looking for something short and does not require a lot of thought.

title: Dumb fun and worth it.
text: Actually enjoyed this one way more than the first one. Mindless dumb fun that doesn't take a lot of brain power to follow and get two hours of entertainment of.CGI is questionable at times, but oddly adds to the overall quality because everything seems to go for the middle of the road -average- on purpose. The story is hardly groundbreaking but does what a standard sequel should do and that is taking what made the first popular and just add more. Statham looked like he was having a fun as well.Just go into it not expecting the next Schindlers List of cinema and you'll have a good time and will make you wonder -just maybe- if there will be an inevitable Meg 3.

title: The sequel delivers the wild fun ride.
text: I enjoyed this film, it was very entertaining, now don't get me wrong, it's silly and over the top, like Fast and the Furious franchise, but if you are willing to suspend disbelief, your probably enjoy it more.Jason Satham I thought he was gonna be bland, but he showed there was more to his character. I also admired the way when it tries to be more than just shark movie. Action scenes are well done, even the scenes with the shark are also good. The other characters don't disappoint either. Like the first one, took everything that made Jaws(1975) famous, and dialed it up a notch. The giant shark is awesome.

title: Just sit back and have fun
text: Did anybody go expecting to see Jaws? It makes you wonder I that bad reviews even saw the first one? It's a fun and entertaining two hours. It's got the camp you expect. The ridiculous one liners we all look back to our childhood and remember fondly.What's not to like? You get three Megs. The dog is back and takes on that Kraken thing to the best of their ability. Lots of annoying folks get devoured. The sheer lunacy of this movie is the reason why it's so funYou get the corporate bad guys, the friend who takes the money to betray others and the possibility of The Meg 3.Can't wait for The Meg 3! See you there chum ü¶à

title: Everything I expected and still enjoyed it
text: Difficult with some modern blockbuster films to know what to exactly expect, I'm not look forward to disappointment from it being a Cashcow.Make two I feel had a good strong story, decent Heroes and some of the original cast from the first film, The Meg. Jason Statham is strong in the lovable rogue hero with his common sense brave attitude, he is very likable still in the role and to certain degree I would like to see a Meg 3.It was disappointing to see some of the original cast not included but the ones that were included a decent strong roles, I do recommend this film. Do you have an open mind that it's a fun, cheesy, action film with a decent plot and story that believable is the first film the meg but you will enjoy.

title: Perspective, please
text: The core premise of this well directed and edited contribution to the archives of cinematic entertainment is that a prehistoric fish terrorises modern man. Possibly a testament to the dangers in the inexhaustible pursuit of mankind's quest to discover and explain the intricacies and splendour of anything and everything open to the inquisition of the nature of materialist manifestation. Or? At approximately 7,000 lbs per square inch pressure in its own environment it would have exploded long, long before surfacing. So, for . . . . 's sake, just enjoy an absolutely fantastic, amazing yarn. It's a hoot.

title: Underwater action + the movie doesn't take itself too seriously üëå
text: I cannot remember if I laughed this much when watching Meg1 on HBO, but watching this one, was time well spent.The primary character are well acted, the tension is high (though I was highly distracted by the girls tiny buns on her head üòÖ) and the humor delightful. As I said, I don't recall how serious the first movie was but it's CLEAR this movie doesn't take itself too seriously and I LOVE THAT.While they could have gone for drama instead to chop up the parts with tension (pun intended) it was nice to get some smiles out of it. Especially Mr Wu Jing delivered comedic relief to perfection. I nearly cried with laughter at some points.All in all, it has both excitement and ginormous sharks plus drizzled with family bonds (especially the one you choose) so I'm kinda baffled as to why this has such a low rating.Minor negatives: the last two stars is taken away due to minor details:

title: A delightful B- movie cheese filled aquatic monster fest.
text: Meg 2: The Trench" is a delightful aquatic monster fest. I don't know what the critics are on about because I got exactly what I expected from this movie and more - giant sharks running amok and Jason Statham doing his thing to stop them. I loved that the sequel totally dialed up the bonkers level by throwing an unhinged aquatic monster blast at us, along with a B-movie James Bond villain plot. Coupled with 3 Megs and Jason Statham, "Meg 2" turned out to be a cheesy but seriously entertaining popcorn crowd-pleaser. If you are looking for logic, look elsewhere. But if you get with the program - which is Statham trying to kick a "Meg" into submission - you will have a complete blast and then some. I sure did!

title: IT'S MEGGIN TIME!!
text: Jason statham holds his breath at the bottom of the ocean because he is BASED and he punches a multi-ton shark in the nose because he is BASED and he rides jet skis and stuff because he is BASED!!!! "This rock is worth over 1 billion dollars" - leaves and it is never mentioned again. Multi minute villain monologue in Korean that I did not understand or have subtitles for, but I got the plot anyways because it is BASED. And then they fight a giant squid because that is BASED. The badguys kill all their own men with explosives because that is BASED. I think there were dinosaurs, but I'm not totally sure- BASED.

title: B movies are EXACTLY THIS. Far Better then The 1st!!!
text: Man i loved it !!! This is the Roadhouse of shark movies in terms of poor acting ridiculous situations an evil sub plot with Cobra type villains who do predictable things and try super hard to convince us theyre role is important. Lmao The shark stuff is awesome!!!!!! I wont give you anymore than that Jason charisma statham give you a patrick swayze type performance. Everyone else is beyond forgetable. The Action is really fun PG-14 for sure. Builds on the ridiculous premise of this jurrasic world hidden but somehow there is a secret... i wont spoil it but it might be worth spoiling because it very absurd.... Anyway IF YOU LIKE CREATURE FEATURES and cult B movies Its for you.

title: AWSOME
text:
Look what I can do!"
"I know I don't listen, but... would you have me any other way...and this makes the story way more predictable"A feel-good exciting cheesey masterpiece of silly and over the top action adventure served with subtle parody satire and surgical wit.A must enjoyable see thrilling parade of reptiles, bad guys and good guys.So much action nonsense goes on but it lands on its feet as a score of 10.Big Shark things with Big teeth, tentacles reaching out like skyscrapers, deep diving to a zone underneath a zone beneath the bottom of the ocean, literally 3 steps below hell,
blown up, torn up, imploding up
All with the bestest of CGI.I got to say,
Jason Statham - is an all out action actor. He's so good and so corny and so good and so corny he's can do no wrong.He cuts the cheese like no other cheese cutter.Just a lovable magnificent performance. He's the Big Cheese that's the glue.Wu King - Kooky serious
Page Kennedy - Jive and relatable
Shuya Sophie Cai - Annoying and irritating teenThe direction by Ben Wheatley is first class.This is a reptile action adventure and He never lets you forget who the star of this film is. The reptiles. It's an all out Mammoth Reptilian Festival.Gnashing their teeth, dragging off their kills, using their brains.The writing team of Jon Hoeber, Erich Hoeber, Dean Georgaris has just enough of truth, backstory, comedy, suspense to not get too much stuck in a heady spin, or weighed down.A One Two punch of quick basic facts and then straight to the reptile-extravaganza.Brilliant move.The second theme is clever too.Finally, it's exciting and good cheese. Did I say foolish fun?You can actually take a break and come back and still have more to see!It's for everybody in the family.Sure it's a B film, but what a Great First Class Cheesey B film it is. You will smile, laugh, cringe, wince all the good things cheesey films make you do. It's just contagious!It's a film you watch over and over again, just because.

title: Laughs and some Horror
text: Meg 2: The Trench: Some critics have it for this film and Wheatley but imho this is a fun SF/Adventure film with touches of horror. Ben Wheatlry puts his own dark stamp on the film, many of the scenes where people are eaten alive are genuinely scary and horrifying rather than just comical for adults anyway.. Plenty of chuckles but the laughter will die in your throat at times. The darkness will likely go over the heads of younger viewers or maybe they'll gleefully enjoy those deaths anyway. All sorts of creatures, not just Mrgs get loose, a giant octopus provides great fun as do lizards which act like Komodo dragons on speed as they chase and devour people. Some great underwater action as well, submersibles battling megs and weaving through rockfalls, also treks in exosuits along the trench bottom fighting the ferocious fishes. Jason Stratham shows how well he can react under pressure. We also get betrayals and a cute little dog. Well worth watching. Directed by Ben Wheatley from a screenplay by Jon Hoeber, Erich Hoeber, and Dean Georgaris. 7.5/10.

title: Such a brilliant sequel much better than the original.
text: For a start the people on here giving low scores must not have seen the same brilliant film that I saw. The idea of mixing ideas from The Abyss, Jurassic Park, Jaws, Moby Dick and Deepstar six was a brilliant move and also the amazing fight scenes. The little dinosaurs that escaped from the trench made it look like Jurassic Park and are a great addition. We even get a giant Octopus like the films from the 1950's. This monster film had everything to keep you on the edge of your seat. The monsters are very well made special effects and looks so real. Jason Statham is a usual an amazing lead character doing what you expect him to do and at one time acting like the captain in Moby Dick when he goes after the Mosasaurs with his explosive harpoons. Ignore the so called critics saying how poor this is just so they can appear cool. Rent it or buy it or see it in the cinema you will not regret it.

title: Good daft fun.
text: To be honest I think if this generation saw jaws they'd say it was rubbish, only reason it was celebrated as a classic was because people still enjoyed movies then, people seem to have lost their sense of fun or go in with ridiculous expectations.The first film was daft, it was fast, fun but ridiculous, the second one goes harder with more ludicrous creatures, scenarios and effects. Is the writing logical or sensible? Not really, would you want it to be? Hell no!Not every film is designed to be a stereotypical masterpiece of cinema, some films luckily are stupid mindless bits of fun where you can escape reality and just laugh.I mean the cinema was packed and film created a nice atmosphere, my 70 year old mom loved it, she was like a child, just chuckling away.There's trailers and YouTube now so people giving this 1/10 either don't look at films before going or are devoid of soul or humour. In classic criteria it's not going to battle Oppenheimer, hell it'll probably lose out to barbie, but I wish people would stop hating on these films if it's not their taste.It always feels condescending and patronising the 1/10s but truthfully I blame the reviewerIf you can't enjoy a movie like this, I feel sorry for you.

title: Not fought in the trenches like WW1
text: This movie is powerfully entertaining and very funny. A must own. A must see only in 3D will have you blocking and ducking. Everything possible is packed in this 2 hours of this heart pounding sequel. You will spill your popcorn and aspirate your Coca Cola. No spoilers here. Jason not only kicked assailants assess but wreak havoc on these beasts. He was not a lone shark he had mega back up. Wonderfully acted. Amazing special effects. Multiple plots. I cried several times. You couldn't ask for more. The true hero here was not Jason. I will not spill the carcasses here. You must go see 3D. Hands down I'm going to see again.

title: In 3D I loved every second of it
text: I saw "Meg 2: The Trench" today and it was a movie experience that I never forget. Not only was the movie terrific fun but I was the only one in the theater. I've been going to the movies for over fifty years and that's never happened before. I've come close a few times but today goes into the record book. As far as the movie goes, "Meg 2: The Trench" is the most fun I've had movies in a long, long time. It a crazy movie. The story and the action are completely insane but I loved it. The "check all the boxes" international cast was distracting for a little while but then every one of them won me over. The cast and the terrific 3D effects made "Meg 2" my favorite movie of 2023 (at least so far). (I saw this movie at the AMC Raceway 10, Westbury, NY)

title: ü¶à üòÇ It Got So Campy that it turned into Hysteria üòÇü¶à
text: 1st Half, it Was So-So, 2nd Half Got So Campy that it turned into Hysteria.Parts I Loved about the Film -1. Did that Villain Guy look like anyone in Particular?2. It Got So Ridiculous (from the Pepper Spray Scene all the way up to the Fun Island Segment) that it was Hysterical to Watch.3. It Got So Campy that it got Laughably Hysterical, I was having a Ball.4. The Slow Motion Helicopter Jump was Hysterically Ridiculous, I was Tearing Up due to Overload of Laughter. üòÇü§£5. The Movements of the Group during Entry and the look on one of the Mercenaries Face. üòÇü§£7. The 2 of them Accidentally running into the hut and The 4 of them in the Hut Scene with the Mercenaries, again more Laughs. üòÇü§£8.
